When she reads travel magazines
questions.explanation: The text states 'Quand elle vole dans l'avion, elle rencontre souvent des gens intéressants' - When she flies in the airplane, she often meets interesting people. 'Vole' (flies) and 'rencontre' (meets) are key present tense forms.

questions.audioText: Fermez la porte et retournez à vos places, s'il vous plaît.
questions.question: Fermez la porte et ______ à vos places, s'il vous plaît.
options: retournez
retournes
retournons
retourne
questions.explanation: The text states 'Fermez la porte et retournez à vos places' - Close the door and return to your seats, please. 'Retournez' is the imperative form for 'vous' (formal/plural), matching 'fermez'.

questions.audioText: Il sauve toujours ses documents avant de fermer l'ordinateur.
questions.question: Il ______ toujours ses documents avant de fermer l'ordinateur.
options: sauve
sauves
sauvons
sauvez
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il sauve toujours ses documents avant de fermer l'ordinateur' - He always saves his documents before closing the computer. 'Sauve' is the third person singular present form of 'sauver'.

questions.audioText: Les touristes que j'ai rencontrés hier sont retournés dans leur pays ce matin.
questions.question: What did the tourists do this morning?
options: They returned to their country
They visited more tourist sites
They extended their vacation plans
They decided to stay permanently
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les touristes que j'ai rencontrés hier sont retournés dans leur pays ce matin' - The tourists I met yesterday returned to their country this morning. 'Rencontrés' (met - past participle plural) and 'retournés' (returned - past participle plural) are key forms.

questions.audioText: Le médecin a sauvé la vie du patient qui était retourné à l'hôpital.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Le médecin a sauvé la vie du patient qui était retourné à l'hôpital.
Le médecin a sauvé la vie du patient qui était retourné à l'école.
Le médecin a soigné la vie du patient qui était retourné à l'hôpital.
Le médecin a sauvé la santé du patient qui était retourné à l'hôpital.
questions.explanation: The exact phrase was 'Le médecin a sauvé la vie du patient qui était retourné à l'hôpital' - The doctor saved the patient's life who had returned to the hospital. This tests listening precision for medical vocabulary and past participles.

questions.audioText: L'argent que j'avais économisé pendant des mois a été volé dans ma voiture.
questions.question: L'argent que j'avais économisé pendant des mois a été ______ dans ma voiture.
options: volé
vendu
donné
perdu
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'argent que j'avais économisé pendant des mois a été volé dans ma voiture' - The money I had saved for months was stolen from my car. 'Volé' is the past participle of 'voler' (to steal) in passive voice.

questions.audioText: La montre qui m'a été volée était un cadeau de ma grand-mère.
questions.question: What was stolen from the speaker?
options: A watch that was a gift from grandmother
A ring from the jewelry store
A necklace bought last year
A bracelet from a friend
questions.explanation: The text states 'La montre qui m'a été volée était un cadeau de ma grand-mère' - The watch that was stolen from me was a gift from my grandmother. 'Volée' is the feminine past participle of 'voler' (to steal), agreeing with 'montre'.

questions.audioText: Les oiseaux volent très haut dans le ciel bleu aujourd'hui.
questions.question: Les oiseaux ______ très haut dans le ciel bleu aujourd'hui.
options: volent
vole
volez
volons
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les oiseaux volent très haut dans le ciel bleu aujourd'hui' - The birds fly very high in the blue sky today. 'Volent' is the third person plural present form of 'voler' (to fly), agreeing with 'oiseaux'.

questions.audioText: Tous les enfants ont été sauvés après l'accident du bus scolaire.
questions.question: What happened to all the children after the school bus accident?
options: They were all saved
They were all injured
They were all hospitalized
They were all scared
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tous les enfants ont été sauvés après l'accident du bus scolaire' - All the children were saved after the school bus accident. 'Sauvés' is the masculine plural past participle of 'sauver' (to save).

questions.audioText: Ma voiture est retournée au garage après la réparation.
questions.question: Ma voiture est ______ au garage après la réparation.
options: retournée
retourné
retournés
retournées
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ma voiture est retournée au garage après la réparation' - My car returned to the garage after the repair. 'Retournée' is the feminine past participle of 'retourner' (to return), agreeing with 'voiture'.

questions.audioText: Tu fermes la porte ou tu la laisses ouverte ?
questions.question: Tu ______ la porte ou tu la laisses ouverte ?
options: fermes
ferme
fermez
fermons
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu fermes la porte ou tu la laisses ouverte ?' - Do you close the door or leave it open? 'Fermes' is the second person singular present form of 'fermer' (to close), agreeing with 'tu'.

questions.audioText: Je retournerai en France l'année prochaine pour voir ma famille.
questions.question: Je ______ en France l'année prochaine pour voir ma famille.
options: retournerai
retourne
retournais
retourné
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je retournerai en France l'année prochaine pour voir ma famille' - I will return to France next year to see my family. 'Retournerai' is the first person singular future form of 'retourner' (to return).

questions.audioText: Les documents importants qui ont été volés contenaient des informations confidentielles.
questions.question: What did the stolen documents contain?
options: Confidential information
Public announcements
Personal photos
Shopping lists
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les documents importants qui ont été volés contenaient des informations confidentielles' - The important documents that were stolen contained confidential information. 'Volés' is the masculine plural past participle of 'voler' (to steal).

questions.audioText: Tu rencontres souvent des problèmes avec ton ordinateur ?
questions.question: Tu ______ souvent des problèmes avec ton ordinateur ?
options: rencontres
rencontre
rencontrez
rencontrons
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu rencontres souvent des problèmes avec ton ordinateur ?' - Do you often encounter problems with your computer? 'Rencontres' is the second person singular present form of 'rencontrer' (to encounter/meet), agreeing with 'tu'.

questions.audioText: Le soldat qui a été sauvé donne maintenant l'exemple à tous ses camarades avec sa foi.
questions.question: What does the saved soldier do now?
options: He sets an example for his comrades with his faith
He teaches military strategy to new recruits
He writes reports about his experience
He requests a transfer to another unit
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le soldat qui a été sauvé donne maintenant l'exemple à tous ses camarades avec sa foi' - The soldier who was saved now sets an example for all his comrades with his faith. This combines 'soldat' (soldier), 'sauvé' (saved), 'exemple' (example), and 'foi' (faith).

questions.audioText: Tu rencontres souvent des soldats qui respectent sévèrement la loi dans cet exemple précis ?
questions.question: Tu ______ souvent des soldats qui respectent sévèrement la loi dans cet exemple précis ?
options: rencontres
rencontre
rencontrez
rencontrons
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu rencontres souvent des soldats qui respectent sévèrement la loi dans cet exemple précis ?' - Do you often meet soldiers who strictly respect the law in this specific example? This combines 'rencontres' (meet-2nd person), 'soldats' (soldiers), 'sévèrement' (strictly), 'loi' (law), and 'exemple' (example).

questions.audioText: Je retournerai certainement voir ce soldat qui défend posément la loi avec une foi exemplaire.
questions.question: Je ______ certainement voir ce soldat qui défend posément la loi avec une foi exemplaire.
options: retournerai
retourne
retournais
retourné
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je retournerai certainement voir ce soldat qui défend posément la loi avec une foi exemplaire' - I will certainly return to see this soldier who calmly defends the law with exemplary faith. This combines 'retournerai' (will return), 'soldat' (soldier), 'posément' (calmly), 'loi' (law), and 'foi' (faith).

questions.audioText: Ces documents de loi qui ont été volés contenaient des exemples habilement rédigés.
questions.question: What did the stolen law documents contain?
options: Skillfully written examples
Simple legal definitions
Historical court cases
Basic government procedures
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces documents de loi qui ont été volés contenaient des exemples habilement rédigés' - These law documents that were stolen contained skillfully written examples. This combines 'loi' (law), 'volés' (stolen), 'exemples' (examples), and 'habilement' (skillfully).

questions.audioText: L'exemple que donnent ces soldats sauvés inspire automatiquement une foi profonde en la loi.
questions.question: What does the example of the saved soldiers inspire?
options: Deep faith in the law automatically
Fear of military discipline
Doubt about government policies
Confusion about legal procedures
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'exemple que donnent ces soldats sauvés inspire automatiquement une foi profonde en la loi' - The example that these saved soldiers give automatically inspires deep faith in the law. This combines 'exemple' (example), 'soldats' (soldiers), 'sauvés' (saved), 'automatiquement' (automatically), 'foi' (faith), and 'loi' (law).

questions.audioText: Il faut partir illico pour ce rendez-vous britannique important.
questions.question: When do they need to leave for the British appointment?
options: Right away
In an hour
Tomorrow morning
Next week
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut partir illico pour ce rendez-vous britannique important' - We must leave right away for this important British appointment. 'Illico' means immediately or right away. This combines 'illico' (right away), 'rendez-vous' (appointment), and 'britannique' (British).

questions.audioText: Cette publicité controversée sur la lune et les rêves a créé beaucoup de discussions dans les médias.
questions.question: What did the controversial advertisement create?
options: Confusion among customers
Many discussions in the media
Legal problems for the company
Increased sales immediately
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette publicité controversée sur la lune et les rêves a créé beaucoup de discussions dans les médias' - This controversial advertisement about the moon and dreams created many discussions in the media. This targets under-represented topics 'moon' and 'advertising'.

questions.audioText: Les soldats outre-mer valaient beaucoup pour cette parole anglaise.
questions.question: What did the overseas soldiers value highly?
options: This English word
Their military training
Local traditions
Foreign currency
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les soldats outre-mer valaient beaucoup pour cette parole anglaise' - The overseas soldiers valued this English word highly. 'Valaient' is the imperfect form of 'valoir' (to be worth) agreeing with plural 'soldats', and 'parole' means 'word'.

questions.audioText: Cette aveugle américaine semble affreusement coupable dessous les larmes.
questions.question: Cette aveugle américaine ______ affreusement coupable dessous les larmes.
options: semble
semblez
sembles
semblent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette aveugle américaine semble affreusement coupable dessous les larmes' - This blind American woman seems terribly guilty beneath the tears. 'Semble' is the correct 3rd person singular form of 'sembler' (to seem) for 'cette aveugle américaine'.

questions.audioText: Il vaudrait mieux partir illico pour éviter cette chaleur malheureuse descendue dessous.
questions.question: What would be better to avoid the unfortunate heat that has descended below?
options: Leave right away
Stay inside
Drink more water
Close the windows
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il vaudrait mieux partir illico pour éviter cette chaleur malheureuse descendue dessous' - It would be better to leave right away to avoid this unfortunate heat that has descended below. This combines 'vaudrait' (would be worth), 'illico' (right away), 'chaleur' (heat, feminine), 'malheureuse' (unfortunate, feminine), 'descendue' (descended, feminine agreement), and 'dessous' (below).

questions.audioText: J'ai un rendez-vous important chez le médecin demain matin.
questions.question: What does the speaker have tomorrow morning?
options: An important appointment
A medical exam
A work meeting
A family visit
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai un rendez-vous important chez le médecin demain matin' - I have an important appointment at the doctor's tomorrow morning. 'Rendez-vous' means appointment or meeting, commonly used for scheduled visits with professionals.

questions.audioText: Il tient toujours sa parole quand il fait une promesse.
questions.question: What does he always do when he makes a promise?
options: Keeps his word
Forgets quickly
Asks for help
Changes his mind
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il tient toujours sa parole quand il fait une promesse' - He always keeps his word when he makes a promise. 'Tenir sa parole' is an idiomatic expression meaning to keep one's word or honor one's commitments.

questions.audioText: La chaleur de l'été devient vraiment insupportable cette année.
questions.question: What is becoming unbearable this year?
options: The summer heat
The winter cold
The spring rain
The autumn wind
questions.explanation: The text states 'La chaleur de l'été devient vraiment insupportable cette année' - The summer heat is becoming really unbearable this year. 'Chaleur' means heat or warmth, often used to describe weather conditions.

questions.audioText: Il veut simplement passer du temps avec ses amis ce week-end.
questions.question: Il veut ______ passer du temps avec ses amis ce week-end.
options: simplement
absolument
difficilement
rarement
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il veut simplement passer du temps avec ses amis ce week-end' - He simply wants to spend time with his friends this weekend. The adverb 'simplement' means 'simply' or 'just', indicating his desire is straightforward and uncomplicated.

questions.audioText: Regarde là, il y a un nouveau café.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Regarde là, il y a un nouveau café.
Regarde ça, il y a un nouveau café.
Regarde donc, il y a un nouveau café.
Regarde ici, il y a un nouveau café.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Regarde là, il y a un nouveau café.' - Look there, there's a new café. The speaker used 'là' (there) to direct attention to a specific location where there's a new café. The other options use different demonstrative words: 'ça' (that), 'donc' (so/then), or 'ici' (here).

questions.audioText: Les enfants se cachent derrière les arbres pendant le jeu.
questions.question: Les enfants se cachent ______ les arbres pendant le jeu.
options: derrière
devant
sous
sur
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les enfants se cachent derrière les arbres pendant le jeu' - The children hide behind the trees during the game. The preposition 'derrière' means 'behind', indicating location.

questions.audioText: Tu arrives justement au bon moment pour nous aider.
questions.question: What does the speaker mean about the timing?
options: The person arrived at exactly the right time
The person arrived too early
The person arrived too late
The person arrived at an inconvenient time
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu arrives justement au bon moment pour nous aider' - You arrive at exactly the right time to help us. The adverb 'justement' means 'precisely', 'exactly', or 'just right'. The speaker is expressing that the person's arrival timing is perfect.

questions.audioText: Tu es évidemment le meilleur candidat pour ce poste important.
questions.question: How does the speaker feel about the candidate's suitability for the position?
options: Completely certain they are the best choice
Somewhat unsure about their qualifications
Neutral about their candidacy
Doubtful about their abilities
questions.explanation: The adverb 'évidemment' means 'obviously' or 'clearly'. The speaker expresses complete certainty and confidence that this person is obviously the best candidate for the important position, showing no doubt whatsoever.

questions.audioText: Les étudiants ont manifesté devant l'université pour soutenir leur professeur licencié après ses critiques du gouvernement.
questions.question: Why did the students demonstrate in front of the university?
options: To support their professor who was fired after criticizing the government
To protest against high university fees
To demand better facilities and resources
To celebrate their graduation ceremony
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les étudiants ont manifesté devant l'université pour soutenir leur professeur licencié après ses critiques du gouvernement' - The students demonstrated in front of the university to support their professor who was fired after his criticisms of the government. The verb 'soutenir' means to support or back someone.

questions.audioText: Les étudiants soutiennent leur professeur qui a perdu son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Les étudiants soutiennent leur professeur qui a perdu son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.
Les étudiants critiquent leur professeur qui a perdu son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.
Les étudiants soutiennent leur professeur qui a trouvé son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.
Les étudiants soutiennent leur directeur qui a perdu son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Les étudiants soutiennent leur professeur qui a perdu son travail à cause de ses opinions politiques.' - The students support their professor who lost his job because of his political opinions.

questions.audioText: Si tu n'aimes pas cette méthode, nous pouvons procéder autrement pour résoudre le problème.
questions.question: What does the speaker suggest about solving the problem?
options: They can proceed differently to solve the problem
They should abandon the problem completely
They must stick to the current method only
They need more time to think about it
questions.explanation: The text states 'Si tu n'aimes pas cette méthode, nous pouvons procéder autrement pour résoudre le problème.' - If you don't like this method, we can proceed differently to solve the problem. The speaker uses 'autrement' meaning 'differently' or 'otherwise'.

questions.audioText: Il y a eu un gros orage cette nuit, mais heureusement notre vol n'a pas été annulé.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Il y a eu un gros orage cette nuit, mais heureusement notre vol n'a pas été annulé.
Il y a eu un gros orage cette nuit, mais malheureusement notre vol n'a pas été annulé.
Il y a eu un gros orage cette nuit, mais heureusement notre vol a été annulé.
Il y a eu un petit orage cette nuit, mais heureusement notre vol n'a pas été annulé.
questions.explanation: The speaker used 'heureusement' (fortunately/luckily) to express relief that despite the big storm last night, their flight was not cancelled. The other options change key words: 'malheureusement' (unfortunately), 'a été annulé' (was cancelled), or 'petit orage' (small storm).

questions.audioText: Le directeur est tantôt très exigeant, tantôt très compréhensif selon les circonstances.
questions.audioTemplate: Le {authority_figure} est tantôt très {trait_demanding}, tantôt très {trait_understanding} selon les {context}.

options: directeur
chef
patron
responsable
exigeant
strict
sévère
rigoureux
compréhensif
bienveillant
indulgent
tolérant
circonstances
situations
contextes
cas

questions.question: What does the speaker say about the authority figure?
options: He alternates between being very demanding and very understanding depending on circumstances
He is always very demanding in all circumstances
He is consistently understanding with everyone
He changes his mind too often without reason
questions.explanation: The construction 'tantôt... tantôt...' means 'sometimes... sometimes...' or 'alternately... alternately...'. It shows that the authority figure's behavior varies depending on the situation - sometimes very demanding, sometimes very understanding. All template variations maintain this core meaning with different vocabulary for workplace roles and personality traits.

questions.audioText: Il ne sort guère de chez lui depuis son accident de voiture.
questions.question: Il ne sort ______ de chez lui depuis son accident de voiture.
options: guère
jamais
souvent
toujours
questions.explanation: The adverb 'guère' means 'hardly' or 'scarcely' and is always used with 'ne' (ne... guère). It indicates that he hardly ever leaves his house since his car accident - almost never, but not completely never like 'jamais' would mean.

questions.audioText: Elle travaille tant que sa santé commence à en souffrir.
questions.question: What does the speaker say about her work situation?
options: She works so much that her health is starting to suffer from it
She works only when her health allows it
She stopped working because of health problems
She works very little to protect her health
questions.explanation: The construction 'tant que' here means 'so much that' (expressing consequence). She works so much that it's starting to affect her health negatively. 'Tant' emphasizes the excessive amount of work.

questions.audioText: Apparemment, la réunion a été reportée à demain sans nous prévenir.
questions.question: What does the speaker suggest about the meeting postponement?
options: It seems the meeting was postponed to tomorrow without notifying them
They confirmed the meeting was officially postponed to tomorrow
They personally decided to postpone the meeting to tomorrow
The meeting will definitely happen tomorrow as planned
questions.explanation: 'Apparemment' means 'apparently' or 'seemingly', indicating the speaker has learned this information indirectly or is making an assumption based on available evidence. They weren't directly informed about the postponement.

questions.audioText: Les prix ont légèrement augmenté ce mois-ci, mais rien de dramatique.
questions.question: Les prix ont ______ augmenté ce mois-ci, mais rien de dramatique.
options: légèrement
énormément
brutalement
rapidement
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les prix ont légèrement augmenté ce mois-ci, mais rien de dramatique' - Prices have slightly increased this month, but nothing dramatic. 'Légèrement' means slightly or lightly, indicating a modest increase that contrasts with 'rien de dramatique' (nothing dramatic).

questions.audioText: Nous avons longuement réfléchi avant de prendre cette décision importante.
questions.question: Nous avons ______ réfléchi avant de prendre cette décision importante.
options: longuement
rapidement
mal
peu
questions.explanation: 'Longuement' means 'at length' or 'for a long time'. It indicates they spent considerable time thinking before making this important decision. The adverb emphasizes the thoroughness and duration of their reflection process.

questions.audioText: Tu devrais sérieusement considérer cette opportunité professionnelle.
questions.question: What type of advice is the speaker giving?
options: They strongly recommend seriously considering the professional opportunity
They suggest casually thinking about the professional opportunity
They advise rejecting the professional opportunity immediately
They recommend waiting before considering the professional opportunity
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu devrais sérieusement considérer cette opportunité professionnelle' - You should seriously consider this professional opportunity. 'Sérieusement' means 'seriously' and emphasizes the importance of the advice. The speaker is strongly recommending that the person give serious, thoughtful consideration to this professional opportunity rather than dismissing it lightly.

questions.audioText: Il a échoué à l'examen, pourtant il avait beaucoup étudié pour se préparer.
questions.question: What is surprising about his exam failure?
options: He had studied a lot to prepare for it
He didn't study at all for the exam
He was expecting to fail the exam
He took the wrong exam by mistake
questions.explanation: 'Pourtant' means 'however' or 'yet' and introduces a contrast. Despite having studied a lot to prepare, he still failed the exam - this contradiction makes the failure surprising.

questions.audioText: Ce film était tellement ennuyeux que j'ai failli m'endormir au cinéma.
questions.question: Ce film était ______ ennuyeux que j'ai failli m'endormir au cinéma.
options: tellement
un peu
assez
moyennement
questions.explanation: 'Tellement' means 'so much' or 'so' and expresses intensity. The construction 'tellement... que' (so... that) shows the extreme degree of boredom that almost caused sleep. The other options are too weak for this intense consequence.

questions.audioText: C'est justement ce que je voulais vous dire lors de notre prochaine réunion.
questions.question: What does the speaker mean by using 'justement'?
options: That's exactly what they wanted to discuss at the next meeting
That's approximately what they wanted to discuss at the next meeting
That's probably what they wanted to discuss at the next meeting
That's unfortunately what they wanted to discuss at the next meeting
questions.explanation: The text states 'C'est justement ce que je voulais vous dire lors de notre prochaine réunion' - That's exactly what I wanted to tell you during our next meeting. 'Justement' means 'exactly', 'precisely', or 'as it happens'. It emphasizes that this topic is precisely what they had planned to bring up in the upcoming meeting - perfect timing or coincidence.

questions.audioText: Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
questions.question: What did the speaker order at the restaurant?
options: A pizza with chorizo and peppers
A Cardini salad with crispy chicken, parmesan, croutons, and caesar sauce
A sandwich with smoked salmon and cucumber
A dessert with honey and nuts
questions.explanation: The speaker ordered 'une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar' - a Cardini salad with crispy chicken, parmesan, croutons, and caesar sauce.

questions.audioText: Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Norvégienne avec du saumon fumé et des crevettes.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Déclic avec du chorizo et des poivrons.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.' - At the restaurant, I ordered a Cardini salad with crispy chicken, parmesan, croutons, and caesar sauce.

questions.audioText: Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons.
questions.question: What did the speaker have for lunch?
options: A Bergère salad with breaded goat cheese and bacon bits
A Croque Monsieur with fries and salad
A Norvégienne salad with smoked salmon and shrimp
A Fromagère dish with camembert and honey
questions.explanation: The speaker had 'une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons' - a Bergère salad with breaded goat cheese and bacon bits for lunch.

questions.audioText: Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons.
Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant et du parmesan.
Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Déclic avec du chorizo et des noisettes.
Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris un Croque Monsieur avec des frites et de la salade.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Pour le déjeuner, j'ai pris une salade Bergère avec du chèvre pané et des lardons.' - For lunch, I had a Bergère salad with breaded goat cheese and bacon bits.

questions.audioText: Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une poêlée de seiche avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux.
questions.question: What did the speaker eat last night?
options: A pan-fried cuttlefish dish with ginger, mild chili, and garlic parsley sauce
A grilled steak with mustard sauce
Duck breast skewers with a side salad
A chicken dish with a fragrant mustard sauce
questions.explanation: The text states 'Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une poêlée de seiche avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux' - Last night, I tasted a pan-fried cuttlefish dish with ginger, mild chili, and garlic parsley sauce, a really tasty dish. 'Dégusté' means tasted/enjoyed, 'seiche' is cuttlefish, and 'savoureux' means tasty/flavorful.

questions.audioText: Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une poêlée de seiche avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une poêlée de seiche avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux.
Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une bavette d'aloyau avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux.
Hier soir, j'ai dégusté des brochettes de magret de canard avec une sauce spéciale, un plat vraiment savoureux.
Hier soir, j'ai dégusté un émincé de poulet à la moutarde parfumée, un plat vraiment savoureux.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Hier soir, j'ai dégusté une poêlée de seiche avec du gingembre, du piment doux et de la persillade, un plat vraiment savoureux.' - Last night, I enjoyed a pan-fried cuttlefish dish with ginger, mild chili, and garlic parsley sauce, a really tasty dish.

questions.audioText: Vous comptez partir en vacances cet été ?
questions.question: What is the speaker asking about?
options: Summer vacation plans
Work schedule changes
Holiday booking costs
Weekend travel ideas
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous comptez partir en vacances cet été ?' - Are you planning to go on vacation this summer? The verb 'comptez' (2nd person plural of 'compter') means 'are planning' or 'intend to' in this context.

questions.audioText: Ce petit budget suffira pour le projet de rénovation de l'appartement.
questions.question: What does the speaker think about the budget?
options: It will be sufficient for the renovation
It needs to be increased immediately
It's too complicated to understand
It should be used for something else
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce petit budget suffira pour le projet de rénovation de l'appartement' - This small budget will be sufficient for the apartment renovation project. The verb 'suffira' is the future tense of 'suffire' (to be sufficient).

questions.audioText: Ces vieux tableaux ne valent pas grand-chose maintenant.
questions.question: Ces vieux tableaux ne ______ pas grand-chose maintenant.
options: valent
vaux
vaut
valuent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces vieux tableaux ne valent pas grand-chose maintenant' - These old paintings aren't worth much now. The correct form is 'valent' (3rd person plural of 'valoir'). Note: 'vaux' exists but only for 1st/2nd person singular.

questions.audioText: Il semblerait que la réunion soit reportée à la semaine prochaine.
questions.question: What does the speaker suggest about the meeting?
options: It seems to be postponed to next week
It will definitely happen this week
It has been cancelled permanently
It needs more participants to attend
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il semblerait que la réunion soit reportée à la semaine prochaine' - It would seem that the meeting is postponed to next week. The conditional 'semblerait' expresses uncertainty or politeness when suggesting something.

questions.audioText: Ces bijoux anciens valent beaucoup d'argent.
questions.question: Ces bijoux anciens ______ beaucoup d'argent.
options: valent
vaut
valuent
valoir
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces bijoux anciens valent beaucoup d'argent' - These antique jewels are worth a lot of money. The correct form is 'valent' (3rd person plural of 'valoir') to agree with the plural subject 'ces bijoux'.

questions.audioText: Mes amis comptent venir à la fête samedi.
questions.question: Mes amis ______ venir à la fête samedi.
options: comptent
comptez
compte
comptes
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes amis comptent venir à la fête samedi' - My friends are planning to come to the party on Saturday. The correct form is 'comptent' (3rd person plural of 'compter') to agree with the plural subject 'mes amis'.

questions.audioText: Les fidèles entraient silencieusement dans l'église ancienne pour la cérémonie de mariage traditionnelle du dimanche.
questions.question: Where did the faithful enter silently for the traditional Sunday wedding ceremony?
options: Into the ancient church
The beautifully decorated reception hall nearby
The historic town square for outdoor celebrations
The family garden with flowers and natural beauty
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les fidèles entraient silencieusement dans l'église ancienne pour la cérémonie de mariage traditionnelle du dimanche.' - The faithful entered the ancient church silently for the traditional Sunday wedding ceremony. 'Église' means church, 'entraient' means were entering, and 'silencieusement' means silently.
questions.source: Strategic noun coverage development - religious wedding ceremonies

questions.audioText: Nous commencerons la construction du nouveau pont l'année prochaine.
questions.question: When will the bridge construction begin?
options: Next year
This month
Last week
In two years
questions.explanation: The text states 'Nous commencerons la construction du nouveau pont l'année prochaine' - We will start the construction of the new bridge next year. The verb 'commencerons' is the future tense of 'commencer' (1st person plural).

questions.audioText: Il faut que le lieutenant réponde rapidement aux questions du capitaine.
questions.question: What does the lieutenant need to do?
options: Answer the captain's questions quickly
Report to the general immediately
Complete the training exercise
Organize the military equipment
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que le lieutenant réponde rapidement aux questions du capitaine' - The lieutenant must answer the captain's questions quickly. The verb 'réponde' is the subjunctive form of 'répondre' used after 'il faut que'.

questions.audioText: Mon frère s'est marié avec une femme allemande l'été dernier.
questions.question: What happened to the speaker's brother last summer?
options: He married a German woman
He moved to Germany for work
He learned German language
He visited German relatives
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon frère s'est marié avec une femme allemande l'été dernier' - My brother married a German woman last summer. The past participle 'marié' is used with 'se marier' (to get married), and 'allemande' means German (feminine).

questions.audioText: Tu embrasses aveuglément cette nouvelle toile artistique sans comprendre sa véritable signification culturelle.
questions.question: How does the person approach this new artwork?
options: You blindly embrace this new artistic canvas without understanding its true cultural significance
You carefully study the artwork before making any judgment
You immediately reject the artwork without looking at it
You understand the cultural meaning perfectly from the start
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu embrasses aveuglément cette nouvelle toile artistique sans comprendre sa véritable signification culturelle' - You blindly embrace this new artistic canvas without understanding its true cultural significance. 'Embrasses' is second person singular present of 'embrasser' (to embrace), with missing adverb 'aveuglément' (blindly) and noun 'toile' (canvas).

questions.audioText: Je continuerai à porter ce style cool même si mes parents n'aiment pas.
questions.question: What will the speaker continue doing despite parental disapproval?
options: Wearing the cool style
Buying expensive clothes
Going out with friends
Listening to loud music
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je continuerai à porter ce style cool même si mes parents n'aiment pas' - I will continue to wear this cool style even if my parents don't like it. The verb 'continuerai' is the future tense of 'continuer', and 'cool' means trendy/fashionable.

questions.audioText: L'histoire se souviendra de ce célèbre discours politique pour toujours.
questions.question: What will be remembered forever?
options: The famous political speech
The election campaign results
The parliamentary debates
The government reforms
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'histoire se souviendra de ce célèbre discours politique pour toujours' - History will remember this famous political speech forever. The verb 'souviendra' is the future of 'se souvenir' (to remember), and 'célèbre' means famous.

questions.audioText: Je ne manquerai jamais une occasion digne de mon attention professionnelle.
questions.question: What won't the speaker miss?
options: Opportunities worthy of professional attention
Important family gatherings
Social events with colleagues
Training sessions at work
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je ne manquerai jamais une occasion digne de mon attention professionnelle' - I will never miss an opportunity worthy of my professional attention. The verb 'manquerai' is the future of 'manquer' (to miss), and 'digne' means worthy.

questions.audioText: Un traitement égal pour tous les patients sauvera notre système de santé.
questions.question: What will save the healthcare system?
options: Equal treatment for all patients
More hospital beds available
Better medical equipment
Higher salaries for doctors
questions.explanation: The text states 'Un traitement égal pour tous les patients sauvera notre système de santé' - Equal treatment for all patients will save our healthcare system. The verb 'sauvera' is the future of 'sauver' (to save), and 'égal' means equal.

questions.audioText: Vous vous inquiétez pour cette coupure sur votre lèvre ?
questions.question: What is the person worried about?
options: A cut on their lip
A dental appointment
A facial bruise
A skin infection
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous vous inquiétez pour cette coupure sur votre lèvre ?' - Are you worried about that cut on your lip? The verb 'inquiétez' (2nd person plural of 's'inquiéter') means 'are worried', and 'lèvre' means lip.

questions.audioText: À propos de cette réunion, vous posez trop de questions difficiles.
questions.question: What does the speaker think about the questions?
options: They are too difficult
They are very relevant
They are poorly timed
They are too simple
questions.explanation: The text states 'À propos de cette réunion, vous posez trop de questions difficiles' - Regarding this meeting, you ask too many difficult questions. The phrase 'à propos de' means 'regarding/about', and 'posez' (2nd person plural of 'poser') means 'you ask'.

questions.audioText: Le sculpteur maria cette forme parfaite avec des matériaux nobles.
questions.question: What did the sculptor do?
options: Combined perfect form with noble materials
Created a statue for a wedding
Designed jewelry for a bride
Built a monument for couples
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le sculpteur maria cette forme parfaite avec des matériaux nobles' - The sculptor combined this perfect form with noble materials. The verb 'maria' (past simple of 'marier') means 'combined/married', and 'forme' means form or shape.

questions.audioText: Tu t'inquiètes pour ton frère qui rejoint l'armée demain ?
questions.question: Tu t'______ pour ton frère qui rejoint l'armée demain ?
options: inquiètes
inquiète
inquiétez
inquiètent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu t'inquiètes pour ton frère qui rejoint l'armée demain ?' - Are you worried about your brother who's joining the army tomorrow? The correct form is 'inquiètes' (2nd person singular of 's'inquiéter'), and 'armée' means army.

questions.audioText: Tu voles vers la capitale pour rencontrer le président ?
questions.question: Tu ______ vers la capitale pour rencontrer le président ?
options: voles
vol
volez
volent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu voles vers la capitale pour rencontrer le président ?' - Are you flying to the capital to meet the president? The correct form is 'voles' (2nd person singular of 'voler'), and 'président' means president.

questions.audioText: Cette odeur de parfum suffirait à masquer l'odeur de cuisine.
questions.question: What would be sufficient to mask the cooking smell?
options: This perfume smell
Opening the windows
Using an air freshener
Cleaning the kitchen
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette odeur de parfum suffirait à masquer l'odeur de cuisine' - This perfume smell would be sufficient to mask the cooking smell. The verb 'suffirait' is the conditional of 'suffire' (to be sufficient), and 'odeur' means smell.

questions.audioText: Le morceau de papier volait dans le vent comme un oiseau.
questions.question: How was the piece of paper moving?
options: Flying in the wind like a bird
Falling slowly to the ground
Sticking to the window
Floating on the water
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le morceau de papier volait dans le vent comme un oiseau' - The piece of paper was flying in the wind like a bird. The verb 'volait' is the imperfect of 'voler' (to fly), and 'papier' means paper.

questions.audioText: Seigneur, qu'est-ce que je foutais dans cette situation bizarre ?
questions.question: What is the speaker expressing?
options: Confusion about being in a strange situation
Anger about a religious ceremony
Excitement about a new opportunity
Satisfaction with current circumstances
questions.explanation: The text states 'Seigneur, qu'est-ce que je foutais dans cette situation bizarre ?' - Lord, what was I doing in this weird situation? The exclamation 'Seigneur' means 'Lord' (expressing surprise), and 'foutais' (imperfect of 'foutre') is informal for 'was doing'.

questions.audioText: Il regardait pensivement cet enfer urbain depuis sa fenêtre.
questions.question: How was he looking at the urban scene?
options: Thoughtfully
Angrily
Quickly
Fearfully
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il regardait pensivement cet enfer urbain depuis sa fenêtre' - He was thoughtfully looking at this urban hell from his window. The adverb 'pensivement' means thoughtfully/pensively, and 'enfer' means hell.

questions.audioText: Sa conscience était intimement liée à ses valeurs morales profondes.
questions.question: How was his conscience connected to his moral values?
options: Intimately linked
Completely separated
Occasionally related
Barely connected
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa conscience était intimement liée à ses valeurs morales profondes' - His conscience was intimately linked to his deep moral values. The adverb 'intimement' means intimately/closely, and 'conscience' means conscience.

questions.audioText: Ce poids sur ses épaules l'oppressait perpétuellement depuis des mois.
questions.question: How long has this weight been oppressing him?
options: Perpetually for months
Only during work hours
Just on weekends
Occasionally in the evening
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce poids sur ses épaules l'oppressait perpétuellement depuis des mois' - This weight on his shoulders had been oppressing him perpetually for months. The adverb 'perpétuellement' means perpetually/constantly, and 'poids' means weight.

questions.audioText: Vous vérifiez toujours l'état de votre cerveau avant de prendre des décisions importantes dans la vie.
questions.question: Vous ______ toujours l'état de votre cerveau avant de prendre des décisions importantes.
questions.explanation: The correct word is 'vérifiez' (verify/check) - the formal 'vous' form of 'vérifier'. The complete text is 'Vous vérifiez toujours l'état de votre cerveau avant de prendre des décisions importantes dans la vie' - You always check the state of your brain before making important decisions in life. This includes the missing noun 'cerveau' (brain).

questions.audioText: Cette bande de jeunes ignorait ostensiblement les règles du parc.
questions.question: How did the group of young people ignore the park rules?
options: Ostentatiously
Accidentally
Secretly
Reluctantly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette bande de jeunes ignorait ostensiblement les règles du parc' - This group of young people was ostentatiously ignoring the park rules. The adverb 'ostensiblement' means ostentatiously/conspicuously, and 'bande' means group/gang.

questions.audioText: Son souffle court indiquait a priori un problème de santé.
questions.question: What did his short breath indicate?
options: Presumably a health problem
Definitely good fitness
Certainly normal breathing
Obviously recent exercise
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son souffle court indiquait a priori un problème de santé' - His short breath presumably indicated a health problem. The phrase 'a priori' means presumably/at first sight, and 'souffle' means breath.

questions.audioText: Le capitaine du navire se sentait coupable d'avoir échoué près de cette côte.
questions.question: How did the ship's captain feel?
options: Guilty about running aground near the coast
Happy about reaching the shore safely
Proud of his navigation skills
Excited about the new destination
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le capitaine du navire se sentait coupable d'avoir échoué près de cette côte' - The ship's captain felt guilty about having run aground near this coast. The adjective 'coupable' means guilty, and 'côte' means coast.

questions.audioText: D'abord, nous devons analyser le problème, puis proposer des solutions concrètes.
questions.question: D'abord, nous devons analyser le problème, puis proposer des solutions concrètes.
options: Analyze the problem
Propose concrete solutions
Discuss with colleagues
Implement immediate changes
questions.explanation: The text states 'D'abord, nous devons analyser le problème, puis proposer des solutions concrètes' - First, we must analyze the problem, then propose concrete solutions. 'D'abord' means 'first' or 'firstly' and indicates the initial step in a sequence. The distractors test confusion about the order of operations.

questions.audioText: Ce rapport riche en données révèle précisément les causes de la crise financière.
questions.question: Ce rapport riche en données révèle précisément les causes de la crise financière.
options: Precisely the causes of the financial crisis
General trends in the global economy
Potential solutions for future problems
Historical patterns of market behavior
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce rapport riche en données révèle précisément les causes de la crise financière' - This data-rich report precisely reveals the causes of the financial crisis. 'Riche' means rich/abundant, and 'précisément' means precisely or exactly. The distractors test confusion about what the report reveals.

questions.audioText: Il fait froid au-dehors, restez à l'intérieur.
questions.question: Il fait froid au-dehors, restez à l'intérieur.
options: Inside the house
Outside
In the basement
In the bedroom
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il fait froid au-dehors, restez à l'intérieur' - It is cold outside, stay inside. 'Au-dehors' means 'outside' or 'outdoors'. The distractors test confusion about the location of the cold.

questions.audioText: Selon l'annonce officielle, chercher un nouveau boulot deviendrait plus facile avec la nouvelle plateforme numérique.
questions.question: What would become easier according to the official announcement?
options: Looking for a new job with the new digital platform
Finding affordable housing in the city center area
Applying for government benefits through online services
Registering for university courses during enrollment period
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Looking for a new job with the new digital platform'. The text states 'Selon l'annonce officielle, chercher un nouveau boulot deviendrait plus facile avec la nouvelle plateforme numérique' - According to the official announcement, looking for a new job would become easier with the new digital platform. 'Deviendrait' is the conditional form of 'devenir' (to become), and 'boulot' is informal for 'job'. The distractors test confusion about what would become easier.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - job platform announcement context

questions.audioText: Le vieux sage s'assoit au sommet de la montagne, contemplant le lever du soleil et réfléchissant à la stabilité du monde.
questions.question: Le vieux sage s'assoit au sommet de la montagne, contemplant le lever du soleil et réfléchissant à la stabilité du monde.
options: Au sommet de la montagne
Dans un fauteuil confortable
Au bord de la mer
Dans une grotte sombre
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le vieux sage s'assoit au sommet de la montagne' - The old wise man sits at the top of the mountain. 'Assoit' is the third person singular present tense of 'asseoir' (to sit). This question touches upon the under-represented topic of 'stability'. The distractors test confusion about where the wise man is sitting.

questions.audioText: Ce nouveau pont vaudra des millions d'euros à construire.
questions.question: What will the new bridge cost?
options: Millions of euros to build
Thousands of euros to repair
Nothing to maintain
Very little to design
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce nouveau pont vaudra des millions d'euros à construire' - This new bridge will cost millions of euros to build. The verb 'vaudra' is the future tense of 'valoir' (to cost/be worth), and 'pont' means bridge.

questions.audioText: Les magasins fermés frustraient cette foule de touristes affamés.
questions.question: What was frustrating the crowd of hungry tourists?
options: The closed stores
The expensive prices
The long waiting lines
The bad weather
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les magasins fermés frustraient cette foule de touristes affamés' - The closed stores were frustrating this crowd of hungry tourists. The past participle 'fermés' (closed) agrees with 'magasins', and 'foule' means crowd.

questions.audioText: Son désir d'aventure lui a valu de nombreuses expériences enrichissantes.
questions.question: What has his desire for adventure brought him?
options: Many enriching experiences
Serious financial problems
Constant family conflicts
Major health issues
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son désir d'aventure lui a valu de nombreuses expériences enrichissantes' - His desire for adventure has brought him many enriching experiences. The past participle 'valu' (brought/earned) is used with 'avoir', and 'désir' means desire.

questions.audioText: Cet homme au volant avait tort de conduire si vite.
questions.question: What was wrong with the man's driving?
options: He was wrong to drive so fast
He was right to be cautious
He was correct to speed up
He was wise to slow down
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet homme au volant avait tort de conduire si vite' - This man at the wheel was wrong to drive so fast. The expression 'avoir tort' means 'to be wrong', 'volant' means steering wheel, and 'tort' means wrong/fault.

questions.audioText: Ces problèmes de souffle m'inquiètent beaucoup depuis quelques semaines.
questions.question: What worries the speaker?
options: Breathing problems for several weeks
Heart issues since yesterday
Stomach pain for months
Headaches since morning
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces problèmes de souffle m'inquiètent beaucoup depuis quelques semaines' - These breathing problems have been worrying me a lot for several weeks. The verb 'inquiètent' (3rd person plural of 'inquiéter') means 'worry', and 'souffle' means breath.

questions.audioText: Ce chat aveugle buvait son lait avec difficulté tous les matins.
questions.question: How did the blind cat drink its milk?
options: With difficulty every morning
Easily throughout the day
Quickly during lunch
Slowly in the evening
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce chat aveugle buvait son lait avec difficulté tous les matins' - This blind cat drank its milk with difficulty every morning. The adjective 'aveugle' means blind, and 'lait' means milk.

questions.audioText: Tu maries élégamment cette douleur à la poitrine avec ton stress quotidien.
questions.question: What is the person combining elegantly?
options: Chest pain with daily stress
Exercise routine with diet
Work schedule with relaxation
Medical treatment with therapy
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu maries élégamment cette douleur à la poitrine avec ton stress quotidien' - You elegantly combine this chest pain with your daily stress. The verb 'maries' (2nd person singular of 'marier') means 'combine/marry', and 'poitrine' means chest.

questions.audioText: Sa volonté d'apprendre l'allemand impressionnait tous ses professeurs européens.
questions.question: What impressed all his European teachers?
options: His willingness to learn German
His ability to speak French
His knowledge of history
His talent for mathematics
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa volonté d'apprendre l'allemand impressionnait tous ses professeurs européens' - His willingness to learn German impressed all his European teachers. The noun 'volonté' means willingness/will, and 'allemand' means German.

questions.audioText: Cet affreux destin l'attendait depuis sa naissance malheureuse.
questions.question: What had been waiting for him since his unfortunate birth?
options: This terrible fate
A wonderful opportunity
A happy family life
A successful career
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet affreux destin l'attendait depuis sa naissance malheureuse' - This terrible fate had been waiting for him since his unfortunate birth. The adjective 'affreux' means terrible/awful, and 'destin' means fate/destiny.

questions.audioText: Cette herbe verte créait un paysage charmant pour leur pique-nique romantique.
questions.question: What did the green grass create?
options: A charming landscape for their romantic picnic
A perfect place for playing sports
An ideal spot for building houses
A suitable area for parking cars
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette herbe verte créait un paysage charmant pour leur pique-nique romantique' - This green grass created a charming landscape for their romantic picnic. The adjective 'charmant' means charming, and 'herbe' means grass.

questions.audioText: Je m'inquiétais constamment pour cette douleur persistante dans ma gorge.
questions.question: Je m'______ constamment pour cette douleur persistante dans ma gorge.
options: inquiétais
inquiète
inquiétez
inquiètent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je m'inquiétais constamment pour cette douleur persistante dans ma gorge' - I was constantly worrying about this persistent pain in my throat. The correct form is 'inquiétais' (1st person singular imperfect of 's'inquiéter'), and 'gorge' means throat.

questions.audioText: Il trouvait grand-peine à rassembler les preuves nécessaires pour son dossier complexe.
questions.question: How was he finding the necessary evidence?
options: With great difficulty
Very easily
Quite quickly
Without any problem
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il trouvait grand-peine à rassembler les preuves nécessaires pour son dossier complexe' - He was finding it very difficult to gather the necessary evidence for his complex file. The expression 'grand-peine' means 'with great difficulty', and 'preuves' means evidence/proof.

questions.audioText: Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade César avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet grillé, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du fromage, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Au restaurant, j'ai commandé une salade Cardini avec du poulet croustillant, du parmesan, des croutôns et de la sauce caesar' - At the restaurant, I ordered a Cardini salad with crispy chicken, parmesan, croutons, and caesar sauce. The distractors test precise listening for 'Cardini' vs 'César', 'croustillant' vs 'grillé', and 'parmesan' vs 'fromage'.

questions.audioText: Un agent des routes de 24 ans a été victime d'un accident alors qu'il portait assistance à un véhicule en panne dans l'Eure.
questions.question: Un agent des routes de 24 ans a été victime d'un accident alors qu'il portait assistance à un véhicule en panne dans l'Eure.
options: He was helping repair a broken vehicle in Eure
He was involved in an accident while assisting a broken-down vehicle
He caused an accident while working on the roads
He was directing traffic around a vehicle breakdown
questions.explanation: The text states 'Un agent des routes de 24 ans a été victime d'un accident alors qu'il portait assistance à un véhicule en panne dans l'Eure' - A 24-year-old road worker was the victim of an accident while assisting a broken-down vehicle in Eure. The distractors test confusion about the role of the agent in the accident.

questions.audioText: La réunion passerait au prochain moment disponible si nous avions plus de participants.
questions.question: La réunion passerait au prochain moment disponible si nous avions plus de participants.
options: To the previous available time
To the next available time
To next week definitely
To the same time tomorrow
questions.explanation: The text states 'La réunion passerait au prochain moment disponible' - The meeting would move to the next available time. The conditional 'passerait' expresses a hypothetical action, 'prochain' means next, and 'moment' refers to a time slot. The distractors test confusion about the new meeting time.

questions.audioText: Vous devriez sauvegarder vos données plus souvent pour éviter de les perdre.
questions.question: Vous devriez sauvegarder vos données plus souvent pour éviter de les perdre.
options: You should back up your data more often to avoid losing it
You should delete old data to free up space
You should share your data with colleagues
You should encrypt your data for security
questions.explanation: The sentence says 'Vous devriez sauvegarder vos données plus souvent pour éviter de les perdre' - You should back up your data more often to avoid losing it. 'Devriez' is the conditional form expressing advice. The distractors test confusion about the advice given.

questions.audioText: Le flic nous a arrêtés pour un contrôle de routine sur l'autoroute.
questions.question: Le flic nous a arrêtés pour un contrôle de routine sur l'autoroute.
options: A police officer
A traffic guard
A security agent
A toll worker
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le flic nous a arrêtés pour un contrôle de routine sur l'autoroute' - The cop stopped us for a routine check on the highway. 'Flic' is an informal term for police officer, commonly used in everyday French. The distractors test confusion about who stopped them.

questions.audioText: Cette machine fermées depuis des heures nous pose un vrai problème en production, c'est un enfer total.
questions.question: What is the main issue described in the text?
options: The production machine has been broken for hours causing major problems
The workers have been locked out of the factory building
The production schedule has been delayed by several hours
The machine operators need additional training to work efficiently
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette machine fermées depuis des heures nous pose un vrai problème en production, c'est un enfer total' - This machine closed for hours is causing us a real production problem, it's total hell. The speaker describes a production crisis where a machine closure is creating major operational difficulties.

questions.audioText: Le médecin honnête m'a dit que cette douleur dans la poitrine nécessite des examens urgents.
questions.question: What did the honest doctor recommend?
options: Urgent tests are needed for the chest pain
The chest pain will go away with rest
Surgery is required immediately
The pain is not serious and can be ignored
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le médecin honnête m'a dit que cette douleur dans la poitrine nécessite des examens urgents' - The honest doctor told me that this chest pain requires urgent tests. The doctor is recommending immediate medical examination.

questions.audioText: Le chirurgien inquiétait ses patients en expliquant que réparer la chair endommagée prendrait plusieurs mois de soins intensifs.
questions.question: What did the surgeon explain to the patients?
options: Repairing the damaged flesh would require several months of intensive care
The surgery would be completed in a few hours
The damaged tissue could not be repaired at all
Only minor treatment would be needed for recovery
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le chirurgien inquiétait ses patients en expliquant que réparer la chair endommagée prendrait plusieurs mois de soins intensifs' - The surgeon worried his patients by explaining that repairing the damaged flesh would take several months of intensive care. The surgeon was explaining the extensive recovery process required.

questions.audioText: La foule aveugle posait des problèmes de mesure - impossible de compter avec précision dans cette masse.
questions.question: What measurement problem is described?
options: It was impossible to count accurately in the chaotic crowd
The crowd was too small to measure properly
The measuring equipment was broken in the crowd
The crowd was moving too fast to take measurements
questions.explanation: The text states 'La foule aveugle posait des problèmes de mesure - impossible de compter avec précision dans cette masse' - The blind crowd posed measurement problems - impossible to count accurately in this mass. The chaotic nature of the crowd made accurate counting impossible.

questions.audioText: Au revoir ! À bientôt pour notre prochain projet de travail ensemble.
questions.question: Au revoir ! À bientôt pour notre prochain projet de travail ensemble.
options: See you soon for our next work project together
Good luck with your next work project alone
Let's cancel our next work project completely
We'll discuss our next work project later
questions.explanation: The text states 'Au revoir ! À bientôt pour notre prochain projet de travail ensemble' - Goodbye! See you soon for our next work project together. 'Revoir' means to see again (in 'au revoir' = goodbye), and 'ensemble' means together. The distractors test confusion about the future of the project.

questions.audioText: Ce pesticide tue les insectes nuisibles mais préserve les abeilles.
questions.question: Ce pesticide tue les insectes nuisibles mais préserve les abeilles.
options: It kills them.
It repels them.
It attracts them.
It transforms them.
questions.explanation: The French sentence uses 'tue' - the present form of 'tuer' (to kill) for il/elle. 'Ce pesticide tue' means 'this pesticide kills'. The sentence describes a selective pesticide that kills harmful insects but preserves bees. The distractors test confusion about the effect of the pesticide.

questions.audioText: L'infirmière garde attentivement les patients malades dans l'hôpital moderne pour assurer leur guérison rapide.
questions.question: Où l'infirmière garde-t-elle attentivement les patients malades ?
options: In the modern hospital
At specialized rehabilitation centers for long-term care
In private medical clinics with advanced equipment
During home visits for elderly patients' comfort
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'infirmière garde attentivement les patients malades dans l'hôpital moderne pour assurer leur guérison rapide.' - The nurse carefully watches over the sick patients in the modern hospital to ensure their quick recovery. 'Hôpital' means hospital, 'garde' is the third person singular of 'garder' (to watch/keep), and 'attentivement' means carefully.
questions.source: Strategic noun coverage development - hospital care and nursing

questions.audioText: Mes nouveaux voisins sont vraiment sympas. Ils tiennent toujours la porte et proposent leur aide quand ils voient que j'ai les bras chargés. C'est un geste de courtoisie simple mais appréciable.
questions.question: What do the neighbors do to be helpful?
options: They play loud music
They ignore the speaker
They hold the door and offer help
They ask for favors
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes nouveaux voisins sont vraiment sympas. Ils tiennent toujours la porte et proposent leur aide quand ils voient que j'ai les bras chargés. C'est un geste de courtoisie simple mais appréciable' - My new neighbors are really nice. They always hold the door and offer help when they see I have my arms full. It's a simple but appreciated gesture of courtesy.

questions.audioText: Son talent artistique tombera horriblement si elle ne pratique pas régulièrement son instrument de musique.
questions.question: What will happen to her artistic talent if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly?
options: It will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly
It will improve dramatically with dedicated daily practice sessions
It will remain stable regardless of her practice frequency
It will develop in unexpected directions with creative exploration
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'It will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly'. The text states 'Son talent artistique tombera horriblement si elle ne pratique pas régulièrement son instrument de musique' - Her artistic talent will fall horribly if she doesn't practice her musical instrument regularly. 'Tombera' is the future form of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'horriblement' means 'horribly'. The distractors test confusion about the consequence of not practicing.

questions.audioText: Seigneur, qu'est-ce que je foutais dans cette situation bizarre ?
questions.question: Seigneur, qu'est-ce que je foutais dans cette situation bizarre ?
options: Confusion about being in a strange situation
Anger about a religious ceremony
Excitement about a new opportunity
Satisfaction with current circumstances
questions.explanation: The text states 'Seigneur, qu'est-ce que je foutais dans cette situation bizarre ?' - Lord, what was I doing in this weird situation? The exclamation 'Seigneur' means 'Lord' (expressing surprise), and 'foutais' (imperfect of 'foutre') is informal for 'was doing'. The distractors test confusion about the speaker's emotion.

questions.audioText: Un épisode venteux et pluvieux impressionnant, les pompiers ont reçu un très grand nombre d'appels.
questions.question: Un épisode venteux et pluvieux impressionnant, les pompiers ont reçu un très grand nombre d'appels.
options: The firefighters received a very large number of calls.
The firefighters closed all the roads.
The firefighters organized a parade.
The firefighters went on strike.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Un épisode venteux et pluvieux impressionnant, les pompiers ont reçu un très grand nombre d'appels' - An impressive windy and rainy episode, the firefighters received a very large number of calls. The distractors test confusion about the firefighters' actions.

questions.audioText: Nous avons suffisamment de temps pour finir le projet.
questions.question: Nous avons suffisamment de temps pour finir le projet.
options: Yes, they have enough time.
No, they don't have enough time.
They have too much time.
They need more time.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Nous avons suffisamment de temps pour finir le projet' - We have enough time to finish the project. The adverb 'suffisamment' means sufficiently/enough, indicating they have adequate time. The distractors test confusion about the amount of time available.

questions.audioText: Vous servez toujours ce café pur avec professionnalisme dans ce restaurant
questions.question: Vous servez toujours ce café pur avec professionnalisme dans ce restaurant
options: With professionalism
Very quickly
Without enthusiasm
Quite carelessly
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'With professionalism'. The text states 'Vous servez toujours ce café pur avec professionnalisme dans ce restaurant' - You always serve this pure coffee with professionalism in this restaurant. 'Servez' is the second person plural of 'servir' (to serve).
questions.source: Strategic conjugate targeting: servez + pur + professionalism

questions.audioText: J'ai senti une amélioration dans l'atmosphère de l'équipe depuis le nouveau manager.
questions.question: J'ai senti une amélioration dans l'atmosphère de l'équipe depuis le nouveau manager.
options: An improvement in the team atmosphere since the new manager
A decline in team morale under new leadership
No change in team dynamics despite management changes
Increased tension between team members recently
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai senti une amélioration dans l'atmosphère de l'équipe depuis le nouveau manager' - I have felt/sensed an improvement in the team atmosphere since the new manager. 'Senti' is the past participle of 'sentir' (to feel/sense). The distractors test confusion about the change in atmosphere.

questions.audioText: En parlant de voyage, nous devrions organiser nos prochaines vacances.
questions.question: En parlant de voyage, nous devrions organiser nos prochaines vacances.
options: They should organize their next vacation
They should cancel their next vacation
They should postpone their next vacation
They should change their vacation destination
questions.explanation: The speaker said 'En parlant de voyage, nous devrions organiser nos prochaines vacances' - Speaking of travel, we should organize our next vacation. 'Parlant' is the present participle of 'parler' (to speak/talk), used in the expression 'en parlant de' (speaking of). The distractors test confusion about the suggestion.

questions.audioText: Je tirerai des conclusions importantes de cette vue d'ensemble sur les expositions d'art contemporain.
questions.question: What will I draw from this overview of contemporary art exhibitions?
options: Important conclusions
Inspiration for personal artistic projects and creations
Contacts with influential gallery owners and curators
Knowledge about current market trends and pricing
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Important conclusions'. The text states 'Je tirerai des conclusions importantes de cette vue d'ensemble sur les expositions d'art contemporain' - I will draw important conclusions from this overview of contemporary art exhibitions. 'Tirerai' is the future form of 'tirer' (to draw/pull), and 'vue' means 'view/sight'. The distractors test confusion about what will be drawn from the overview.

questions.audioText: Il a ce truc bizarre dans l'esprit qui l'empêche de se concentrer toute la journée.
questions.question: Il a ce truc bizarre dans l'esprit qui l'empêche de se concentrer toute la journée.
options: This weird thing in his mind that bothers him all day
The noise from construction work outside
His phone constantly ringing with calls
The uncomfortable temperature in the room
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a ce truc bizarre dans l'esprit qui l'empêche de se concentrer toute la journée' - He has this weird thing in his mind that prevents him from concentrating all day. This targets the nouns 'truc', 'esprit', and 'journée' in a mental focus context. The distractors test confusion about the source of the distraction.
questions.source: Strategic noun targeting: truc, esprit, journée

questions.audioText: Les habitants vivaient au bout de la forêt verte, totalement isolés de la ville polluée.
questions.question: How were the inhabitants related to the polluted city?
options: Partially connected to it
Totally isolated from it
Right next to it
Occasionally visiting it
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les habitants vivaient au bout de la forêt verte, totalement isolés de la ville polluée' - The inhabitants lived at the edge of the green forest, totally isolated from the polluted city. 'Vivaient' is imperfect tense, 'bout' means end/edge, 'verte' means green, and 'totalement' means totally. The distractors test confusion about the inhabitants' relationship with the city.

questions.audioText: Les étudiants attendent vivement les résultats de leurs examens finaux demain.
questions.question: Les étudiants attendent vivement les résultats de leurs examens finaux demain.
options: They are eagerly awaiting them
They are nervously avoiding them
They are calmly preparing for them
They are reluctantly expecting them
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les étudiants attendent vivement les résultats de leurs examens finaux demain' - The students are eagerly awaiting their final exam results tomorrow. 'Vivement' means eagerly, keenly, or with great enthusiasm.

questions.audioText: Tu payez joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti.
questions.question: Tu payez joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti.
options: Tu paies joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti
Tu payez joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti
Tu payées joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti
Tu payés joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu paies joyeusement le capitaine pour ce bonheur instinctivement ressenti' - You joyfully pay the captain for this happiness instinctively felt. 'Tu paies' is the correct present tense form of 'payer' (to pay). 'Capitaine' means captain and 'bonheur' means happiness. The distractors test confusion about the correct verb form.
questions.source: Strategic targeting: capitaine + bonheur + payez → paies + joyeusement + instinctivement

questions.audioText: L'ingénieur sensible a bougé le capteur de trois millimètres pour améliorer la mesure de température.
questions.question: How much did the engineer move the sensor?
options: Three millimeters to improve the temperature measurement
Five centimeters to fix the calibration error
One meter to avoid interference from nearby equipment
Half an inch to align with the new specifications
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'ingénieur sensible a bougé le capteur de trois millimètres pour améliorer la mesure de température' - The sensitive engineer moved the sensor three millimeters to improve the temperature measurement. 'Bougé' is the past participle of 'bouger' (to move).

questions.audioText: Le technicien aveugle se foute complètement de réparer cette machine sauvage qui pose tant de problèmes techniques.
questions.question: What is the blind technician's attitude toward repairing the problematic machine?
options: He doesn't care at all about fixing it
He is very enthusiastic about the repair challenge
He is carefully planning the repair strategy
He is seeking help from more experienced colleagues
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le technicien aveugle se foute complètement de réparer cette machine sauvage qui pose tant de problèmes techniques' - The blind technician doesn't care at all about repairing this wild machine that causes so many technical problems. 'Se foute de' is a colloquial expression meaning 'doesn't give a damn about'.

questions.audioText: L'agent immobilier honnête posera ses documents sur la table lors de notre rendez-vous pour visiter l'appartement extrême.
questions.question: When will the real estate agent place the documents on the table?
options: During our appointment to visit the extreme apartment
Before the building inspection takes place
After signing the rental agreement
When the previous tenants move out completely
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'agent immobilier honnête posera ses documents sur la table lors de notre rendez-vous pour visiter l'appartement extrême' - The honest real estate agent will place his documents on the table during our appointment to visit the extreme apartment. 'Posera' is the future tense of 'poser'.

questions.audioText: Demain j'apporterai ma tablette graphique au bureau car mon métier d'artiste numérique demande cet équipement spécialisé.
questions.question: Why will the speaker bring their graphics tablet to the office tomorrow?
options: Because their digital artist job requires this specialized equipment
Because they want to show it to their colleagues
Because they need to repair it during lunch break
Because they forgot to bring it home yesterday
questions.explanation: The text states 'Demain j'apporterai ma tablette graphique au bureau car mon métier d'artiste numérique demande cet équipement spécialisé' - Tomorrow I will bring my graphics tablet to the office because my digital artist job requires this specialized equipment. 'Apporterai' is the future tense first person singular of 'apporter'.

questions.audioText: Ces designers urbains marient de façon évidente les styles moderne et traditionnel dans leur nouvel espace commercial downtown.
questions.question: How do these urban designers combine different styles?
options: They obviously blend modern and traditional styles in their new commercial space
They carefully separate contemporary and classical elements
They exclusively use vintage materials and techniques
They focus only on minimalist and industrial designs
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces designers urbains marient de façon évidente les styles moderne et traditionnel dans leur nouvel espace commercial downtown' - These urban designers obviously blend modern and traditional styles in their new commercial space downtown. 'Marient' means 'marry/combine' (third person plural of 'marier').

questions.audioText: Chaque soir, la télé nous apportait des nouvelles fascinantes sur l'exploration de la lune par les astronautes.
questions.question: What did television bring every evening?
options: Fascinating news about astronauts exploring the moon
Entertainment programs about science fiction movies
Educational documentaries about space technology
Live coverage of rocket launches from the space center
