questions.question: Son explication était si ______ qu'elle a corrigé toutes ses réponses fausses immédiatement.
options: claire
longue
difficile
rapide
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son explication était si claire qu'elle a corrigé toutes ses réponses fausses immédiatement' - His explanation was so clear that she corrected all her false answers immediately. 'Claire' (clear) contrasts with 'fausses' (false), showing how clarity helped fix errors.

questions.audioText: Pourquoi demandez-vous toujours des explications supplémentaires pendant les réunions?
questions.question: Pourquoi ______ toujours des explications supplémentaires pendant les réunions?
options: demandez-vous
demandez
demander
demandons
questions.explanation: The text contains 'Pourquoi demandez-vous toujours des explications supplémentaires pendant les réunions?' - Why do you always ask for additional explanations during meetings? 'Demandez-vous' is the second person plural present tense of 'demander' (to ask) in interrogative form.

questions.audioText: Il essaye de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Il essaye de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien.
Il essaie de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien.
Il essaye de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien.
Il essayait de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien.
questions.explanation: The exact phrase was 'Il essaye de nouvelles techniques de méditation pour réduire son stress quotidien' - He tries new meditation techniques to reduce his daily stress. 'Essaye' is the third person singular present tense of 'essayer' (to try), alternative spelling of 'essaie'.

questions.audioText: Pourquoi essayez-vous toujours de résoudre les problèmes seuls sans demander d'aide?
questions.question: How do they always try to solve problems?
options: Alone, without asking for help
By working in small teams
By consulting with supervisors first
Through collaborative brainstorming
questions.explanation: The text states 'Pourquoi essayez-vous toujours de résoudre les problèmes seuls sans demander d'aide?' - Why do you always try to solve problems alone without asking for help? The question describes their method: working 'seuls sans demander d'aide' (alone without asking for help). 'Essayez' is the second person plural present tense of 'essayer' (to try) in interrogative form.

questions.audioText: Que cherches-tu exactement dans cette relation amoureuse?
questions.question: What is the person looking for in this romantic relationship?
options: The question asks what exactly they are seeking
They are looking for financial security
They want to find their soulmate
They are seeking adventure and excitement
questions.explanation: The text states 'Que cherches-tu exactement dans cette relation amoureuse?' - What are you looking for exactly in this romantic relationship? 'Cherches' is the second person singular present tense of 'chercher' (to look for), in interrogative form asking about relationship expectations.

questions.audioText: Mon projet finit toujours par être retardé à cause de problèmes techniques.
questions.question: Mon projet ______ toujours par être retardé à cause de problèmes techniques.
options: finit
finis
finissent
finira
questions.explanation: The text contains 'Mon projet finit toujours par être retardé à cause de problèmes techniques' - My project always ends up being delayed because of technical problems. 'Finit' is the third person singular present tense of 'finir' (to finish/end), expressing a recurring pattern.

questions.audioText: Tu joues au tennis depuis combien de temps exactement?
questions.question: What is the person asking about tennis?
options: How long exactly they have been playing
Whether they enjoy playing the sport
What time they usually play
How often they practice each week
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu joues au tennis depuis combien de temps exactement?' - How long exactly have you been playing tennis? 'Joues' is the second person singular present tense of 'jouer' (to play), asking about duration of activity.

questions.audioText: Cette famille riche habite dans un quartier très exclusif de la ville.
questions.question: Where does this wealthy family live?
options: In a very exclusive neighborhood of the city
In a modern apartment downtown
In a rural house outside the city
In a traditional family home
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette famille riche habite dans un quartier très exclusif de la ville' - This wealthy family lives in a very exclusive neighborhood of the city. 'Riche' is a high-frequency adjective meaning wealthy or rich, describing the family's financial status.

questions.audioText: Je reviendrai vous voir dès que j'aurai résolu ce problème urgent.
questions.question: Je ______ vous voir dès que j'aurai résolu ce problème urgent.
options: reviendrai
reviens
revenais
reviendra
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je reviendrai vous voir dès que j'aurai résolu ce problème urgent.' - I will come back to see you as soon as I have resolved this urgent problem. 'Reviendrai' is the first person singular future tense of 'revenir' (to return).

questions.audioText: La dissertation est enfin finie après trois semaines de recherches intensives.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: La dissertation est enfin finie après trois semaines de recherches intensives.
La dissertation est enfin fini après trois semaines de recherches intensives.
La dissertation est enfin terminée après trois semaines de recherches intensives.
La dissertation est enfin complétée après trois semaines de recherches intensives.
questions.explanation: The text states 'La dissertation est enfin finie après trois semaines de recherches intensives.' - The dissertation is finally finished after three weeks of intensive research. 'Finie' is the feminine past participle of 'finir' (to finish), agreeing with the feminine noun 'dissertation'. The distractors test gender agreement ('fini' - incorrect masculine) and synonym variations ('terminée', 'complétée').

questions.audioText: Mes voisins appellent toujours la police quand nous organisons des fêtes.
questions.question: What do the neighbors always do when they organize parties?
options: They call the police
They join the celebration
They close their windows
They complain to the landlord
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes voisins appellent toujours la police quand nous organisons des fêtes' - My neighbors always call the police when we organize parties. 'Appellent' is the third person plural present tense of 'appeler' (to call).

questions.audioText: Ma sœur est revenue de son voyage en Asie avec des souvenirs magnifiques.
questions.question: Ma sœur est ______ de son voyage en Asie avec des souvenirs magnifiques.
options: revenue
revenu
revenus
revenues
questions.explanation: The text contains 'Ma sœur est revenue de son voyage en Asie avec des souvenirs magnifiques' - My sister came back from her trip to Asia with magnificent souvenirs. 'Revenue' is the feminine past participle of 'revenir' (to return), agreeing with 'ma sœur'.

questions.audioText: Nous nous retrouvons au bar après le travail pour discuter du combat de boxe
questions.question: Where are they meeting to discuss the boxing match?
options: At the bar
At the gym
At the office
At home
questions.explanation: The text states 'Nous nous retrouvons au bar après le travail pour discuter du combat de boxe' - We meet at the bar after work to discuss the boxing match. This combines 'bar' and 'combat' in a natural context.

questions.audioText: Sa maladie l'empêche de travailler sans cesse comme avant
questions.question: What prevents him from working constantly like before?
options: His illness
His age
His family
His schedule
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa maladie l'empêche de travailler sans cesse comme avant' - His illness prevents him from working constantly like before. 'Maladie' means illness and 'sans cesse' means constantly/without pause.

questions.audioText: La somme d'argent nécessaire pour couvrir les frais médicaux est considérable
questions.question: What is considerable about the medical expenses?
options: The amount of money needed
The number of doctors
The time required
The complexity of treatment
questions.explanation: The text states 'La somme d'argent nécessaire pour couvrir les frais médicaux est considérable' - The amount of money needed to cover medical expenses is considerable. 'Somme' means sum/amount.

questions.audioText: Le combat contre cette maladie demande une somme énorme d'énergie et de détermination
questions.question: What does fighting this disease require?
options: A huge amount of energy and determination
Expensive medical equipment
Multiple specialists
Long hospitalization
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le combat contre cette maladie demande une somme énorme d'énergie et de détermination' - Fighting this disease requires a huge amount of energy and determination. This combines 'combat', 'maladie', and 'somme' naturally.

questions.audioText: Depuis son arrivée au bar, il ne cesse de parler de son combat personnel
questions.question: What has he been doing since arriving at the bar?
options: Talking constantly about his personal struggle
Drinking quietly alone
Watching sports on TV
Playing games with friends
questions.explanation: The text states 'Depuis son arrivée au bar, il ne cesse de parler de son combat personnel' - Since his arrival at the bar, he hasn't stopped talking about his personal struggle. 'Ne cesse de' means 'doesn't stop' and 'combat personnel' means 'personal struggle'.

questions.audioText: Pour être libre dans ce monde, il faut être craint. Pour être craint, il faut être puissant.
questions.question: Pour être libre dans ce monde, il faut être craint. Pour être craint, il faut être puissant.
options: One must be feared, and to be feared, one must be powerful
One must be loved and respected by everyone
One must have many friends and allies
One must avoid all conflicts and remain neutral
questions.explanation: The text states 'Pour être libre dans ce monde, il faut être craint. Pour être craint, il faut être puissant' - To be free in this world, one must be feared. To be feared, one must be powerful. This expresses a philosophy linking freedom to power through fear.

questions.audioText: Le médecin honnête m'a dit que cette douleur dans la poitrine nécessite des examens urgents.
questions.question: Le médecin honnête m'a dit que cette douleur dans la poitrine nécessite des examens urgents.
options: Urgent tests are needed for the chest pain
The chest pain will go away with rest
Surgery is required immediately
The pain is not serious and can be ignored
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le médecin honnête m'a dit que cette douleur dans la poitrine nécessite des examens urgents' - The honest doctor told me that this chest pain requires urgent tests. The doctor is recommending immediate medical examination. The distractors test confusion about the doctor's recommendation.

questions.audioText: Clémence et Malik donnent des explications après leur séparation difficile suite à l'émission de télé-réalité. Le couple de cette saison a annoncé une rupture qui a provoqué de nombreuses réactions sur les réseaux sociaux.
questions.question: Clémence et Malik donnent des explications après leur séparation difficile suite à l'émission de télé-réalité. Le couple de cette saison a annoncé une rupture qui a provoqué de nombreuses réactions sur les réseaux sociaux.
options: They got married and are planning their honeymoon
They explained their difficult separation and the public reaction
They announced they are staying together despite problems
They decided to participate in another reality show
questions.explanation: The text states 'Clémence et Malik donnent des explications après leur séparation difficile suite à l'émission de télé-réalité' - Clémence and Malik give explanations after their difficult separation following the reality TV show. The distractors test confusion about the couple's situation.

questions.audioText: L'effet dangereux de ce milieu agit follement sur la bouche du docteur immobile, créant une situation ridicule.
questions.question: L'effet dangereux de ce milieu agit follement sur la bouche du docteur immobile, créant une situation ridicule.
options: Madly
Slowly
Gently
Quietly
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'effet dangereux de ce milieu agit follement sur la bouche du docteur immobile, créant une situation ridicule.' - The dangerous effect of this environment acts madly on the motionless doctor's mouth, creating a ridiculous situation. 'Follement' means madly/wildly, describing how the effect acts. The distractors test confusion about how the effect acts.

questions.audioText: Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des années.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des années
Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des ans
Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des siècles
Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des mois
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faudrait plus d'argent pour acheter cette belle voiture que nous voulons depuis des années' - It would be necessary to have more money to buy this beautiful car that we have wanted for years. 'Années' (years) is the correct time period mentioned in the audio.

questions.audioText: L'oie désolée traverse efficacement l'aéroport pour rencontrer le jeune fermier prêt à discuter des affaires agricoles importantes.
questions.question: L'oie désolée traverse efficacement l'aéroport pour rencontrer le jeune fermier prêt à discuter des affaires agricoles importantes.
options: Efficiently to discuss important agricultural affairs
Slowly to avoid security problems
Quietly to prevent disturbing travelers
Carefully to reach the parking area
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'oie désolée traverse efficacement l'aéroport pour rencontrer le jeune fermier prêt à discuter des affaires agricoles importantes.' - 'The sorry goose efficiently crosses the airport to meet the young farmer ready to discuss important agricultural affairs.' The noun 'oie' means goose, and the adjectives 'désolée' means sorry and 'prêt' means ready. The distractors test confusion about how the goose crosses the airport.

questions.audioText: Tu partais notamment vers cette chance importante hier.
questions.question: Tu partais notamment vers cette chance importante hier.
options: Yesterday, specifically
Today, early morning
Tomorrow, definitely
Last week, probably
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu partais notamment vers cette chance importante hier' - You were leaving specifically toward this important opportunity yesterday. 'Partais' is the imperfect form of 'partir' (to leave), and 'notamment' means 'notably/specifically'. The distractors test confusion about the time of departure.

questions.audioText: Je changerai complètement l'intérieur de cette maison avant de la mettre en vente sur le marché immobilier.
questions.question: Je changerai complètement l'intérieur de cette maison avant de la mettre en vente sur le marché immobilier.
options: Completely change the interior of this house
Partially renovate the exterior garden area
Slightly modify the basement storage space
Entirely rebuild the garage and driveway
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Completely change the interior of this house'. The text states 'Je changerai complètement l'intérieur de cette maison avant de la mettre en vente sur le marché immobilier' - I will completely change the interior of this house before putting it on sale on the real estate market. 'Changerai' is the future tense of 'changer' (to change), 'intérieur' means 'interior', and the text refers to real estate sales. The distractors test confusion about what will be changed.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - real estate context

questions.audioText: Ma grand-mère jouait du piano tous les dimanches après-midi quand j'étais petit.
questions.question: What did the grandmother do every Sunday afternoon?
options: She played the piano
She cooked traditional meals
She read stories aloud
She worked in her garden
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ma grand-mère jouait du piano tous les dimanches après-midi quand j'étais petit' - My grandmother played the piano every Sunday afternoon when I was little. 'Jouait' is the imperfect form of 'jouer' (to play), describing a past habit with the temporal clause repositioned. The distractors test confusion about the grandmother's activity.

questions.audioText: Mes nouveaux voisins sont vraiment sympas. Ils tiennent toujours la porte et proposent leur aide quand ils voient que j'ai les bras chargés. C'est un geste de courtoisie simple mais appréciable.
questions.question: Mes nouveaux voisins sont vraiment sympas. Ils tiennent toujours la porte et proposent leur aide quand ils voient que j'ai les bras chargés. C'est un geste de courtoisie simple mais appréciable.
options: They play loud music
They ignore the speaker
They hold the door and offer help
They ask for favors
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes nouveaux voisins sont vraiment sympas. Ils tiennent toujours la porte et proposent leur aide quand ils voient que j'ai les bras chargés. C'est un geste de courtoisie simple mais appréciable' - My new neighbors are really nice. They always hold the door and offer help when they see I have my arms full. It's a simple but appreciated gesture of courtesy. The distractors test confusion about the neighbors' actions.

questions.audioText: Ce riche industriel habite la deuxième maison après ce terrain sec et abandonné.
questions.question: Ce riche industriel habite la deuxième maison après ce terrain sec et abandonné.
options: In the second house after the dry, abandoned land
In the first house before the dry, abandoned land
In the third house beyond the green, fertile land
In the main house on the dry, abandoned land
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce riche industriel habite la deuxième maison après ce terrain sec et abandonné' - This wealthy industrialist lives in the second house after this dry and abandoned land. 'Riche' means wealthy, 'deuxième' means second, and 'sec' means dry. The distractors test confusion about the location of the house.

questions.audioText: Dans ce restaurant franco, ils utilisent essentiellement la coriandre et l'origan pour donner du goût aux plats méditerranéens.
questions.question: Dans ce restaurant franco, ils utilisent essentiellement la coriandre et l'origan pour donner du goût aux plats méditerranéens.
options: Coriander and oregano
Olive oil and fresh garlic for authentic taste
Traditional French herbs from regional gardens
Sea salt and black pepper for simple seasoning
questions.explanation: The text states 'Dans ce restaurant franco, ils utilisent essentiellement la coriandre et l'origan pour donner du goût aux plats méditerranéens.' - In this French restaurant, they essentially use coriander and oregano to flavor Mediterranean dishes. 'Coriandre' means coriander, 'origan' means oregano, 'franco' means French-style, and 'essentiellement' means essentially. The distractors test confusion about the ingredients used.
questions.source: Strategic spice vocabulary development - Mediterranean cuisine

questions.audioText: J'écris franchement mes opinions sur cette image superbe dans mon journal personnel
questions.question: J'écris franchement mes opinions sur cette image superbe dans mon journal personnel
options: Honest opinions about the superb image
Secret thoughts about family members
Daily activities and appointments
Creative stories and poems
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'écris franchement mes opinions sur cette image superbe dans mon journal personnel' - I write frankly my opinions about this superb image in my personal journal. 'Écris' is the first person singular of 'écrire' (to write), 'franchement' means frankly/honestly, and 'superbe' means superb/magnificent.
questions.source: Strategic conjugate targeting: écris + franchement + image + superbe

questions.audioText: Sa proposition semble raisonnable même si elle le rend nerveux et jaloux
questions.question: What can be said about his proposal?
options: It seems reasonable despite making him nervous and jealous
It is unreasonable and makes everyone uncomfortable
It is perfect and makes everyone happy
It is confusing and needs clarification
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa proposition semble raisonnable même si elle le rend nerveux et jaloux' - His proposal seems reasonable even though it makes him nervous and jealous. This combines 'raisonnable', 'nerveux', and 'jaloux'.

questions.audioText: Cette femme enceinte devient soudain jalouse de sa voisine plus maigre
questions.question: What happens to the pregnant woman?
options: She suddenly becomes jealous of her thinner neighbor
She gradually becomes friends with her neighbor
She slowly gains weight like her neighbor
She immediately helps her sick neighbor
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette femme enceinte devient soudain jalouse de sa voisine plus maigre' - This pregnant woman suddenly becomes jealous of her thinner neighbor. This combines 'enceinte', 'soudain', 'jalouse', and 'maigre'.

questions.audioText: Il serait raisonnable d'utiliser du papier moins épais pour ce projet urgent
questions.question: What would be reasonable for this urgent project?
options: Using thinner paper
Using more expensive materials
Delaying the project deadline
Hiring more workers
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il serait raisonnable d'utiliser du papier moins épais pour ce projet urgent' - It would be reasonable to use thinner paper for this urgent project. This combines 'raisonnable' and 'épais'.

questions.audioText: Le papier vierge épais permet une meilleure impression que le papier maigre
questions.question: What allows for better printing?
options: Virgin thick paper compared to thin paper
Recycled paper compared to new paper
Colored paper compared to white paper
Glossy paper compared to matte paper
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le papier vierge épais permet une meilleure impression que le papier maigre' - Virgin thick paper allows for better printing than thin paper. This combines 'vierge', 'épais', and 'maigre'.

questions.audioText: Elle devient soudain jalouse quand elle voit cette femme enceinte si raisonnable
questions.question: When does she become jealous?
options: Suddenly when she sees the reasonable pregnant woman
Gradually over several months of observation
Only during stressful situations
After hearing gossip about the woman
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle devient soudain jalouse quand elle voit cette femme enceinte si raisonnable' - She suddenly becomes jealous when she sees this pregnant woman who is so reasonable. This combines 'soudain', 'jalouse', 'enceinte', and 'raisonnable'.

questions.audioText: Ce homme riche possède une collection immense d'art contemporain et de livres rares.
questions.question: Ce homme riche possède une collection immense d'art contemporain et de livres rares.
options: An immense collection of contemporary art and rare books
A small collection of modern paintings
A large collection of antique furniture
An impressive collection of musical instruments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce homme riche possède une collection immense d'art contemporain et de livres rares' - This rich man possesses an immense collection of contemporary art and rare books. 'Riche' means rich/wealthy, 'immense' means immense/huge, and 'contemporain' means contemporary/modern.

questions.audioText: Suivez les panneaux bleus pour arriver au parking des employés.
questions.question: Suivez les panneaux bleus pour arriver au parking des employés.
options: The blue signs
The red signs
The yellow lines
The green arrows
questions.explanation: The text states 'Suivez les panneaux bleus pour arriver au parking des employés' - Follow the blue signs to reach the employee parking. 'Suivez' is the imperative form of 'suivre' (to follow), 'panneaux' means signs, and 'parking des employés' means employee parking.

questions.audioText: Vous oublierez rapidement vos soucis si vous cultivez un jardin parfait avec des fleurs merveilleux dans votre cour.
questions.question: Vous oublierez rapidement vos soucis si vous cultivez un jardin parfait avec des fleurs merveilleux dans votre cour.
options: Your worries
Important deadlines and professional commitments
Family birthdays and special anniversary celebrations
Financial obligations and monthly bill payments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous oublierez rapidement vos soucis si vous cultivez un jardin parfait avec des fleurs merveilleux dans votre cour.' - You will quickly forget your worries if you cultivate a perfect garden with wonderful flowers in your yard. 'Oublierez' is the future form of 'oublier' (to forget), 'soucis' means worries, and 'rapidement' means quickly. The distractors test confusion about what will be forgotten.
questions.source: Strategic conjugate coverage development - gardening therapy

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu comprennes que dire merci est vraiment sympa et important.
questions.question: Il faut que tu comprennes que dire merci est vraiment sympa et important.
options: It's unnecessary
It's really nice and important
It's only for adults
It's too formal
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu comprennes que dire merci est vraiment sympa et important' - You must understand that saying thanks is really nice and important. 'Comprennes' is the subjunctive form of 'comprendre' (to understand), 'merci' means thanks, and 'sympa' means nice/kind.

questions.audioText: Vous décidez convenablement d'ignorer le rire moqueur de vos collègues lors de la présentation importante.
questions.question: Vous décidez convenablement d'ignorer le rire moqueur de vos collègues lors de la présentation importante.
options: Ignore it during the important presentation
Confront them immediately after the meeting
Report their behavior to human resources
Join in the laughter to diffuse tension
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous décidez convenablement d'ignorer le rire moqueur de vos collègues lors de la présentation importante' - You appropriately decide to ignore the mocking laughter of your colleagues during the important presentation. 'Rire' means laughter, 'décidez' is second person plural of 'décider', and 'convenablement' means appropriately. The distractors test confusion about the appropriate action.

questions.audioText: Quelle est votre taille pour cette veste ?
questions.question: Quelle est votre taille pour cette veste ?
options: Your size for the jacket
Your age for the jacket
Your color preference
Your payment method
questions.explanation: The text states 'Quelle est votre taille pour cette veste ?' - What is your size for this jacket? 'Taille' means size (for clothing). The distractors test confusion about the question being asked.

questions.audioText: Pour organiser sa garde-robe, elle classe simplement ses vêtements par couleur et par saison.
questions.question: Pour organiser sa garde-robe, elle classe simplement ses vêtements par couleur et par saison.
options: She simply sorts clothes by color and season.
She carefully arranges clothes by brand and price.
She quickly organizes clothes by size and fabric.
She systematically groups clothes by style and occasion.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Pour organiser sa garde-robe, elle classe simplement ses vêtements par couleur et par saison' - To organize her wardrobe, she simply sorts her clothes by color and season. 'Garde-robe' means wardrobe, 'classe' means sorts/organizes, and 'simplement' means simply.

questions.audioText: Mon père et ses amis sont sortis hier soir pour fêter leur victoire au tournoi de pétanque. Ils sont rentrés très tard, mais ils avaient l'air vraiment contents de leur soirée.
questions.question: Why did the father and his friends go out last night?
options: To celebrate a birthday
To watch a movie
To celebrate winning a pétanque tournament
To have a quiet dinner
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon père et ses amis sont sortis hier soir pour fêter leur victoire au tournoi de pétanque. Ils sont rentrés très tard, mais ils avaient l'air vraiment contents de leur soirée.' - My father and his friends went out last night to celebrate their victory in the pétanque tournament. They came home very late but looked really happy about their evening. 'Fêter' means to celebrate and 'victoire' means victory.

questions.audioText: Cette émission a été regardée par des millions de téléspectateurs.
questions.question: Cette émission a été regardée par des millions de téléspectateurs.
options: It was watched by millions of viewers.
It was criticized by millions of viewers.
It was ignored by millions of viewers.
It was recorded by millions of viewers.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette émission a été regardée par des millions de téléspectateurs' - This show was watched by millions of viewers. The past participle 'regardée' agrees with the feminine noun 'émission', and 'téléspectateurs' means television viewers.

questions.audioText: L'entrepreneur essaiera personnellement de développer une solution naturelle pour résoudre ce problème complexe du marché.
questions.question: L'entrepreneur essaiera personnellement de développer une solution naturelle pour résoudre ce problème complexe du marché.
options: A natural solution
Advanced technological innovation using artificial intelligence
Strategic partnerships with established industry leaders
Comprehensive market analysis with consumer behavior studies
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'entrepreneur essaiera personnellement de développer une solution naturelle pour résoudre ce problème complexe du marché.' - The entrepreneur will try personally to develop a natural solution to solve this complex market problem. 'Essaiera' is the future form of 'essayer' (to try), 'personnellement' means personally, and 'naturelle' means natural (feminine form agreeing with 'solution').
questions.source: Strategic conjugate coverage development - entrepreneurial innovation

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu aies plus de confiance en toi pour réussir dans cette nouvelle entreprise.
questions.question: Il faut que tu aies plus de confiance en toi pour réussir dans cette nouvelle entreprise.
options: You need to have more confidence in yourself
You need to work harder than everyone else
You need to ask for help from colleagues
You need to change your working methods
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu aies plus de confiance en toi pour réussir dans cette nouvelle entreprise' - You need to have more confidence in yourself to succeed in this new business. 'Aies' is the subjunctive form of 'avoir' used after 'il faut que', and 'confiance en toi' means confidence in yourself.

questions.audioText: Sa volonté de réussir dans cette entreprise difficile impressionne tous ses collègues qui admirent sa détermination.
questions.question: What impresses the colleagues?
options: His willingness to succeed in this difficult undertaking
His ability to work long hours every day
His knowledge of complex business strategies
His experience with international markets
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa volonté de réussir dans cette entreprise difficile impressionne tous ses collègues' - His willingness to succeed in this difficult undertaking impresses all his colleagues. 'Volonté' means willingness/will, 'réussir' means to succeed, and 'entreprise' here means undertaking.

questions.audioText: Son esprit vif et sa folie créative en font un artiste exceptionnel que tous admirent.
questions.question: What makes him an exceptional artist that everyone admires?
options: His sharp mind and creative madness
His expensive art supplies and studio
His formal training and prestigious awards
His wealthy family and social connections
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son esprit vif et sa folie créative en font un artiste exceptionnel' - His sharp mind and his creative madness make him an exceptional artist. 'Vif' means sharp/lively, 'folie' means madness/folly, and 'créative' means creative.

questions.audioText: Le manuel épais traite de l'éducation sexuellement explicite dans les programmes scolaires modernes.
questions.question: What does the thick manual deal with?
options: Sexually explicit education in modern school programs
Traditional teaching methods and classroom management
Advanced mathematics and scientific research techniques
Historical perspectives on educational philosophy
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le manuel épais traite de l'éducation sexuellement explicite dans les programmes scolaires modernes' - The thick manual deals with sexually explicit education in modern school programs. 'Épais' means thick, 'sexuellement' means sexually, and 'explicite' means explicit.

questions.audioText: Cette chasse aux papillons dans le musée me paraît complètement absurde et sans aucun sens logique.
questions.question: How does the speaker view the butterfly hunt in the museum?
options: Completely absurd and senseless
Scientifically valuable and educational
Entertaining but potentially dangerous
Traditional but somewhat outdated
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette chasse aux papillons dans le musée me paraît complètement absurde et sans aucun sens logique' - This butterfly hunt in the museum seems completely absurd to me and without any logical sense. 'Chasse' means hunt, 'absurde' means absurd, and 'sens logique' means logical sense.

questions.audioText: Le toit de cette maison résiste pleinement aux tempêtes hivernales grâce à sa construction solide.
questions.question: Le toit de cette maison résiste ______ aux tempêtes hivernales grâce à sa construction solide.
options: pleinement
partiellement
difficilement
rarement
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le toit de cette maison résiste pleinement aux tempêtes hivernales' - The roof of this house fully resists winter storms. 'Toit' means roof, 'pleinement' means fully/completely, and 'tempêtes' means storms.

questions.audioText: L'homme a pleuré toute la nuit après avoir découvert cette preuve furieuse de la trahison de son ami.
questions.question: What did the man do all night after discovering the proof?
options: He cried all night
He searched for more evidence
He called his lawyer immediately
He confronted his friend angrily
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'homme a pleuré toute la nuit après avoir découvert cette preuve furieuse' - The man cried all night after discovering this furious proof. 'Pleuré' is the past participle of 'pleurer' (to cry), 'preuve' means proof, and 'furieuse' means furious.

questions.audioText: Cette entreprise reçoit une adresse confidentielle pour livrer les documents secrets à temps.
questions.question: Cette entreprise reçoit une adresse confidentielle pour livrer les documents secrets à temps.
options: This company receives a confidential address to deliver secret documents on time
This business sends private information to multiple secure locations daily
This organization stores classified files in underground vault systems
This corporation transfers encrypted data through satellite communication networks
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette entreprise reçoit une adresse confidentielle pour livrer les documents secrets à temps' - This company receives a confidential address to deliver secret documents on time. 'Reçoit' is the 3rd person singular form of 'recevoir' (to receive), and 'adresse' means address.

questions.audioText: Vous agissez humblement face à cette situation complexe qui demande de la patience et de la sagesse.
questions.question: Vous ______ humblement face à cette situation complexe qui demande de la patience et de la sagesse.
options: agissez
réagissez
fuyez
critiquez
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous agissez humblement face à cette situation complexe' - You act humbly facing this complex situation. 'Agissez' is the 2nd person plural/formal form of 'agir' (to act), and 'humblement' means humbly.

questions.audioText: Cette bande de jeunes traverse toujours la rue à cet endroit dangereux.
questions.question: What does this group of young people always do at this dangerous place?
options: They cross the street
They wait for the bus
They play music
They sell newspapers
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette bande de jeunes traverse toujours la rue à cet endroit dangereux' - This group of young people always crosses the street at this dangerous place. 'Bande' means group or gang.

questions.audioText: Leur conversation s'est prolongée tard dans la nuit malgré la fatigue.
questions.question: What continued late into the night despite fatigue?
options: Their conversation
Their homework
Their television program
Their dinner preparation
questions.explanation: The text states 'Leur conversation s'est prolongée tard dans la nuit malgré la fatigue' - Their conversation continued late into the night despite fatigue. 'Conversation' means conversation or discussion.

questions.audioText: Tu as tort de penser que cette solution résoudra tous nos problèmes financiers.
questions.question: What is the speaker's opinion about this solution?
options: The person is wrong to think it will solve all financial problems
The person is right to believe it will help with money issues
The person should invest more money in this solution
The person needs to find a different financial advisor
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu as tort de penser que cette solution résoudra tous nos problèmes financiers' - You are wrong to think that this solution will solve all our financial problems. 'Tort' means wrong or fault.

questions.audioText: Il nous faut une preuve solide pour convaincre le jury de son innocence.
questions.question: What do they need to convince the jury of his innocence?
options: Solid proof
A good lawyer
More time
Character witnesses
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il nous faut une preuve solide pour convaincre le jury de son innocence' - We need solid proof to convince the jury of his innocence. 'Preuve' means proof or evidence.

questions.audioText: Ce héros moderne inspire les jeunes générations par son courage exceptionnel.
questions.question: How does this modern hero inspire young generations?
options: Through his exceptional courage
Through his wealth and success
Through his athletic achievements
Through his artistic talents
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce héros moderne inspire les jeunes générations par son courage exceptionnel' - This modern hero inspires young generations through his exceptional courage. 'Héros' means hero.

questions.audioText: Les soins médicaux appropriés ont permis sa guérison rapide et complète.
questions.question: What enabled his quick and complete recovery?
options: Appropriate medical care
Regular exercise and diet
Family support and rest
Alternative medicine treatments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les soins médicaux appropriés ont permis sa guérison rapide et complète' - Appropriate medical care enabled his quick and complete recovery. 'Soins' means care or treatment.

questions.audioText: Le toit de cette vieille maison a besoin de réparations urgentes avant l'hiver.
questions.question: What needs urgent repairs before winter?
options: The roof of this old house
The windows of this old house
The foundation of this old house
The garden of this old house
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le toit de cette vieille maison a besoin de réparations urgentes avant l'hiver' - The roof of this old house needs urgent repairs before winter. 'Toit' means roof.

questions.audioText: Le médecin recommande un soin particulier pour cette blessure.
questions.question: What does the doctor recommend for the injury?
options: A particular treatment
Immediate surgery
Complete rest
Medication only
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le médecin recommande un soin particulier pour cette blessure' - The doctor recommends a particular treatment for this injury. 'Soin' refers to care or treatment in medical contexts.

questions.audioText: Le professeur écrit les formules mathématiques au tableau.
questions.question: Where does the teacher write the mathematical formulas?
options: On the blackboard
In the textbook
On worksheets
In the notebook
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le professeur écrit les formules mathématiques au tableau' - The teacher writes the mathematical formulas on the blackboard. 'Tableau' refers to a blackboard or whiteboard in educational contexts.

questions.audioText: Le formulaire demande de préciser votre sexe et votre âge.
questions.question: What information does the form request?
options: Your gender and age
Your name and address
Your job and salary
Your education and experience
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le formulaire demande de préciser votre sexe et votre âge' - The form asks to specify your gender and age. 'Sexe' refers to gender in official documents.

questions.audioText: Cet objet mystérieux a été trouvé dans le grenier.
questions.question: Where was the mysterious object found?
options: In the attic
In the basement
In the garage
In the garden
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet objet mystérieux a été trouvé dans le grenier' - This mysterious object was found in the attic. 'Objet' refers to an object or item.

questions.audioText: Tu pars en vacances demain matin ou tu restes encore quelques jours ici avec nous ?
questions.question: Tu ______ en vacances demain matin ou tu restes encore quelques jours ici avec nous ?
options: pars
parts
partis
partir
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu pars en vacances demain matin ou tu restes encore quelques jours ici avec nous ?' - Are you leaving on vacation tomorrow morning or are you staying a few more days here with us? The correct answer is 'pars' (you leave/go) - the second person singular present tense of 'partir'.

questions.audioText: Les scientifiques savent que le changement climatique menace notre planète.
questions.question: Les scientifiques ______ que le changement climatique menace notre planète.
options: savent
sait
savez
savons
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les scientifiques savent que le changement climatique menace notre planète' - Scientists know that climate change threatens our planet. The correct form is 'savent' (3rd person plural present of 'savoir') agreeing with 'les scientifiques'.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu sois gentil avec ton petit frère cette année.
questions.question: What does the speaker want the person to be like with their little brother this year?
options: Kind and gentle
Strict and demanding
Playful but competitive
Distant and independent
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu sois gentil avec ton petit frère cette année' - You need to be kind with your little brother this year. 'Sois' is the subjunctive form of 'être' (to be), required after 'il faut que', and 'gentil' means kind or nice.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu dises la vérité.
questions.question: Il faut que tu ______ la vérité.
options: dises
dis
dire
disant
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu dises la vérité' - You must tell the truth. The correct answer is 'dises' (2nd person singular subjunctive of 'dire'). After 'il faut que', the subjunctive mood is required.

questions.audioText: Il était furieux contre son collègue qui avait révélé des informations confidentielles à la concurrence.
questions.question: How did he feel about his colleague's actions?
options: Furious about the leaked confidential information
Disappointed about the missed deadline
Concerned about the project budget
Surprised by the unexpected promotion
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il était furieux contre son collègue qui avait révélé des informations confidentielles à la concurrence.' - 'He was furious with his colleague who had revealed confidential information to the competition.' The adjective 'furieux' expresses intense anger.

questions.audioText: Ce film d'horreur était vraiment affreux, je n'ai pas pu le regarder jusqu'à la fin.
questions.question: Ce film d'horreur était vraiment ______, je n'ai pas pu le regarder jusqu'à la fin.
options: affreux
affreuse
effrayant
terrible
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce film d'horreur était vraiment affreux, je n'ai pas pu le regarder jusqu'à la fin.' - 'This horror film was really awful, I couldn't watch it to the end.' The adjective 'affreux' (awful/dreadful) agrees with the masculine noun 'film'.

questions.audioText: L'existence de cette espèce rare d'oiseau fascine les biologistes du monde entier.
questions.question: What fascinates biologists worldwide?
options: The existence of this rare bird species
The migration patterns of common birds
The feeding habits of forest animals
The reproduction cycle of marine life
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'existence de cette espèce rare d'oiseau fascine les biologistes du monde entier.' - 'The existence of this rare bird species fascinates biologists worldwide.' The noun 'existence' refers to the fact that this species exists or lives.

questions.audioText: Il a menti à ses parents sur ses notes pour éviter leur déception et les conséquences désagréables.
questions.question: Why did he lie to his parents about his grades?
options: To avoid their disappointment and unpleasant consequences
To get more money for school supplies
To impress his friends at school
To change schools next semester
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a menti à ses parents sur ses notes pour éviter leur déception et les conséquences désagréables.' - 'He lied to his parents about his grades to avoid their disappointment and unpleasant consequences.' The past participle 'menti' (lied) comes from the verb 'mentir'.

questions.audioText: Le chauffeur de taxi a conduit les touristes jusqu'à l'hôtel en centre-ville malgré les embouteillages.
questions.question: Le chauffeur de taxi a ______ les touristes jusqu'à l'hôtel en centre-ville malgré les embouteillages.
options: conduit
conduite
conduire
conduisait
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le chauffeur de taxi a conduit les touristes jusqu'à l'hôtel en centre-ville malgré les embouteillages.' - 'The taxi driver drove the tourists to the downtown hotel despite the traffic jams.' The past participle 'conduit' (drove) is used with 'avoir' in the passé composé.

questions.audioText: Elle a offert un cadeau magnifique à sa meilleure amie pour son anniversaire hier soir.
questions.question: What did she do for her best friend's birthday?
options: She offered a magnificent gift
She organized a surprise party
She cooked a special dinner
She wrote a heartfelt letter
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle a offert un cadeau magnifique à sa meilleure amie pour son anniversaire hier soir.' - 'She offered a magnificent gift to her best friend for her birthday last night.' The past participle 'offert' (offered/gave) comes from 'offrir'.

questions.audioText: Le guide touristique nous a amené dans un magnifique château historique pour découvrir l'architecture médiévale.
questions.question: Who brought them to the historic castle?
options: The tour guide
The hotel manager
The bus driver
The local historian
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le guide touristique nous a amené dans un magnifique château historique pour découvrir l'architecture médiévale.' - 'The tour guide brought us to a magnificent historic castle to discover medieval architecture.' The past participle 'amené' comes from 'amener' (to bring/take someone somewhere).

questions.audioText: Après plusieurs heures de négociation, le directeur a finalement accepté notre proposition de réorganisation complète du département.
questions.question: What did the director do after hours of negotiation?
options: He finally accepted their reorganization proposal
He rejected all the suggested changes completely
He postponed the decision until next week
He demanded additional documentation first
questions.explanation: The text states 'Après plusieurs heures de négociation, le directeur a finalement accepté notre proposition de réorganisation complète du département.' - 'After several hours of negotiation, the director finally accepted our complete departmental reorganization proposal.' The past participle 'accepté' comes from 'accepter' (to accept).

questions.audioText: Le technicien a enlevé l'ancien équipement défaillant pour installer le nouveau système informatique plus performant.
questions.question: What did the technician do with the old equipment?
options: He removed the faulty old equipment
He repaired the existing system components
He upgraded the current software only
He relocated it to another department
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le technicien a enlevé l'ancien équipement défaillant pour installer le nouveau système informatique plus performant.' - 'The technician removed the old faulty equipment to install the new, more efficient computer system.' The past participle 'enlevé' comes from 'enlever' (to remove/take away).

questions.audioText: Elle s'est réveillée très tôt ce matin pour préparer son examen important de fin d'année universitaire.
questions.question: When did she wake up this morning?
options: Very early to prepare for her important exam
Late because she forgot about the test
At her usual time for regular classes
In the afternoon after studying all night
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle s'est réveillée très tôt ce matin pour préparer son examen important de fin d'année universitaire.' - 'She woke up very early this morning to prepare for her important end-of-year university exam.' The past participle 'réveillée' agrees with the feminine subject and comes from 'réveiller' (to wake up).

questions.audioText: Elle reverra sûrement son ancien professeur de musique lors de la cérémonie de remise des diplômes du conservatoire.
questions.question: When will she likely see her former music teacher again?
options: At the conservatory graduation ceremony
During her next private music lesson
At the annual school concert performance
When visiting the music school library
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle reverra sûrement son ancien professeur de musique lors de la cérémonie de remise des diplômes du conservatoire.' - 'She will surely see her former music teacher again at the conservatory graduation ceremony.' The future form 'reverra' comes from 'revoir' (to see again).

questions.audioText: Tu mens constamment à tes parents sur tes résultats scolaires et ils commencent à s'inquiéter de tes comportements étranges.
questions.question: What does the person constantly do to their parents?
options: Lies about their school results
Tells them everything honestly
Asks for help with homework
Shows them perfect grades
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu mens constamment à tes parents sur tes résultats scolaires et ils commencent à s'inquiéter de tes comportements étranges.' - 'You constantly lie to your parents about your school results and they're starting to worry about your strange behaviors.' The verb 'mens' is the second person singular present form of 'mentir' (to lie).

questions.audioText: Le chauffeur de taxi nous a ramené directement à l'hôtel après notre longue journée de visite touristique dans la capitale.
questions.question: Where did the taxi driver take them?
options: Directly back to their hotel
To another tourist attraction
To the airport for departure
To a restaurant for dinner
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le chauffeur de taxi nous a ramené directement à l'hôtel après notre longue journée de visite touristique dans la capitale.' - 'The taxi driver brought us directly back to the hotel after our long day of sightseeing in the capital.' The past participle 'ramené' comes from 'ramener' (to bring back).

questions.audioText: J'ai revu mon ancien collègue de travail hier soir dans un café du centre-ville et nous avons discuté de nos nouveaux projets professionnels.
questions.question: Where did the speaker see their former colleague?
options: In a downtown café
At their old workplace
At a business conference
In a shopping center
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai revu mon ancien collègue de travail hier soir dans un café du centre-ville et nous avons discuté de nos nouveaux projets professionnels.' - 'I saw my former work colleague again last night in a downtown café and we discussed our new professional projects.' The past participle 'revu' comes from 'revoir' (to see again).

questions.audioText: La vieille affiche publicitaire a été enlevée du mur par les employés municipaux pour faire place aux nouvelles informations administratives.
questions.question: What happened to the old advertising poster?
options: It was removed from the wall by municipal employees
It was repaired and updated with new information
It was moved to a different location downtown
It was covered with transparent protective material
questions.explanation: The text states 'La vieille affiche publicitaire a été enlevée du mur par les employés municipaux pour faire place aux nouvelles informations administratives.' - 'The old advertising poster was removed from the wall by municipal employees to make room for new administrative information.' The past participle 'enlevée' agrees with the feminine noun 'affiche' and comes from 'enlever' (to remove).

questions.audioText: Je reverrai probablement ma cousine l'année prochaine lors du mariage de notre grand-mère qui célébrera ses quatre-vingts ans.
questions.question: When will the speaker likely see their cousin again?
options: Next year at their grandmother's anniversary celebration
This weekend at a family dinner
During the summer vacation period
At Christmas with the extended family
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je reverrai probablement ma cousine l'année prochaine lors du mariage de notre grand-mère qui célébrera ses quatre-vingts ans.' - 'I will probably see my cousin again next year at our grandmother's wedding who will be celebrating her eightieth birthday.' The future form 'reverrai' comes from 'revoir' (to see again).

questions.audioText: Cette montagne est un lieu sacré pour les habitants de la région qui y organisent des cérémonies traditionnelles chaque printemps.
questions.question: What is this mountain for the local inhabitants?
options: A sacred place where they hold traditional ceremonies
A dangerous area they avoid during spring
A commercial site for tourism development
A research location for scientific studies
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette montagne est un lieu sacré pour les habitants de la région qui y organisent des cérémonies traditionnelles chaque printemps.' - 'This mountain is a sacred place for the inhabitants of the region who organize traditional ceremonies there every spring.' The adjective 'sacré' means sacred or holy.

questions.audioText: Il était furieux contre son voisin qui avait organisé une fête bruyante jusqu'à trois heures du matin sans prévenir personne.
questions.question: How did he feel about his neighbor?
options: He was furious about the loud party until 3 AM
He was grateful for being invited to celebrate
He was impressed by the party organization
He was understanding about the late celebration
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il était furieux contre son voisin qui avait organisé une fête bruyante jusqu'à trois heures du matin sans prévenir personne.' - 'He was furious with his neighbor who had organized a loud party until three in the morning without warning anyone.' The adjective 'furieux' means furious or very angry.

questions.audioText: Ce vendeur est vraiment malin, il arrive toujours à convaincre ses clients d'acheter plus que ce qu'ils avaient prévu initialement.
questions.question: What does the text say about the salesperson?
options: He's really clever at convincing clients to buy more
He's honest about what customers actually need
He's struggling to make any sales this month
He's new and still learning sales techniques
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce vendeur est vraiment malin, il arrive toujours à convaincre ses clients d'acheter plus que ce qu'ils avaient prévu initialement.' - 'This salesperson is really clever, he always manages to convince his clients to buy more than they had initially planned.' The adjective 'malin' means clever, smart, or cunning.

questions.audioText: Il trouve absurde de dépenser autant d'argent pour des vêtements de marque quand on peut trouver la même qualité ailleurs.
questions.question: What does he think about spending money on designer clothes?
options: He finds it absurd when similar quality exists elsewhere
He believes it's always worth the investment
He thinks it shows good taste and style
He considers it necessary for professional success
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il trouve absurde de dépenser autant d'argent pour des vêtements de marque quand on peut trouver la même qualité ailleurs.' - 'He finds it absurd to spend so much money on designer clothes when you can find the same quality elsewhere.' The adjective 'absurde' means absurd, ridiculous, or nonsensical.

questions.audioText: Ce restaurant est fameux pour ses desserts au chocolat qui attirent des visiteurs de toute la région depuis plus de vingt ans.
questions.question: What is this restaurant famous for?
options: Its chocolate desserts that attract regional visitors
Its innovative vegetarian menu options
Its live music performances every weekend
Its historic building and traditional architecture
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce restaurant est fameux pour ses desserts au chocolat qui attirent des visiteurs de toute la région depuis plus de vingt ans.' - 'This restaurant is famous for its chocolate desserts that have attracted visitors from the entire region for over twenty years.' The adjective 'fameux' means famous, renowned, or well-known.

questions.audioText: Vous recevez beaucoup de courrier électronique chaque matin pour votre travail administratif.
questions.question: What do you receive every morning for your administrative work?
options: A lot of electronic mail
Important phone calls from clients
Various printed documents
Weekly progress reports
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous recevez beaucoup de courrier électronique chaque matin pour votre travail administratif.' - You receive a lot of electronic mail every morning for your administrative work. The verb 'recevez' is the second person plural present form of 'recevoir' (to receive).

questions.audioText: Vous choisissez toujours les meilleurs restaurants pour vos dîners d'affaires importants.
questions.question: Vous ______ toujours les meilleurs restaurants pour vos dîners d'affaires importants.
options: choisissez
réservez
recommandez
trouvez
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous choisissez toujours les meilleurs restaurants pour vos dîners d'affaires importants.' - You always choose the best restaurants for your important business dinners. The verb 'choisissez' is the second person plural present form of 'choisir' (to choose).

questions.audioText: Vous chantez souvent sous la douche le matin avant de partir au bureau.
questions.question: What do you often do in the shower before going to the office?
options: Sing in the morning
Listen to music loudly
Practice speaking exercises
Think about work problems
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous chantez souvent sous la douche le matin avant de partir au bureau.' - You often sing in the shower in the morning before leaving for the office. The verb 'chantez' is the second person plural present form of 'chanter' (to sing).

questions.audioText: Il a chanté cette mélodie romantique pendant toute la soirée pour impressionner sa petite amie.
questions.question: What did he do all evening to impress his girlfriend?
options: He sang a romantic melody
He played guitar softly
He recited love poems
He danced elegantly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a chanté cette mélodie romantique pendant toute la soirée pour impressionner sa petite amie.' - He sang this romantic melody all evening to impress his girlfriend. The past participle 'chanté' comes from the verb 'chanter' (to sing).

questions.audioText: Ce problème commun affecte de nombreuses familles dans notre quartier depuis plusieurs mois.
questions.question: What kind of problem affects many families in the neighborhood?
options: A common problem that has lasted for several months
A rare issue that appeared recently
A temporary difficulty from last week
An unusual situation affecting few people
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce problème commun affecte de nombreuses familles dans notre quartier depuis plusieurs mois.' - This common problem affects many families in our neighborhood for several months. The adjective 'commun' means common, shared, or widespread.

questions.audioText: Le propriétaire furieux a exigé une explication immédiate de ses locataires bruyants.
questions.question: How did the landlord react to the noisy tenants?
options: He was furious and demanded an immediate explanation
He calmly asked them to be quieter
He politely sent them a written warning
He ignored the situation completely
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le propriétaire furieux a exigé une explication immédiate de ses locataires bruyants.' - The furious landlord demanded an immediate explanation from his noisy tenants. The adjective 'furieux' means furious, angry, or enraged.

questions.audioText: Ce comportement méchant envers les animaux du parc révèle un manque total d'éducation.
questions.question: What does the mean behavior toward park animals reveal?
options: A total lack of education
A temporary bad mood
A misunderstanding about animals
A fear of wild creatures
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce comportement méchant envers les animaux du parc révèle un manque total d'éducation.' - This mean behavior toward park animals reveals a total lack of education. 'Méchant' means mean/nasty and 'total' means total/complete.

questions.audioText: Cette tradition sacrée de notre village remonte à plusieurs siècles et unit toutes les générations.
questions.question: What characterizes this village tradition?
options: It is sacred, centuries-old, and unites all generations
It is modern, innovative, and appeals to young people
It is seasonal, temporary, and changes every year
It is private, exclusive, and limited to certain families
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette tradition sacrée de notre village remonte à plusieurs siècles et unit toutes les générations.' - This sacred tradition of our village goes back several centuries and unites all generations. The adjective 'sacré' means sacred, holy, or revered.

questions.audioText: Cette troupe de théâtre amateur présente des spectacles fascinants dans notre centre culturel local chaque weekend.
questions.question: What presents fascinating shows at the local cultural center?
options: An amateur theater troupe every weekend
Professional musicians twice monthly
Dance students during holidays
Local artists once per season
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette troupe de théâtre amateur présente des spectacles fascinants dans notre centre culturel local chaque weekend.' - This amateur theater troupe presents fascinating shows at our local cultural center every weekend. The noun 'troupe' means troupe, company, or group of performers.

questions.audioText: Le roman policier raconte l'histoire d'un meurtre mystérieux dans un petit village de montagne isolé.
questions.question: What does the detective novel tell the story of?
options: A mysterious murder in an isolated mountain village
A romantic adventure in a coastal town
A family reunion in a big city
A treasure hunt in an ancient castle
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le roman policier raconte l'histoire d'un meurtre mystérieux dans un petit village de montagne isolé.' - The detective novel tells the story of a mysterious murder in a small isolated mountain village. The noun 'meurtre' means murder or killing.

questions.audioText: Cette folie des achats pendant les soldes transforme complètement le comportement des consommateurs raisonnables.
questions.question: What transforms the behavior of reasonable consumers during sales?
options: Shopping madness that completely changes them
High prices that discourage purchases
Limited store hours that create frustration
Poor customer service that causes complaints
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette folie des achats pendant les soldes transforme complètement le comportement des consommateurs raisonnables.' - This shopping madness during sales completely transforms the behavior of reasonable consumers. The noun 'folie' means madness, craze, or frenzy.

questions.audioText: Elle croit fermement que son destin est lié à cette ancienne prophétie découverte dans les archives familiales.
questions.question: What does she firmly believe about her destiny?
options: It is connected to an ancient prophecy found in family archives
It depends entirely on her personal choices and efforts
It will be revealed through dreams and meditation
It is written in the stars and cannot be changed
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle croit fermement que son destin est lié à cette ancienne prophétie découverte dans les archives familiales.' - She firmly believes that her destiny is linked to this ancient prophecy discovered in the family archives. The noun 'destin' means destiny, fate, or future.

questions.audioText: Cette pierre jetée savamment dans l'eau a créé des cercles parfaits qui se sont étendus sur toute la surface du lac.
questions.question: How was the stone thrown into the water?
options: Skillfully, creating perfect circles across the lake
Carelessly, making loud splashing sounds
Angrily, disturbing the peaceful environment
Accidentally, while walking along the shore
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette pierre jetée savamment dans l'eau a créé des cercles parfaits qui se sont étendus sur toute la surface du lac.' - This stone thrown skillfully into the water created perfect circles that spread across the entire lake surface. 'Jetée' is the past participle of 'jeter' (to throw), and 'savamment' means 'skillfully' or 'expertly'.

questions.audioText: Cette branche coupée mortellement par la tempête est tombée dangereusement près de la maison familiale.
questions.question: How was the branch affected by the storm?
options: It was mortally cut and fell dangerously near the family house
It was slightly damaged but remained attached to the tree
It was completely uprooted and carried far away
It was broken in half but stayed upright
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette branche coupée mortellement par la tempête est tombée dangereusement près de la maison familiale.' - This branch mortally cut by the storm fell dangerously near the family house. 'Coupée' is the past participle of 'couper' (to cut), and 'mortellement' means 'mortally' or 'fatally'.

questions.audioText: Cette enfant amenée à califourchon sur les épaules de son père découvre le monde avec émerveillement.
questions.question: How is the child being carried by her father?
options: Sitting astride on his shoulders
Held carefully in his arms
Walking beside him holding hands
Riding in a small stroller
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette enfant amenée à califourchon sur les épaules de son père découvre le monde avec émerveillement.' - This child brought astride on her father's shoulders discovers the world with wonder. 'Amenée' is the past participle of 'amener' (to bring), and 'à califourchon' means 'astride' or 'straddling'.

questions.audioText: Le boxeur frappé vachement fort s'est relevé courageusement pour continuer le combat malgré sa douleur visible.
questions.question: What happened to the boxer who was hit very hard?
options: He got up courageously to continue fighting despite visible pain
He immediately gave up and left the ring
He called for medical assistance from his corner
He complained angrily to the referee about unfair play
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le boxeur frappé vachement fort s'est relevé courageusement pour continuer le combat malgré sa douleur visible.' - The boxer hit really hard got up courageously to continue the fight despite his visible pain. 'Frappé' is the past participle of 'frapper' (to hit), and 'vachement' means 'really' or 'very' (informal).

questions.audioText: Tu chantes magnifiquement bien cette mélodie complexe qui demande une technique vocale très développée.
questions.question: How does the person sing the complex melody?
options: Magnificently well with developed vocal technique
With difficulty and some hesitation
Only the simple parts clearly
Better than expected for a beginner
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu chantes magnifiquement bien cette mélodie complexe qui demande une technique vocale très développée.' - You sing magnificently well this complex melody that requires very developed vocal technique. 'Chantes' is the second person singular present form of 'chanter' (to sing).

questions.audioText: Tu acceptes facilement les critiques constructives de tes collègues même quand elles remettent en question tes méthodes habituelles.
questions.question: How does the person react to constructive criticism?
options: Accepts it easily even when it questions usual methods
Gets defensive and argues against suggestions
Only accepts criticism from certain people
Pretends to listen but ignores the advice
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu acceptes facilement les critiques constructives de tes collègues même quand elles remettent en question tes méthodes habituelles.' - You easily accept constructive criticism from your colleagues even when it questions your usual methods. 'Acceptes' is the second person singular present form of 'accepter' (to accept).

questions.audioText: Les anciennes traditions culturelles disparaissent progressivement face à la modernisation rapide de la société contemporaine.
questions.question: What is happening to ancient cultural traditions?
options: They are progressively disappearing due to rapid modernization
They are being carefully preserved by cultural institutions
They are adapting and evolving with modern times
They are becoming more popular among young people
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les anciennes traditions culturelles disparaissent progressivement face à la modernisation rapide de la société contemporaine.' - Ancient cultural traditions are progressively disappearing in the face of rapid modernization of contemporary society. 'Disparaissent' is the third person plural present form of 'disparaître' (to disappear).

questions.audioText: Tu adorais autrefois passer des heures dans cette vieille bibliothèque à parcourir les livres d'histoire ancienne.
questions.question: What did the person used to love doing?
options: Spending hours in the old library browsing ancient history books
Writing historical research papers for university
Teaching history lessons to younger students
Collecting rare books about ancient civilizations
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu adorais autrefois passer des heures dans cette vieille bibliothèque à parcourir les livres d'histoire ancienne.' - You used to love spending hours in this old library browsing ancient history books. 'Adorais' is the second person singular imperfect form of 'adorer' (to love/adore).

questions.audioText: Les marchands vendent leurs produits artisanaux locaux sur la place du marché traditionnel chaque samedi matin.
questions.question: When do the merchants sell their local artisanal products?
options: Every Saturday morning at the traditional market square
Daily except Sunday at the town center
Only during summer festivals and holidays
Twice a week at different locations in town
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les marchands vendent leurs produits artisanaux locaux sur la place du marché traditionnel chaque samedi matin.' - The merchants sell their local artisanal products at the traditional market square every Saturday morning. 'Vendent' is the third person plural present form of 'vendre' (to sell).

questions.audioText: Elle revoit ses anciens amis d'université lors de réunions annuelles organisées dans la capitale pour maintenir les liens.
questions.question: When does she see her old university friends again?
options: At annual reunions organized in the capital to maintain connections
During regular weekend visits to their home cities
Only at special occasions like weddings and births
Through monthly video calls and social media
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle revoit ses anciens amis d'université lors de réunions annuelles organisées dans la capitale pour maintenir les liens.' - She sees her old university friends again at annual reunions organized in the capital to maintain connections. 'Revoit' is the third person singular present form of 'revoir' (to see again).

questions.audioText: Ces deux architectures contemporaines se ressemblent étrangement malgré leurs origines géographiques complètement différentes.
questions.question: What is remarkable about these two contemporary architectures?
options: They strangely resemble each other despite completely different geographical origins
They were designed by the same famous international architect
They use identical materials imported from the same region
They were built during the same historical period
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces deux architectures contemporaines se ressemblent étrangement malgré leurs origines géographiques complètement différentes.' - These two contemporary architectures strangely resemble each other despite their completely different geographical origins. 'Ressemblent' is the third person plural present form of 'se ressembler' (to resemble each other).

questions.audioText: Les athlètes professionnels courent quotidiennement des distances impressionnantes pour maintenir leur condition physique optimale.
questions.question: What do professional athletes do daily?
options: Run impressive distances to maintain optimal physical condition
Practice technical skills specific to their sport
Follow strict dietary regimens supervised by nutritionists
Attend strategy meetings with their coaching teams
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les athlètes professionnels courent quotidiennement des distances impressionnantes pour maintenir leur condition physique optimale.' - Professional athletes run impressive distances daily to maintain their optimal physical condition. 'Courent' is the third person plural present form of 'courir' (to run).

questions.audioText: Vous frappez délicatement à la porte avant d'entrer dans le bureau du directeur pour éviter de le déranger pendant ses réunions.
questions.question: How do you approach the director's office?
options: Knock gently at the door to avoid disturbing meetings
Enter directly without announcement as usual
Wait outside until someone invites you in
Send an email first to schedule an appointment
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous frappez délicatement à la porte avant d'entrer dans le bureau du directeur pour éviter de le déranger pendant ses réunions.' - You knock gently at the door before entering the director's office to avoid disturbing him during his meetings. 'Frappez' is the second person plural present form of 'frapper' (to knock).

questions.audioText: Tu adorerais certainement cette exposition d'art contemporain qui présente des œuvres innovantes d'artistes émergents du monde entier.
questions.question: What would the person certainly love?
options: A contemporary art exhibition featuring innovative works by emerging international artists
A classical music concert performed by renowned symphonic orchestras
A historical documentary about ancient civilizations and cultures
A culinary festival showcasing traditional recipes from various regions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu adorerais certainement cette exposition d'art contemporain qui présente des œuvres innovantes d'artistes émergents du monde entier.' - You would certainly love this contemporary art exhibition that presents innovative works by emerging artists from around the world. 'Adorerais' is the second person singular conditional form of 'adorer' (to love).

questions.audioText: Mon grand-père adorait raconter des histoires fascinantes de son époque pendant les longues soirées d'hiver près de la cheminée.
questions.question: What did the grandfather love to do?
options: Tell fascinating stories from his era during long winter evenings by the fireplace
Read classical literature aloud to the entire family
Play traditional card games with visiting neighbors
Teach traditional crafts and skills to younger generations
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon grand-père adorait raconter des histoires fascinantes de son époque pendant les longues soirées d'hiver près de la cheminée.' - My grandfather loved to tell fascinating stories from his era during long winter evenings by the fireplace. 'Adorait' is the third person singular imperfect form of 'adorer' (to love).

questions.audioText: Vous vous couchez généralement vers dix heures du soir pour respecter un rythme de sommeil régulier essentiel à votre bien-être.
questions.question: When do you usually go to bed?
options: Around ten o'clock in the evening to maintain a regular sleep rhythm essential for well-being
Very late after finishing all daily tasks and responsibilities
Early in the afternoon to compensate for morning work shifts
At different times depending on social activities and commitments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous vous couchez généralement vers dix heures du soir pour respecter un rythme de sommeil régulier essentiel à votre bien-être.' - You usually go to bed around ten o'clock in the evening to respect a regular sleep rhythm essential to your well-being. 'Couchez' is the second person plural present form of 'se coucher' (to go to bed).

questions.audioText: Tu agis toujours avec prudence et réflexion avant de prendre des décisions importantes qui pourraient affecter ton avenir professionnel.
questions.question: How does the person approach important decisions?
options: Acts with caution and reflection before making decisions that could affect professional future
Makes quick intuitive choices based on immediate feelings
Delays all decisions until external pressure forces action
Relies entirely on advice from friends and family members
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu agis toujours avec prudence et réflexion avant de prendre des décisions importantes qui pourraient affecter ton avenir professionnel.' - You always act with caution and reflection before making important decisions that could affect your professional future. 'Agis' is the second person singular present form of 'agir' (to act).

questions.audioText: Cette proposition commerciale paraît complètement absurde compte tenu des contraintes budgétaires actuelles de notre entreprise.
