questions.question: How does the commercial proposal appear?
options: Completely absurd given current budgetary constraints
Reasonably feasible with minor adjustments needed
Highly innovative and worth serious consideration
Partially acceptable but requiring significant modifications
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette proposition commerciale paraît complètement absurde compte tenu des contraintes budgétaires actuelles de notre entreprise.' - This commercial proposal appears completely absurd given the current budgetary constraints of our company. 'Absurde' means absurd, ridiculous, or nonsensical.

questions.audioText: Ce restaurant est devenu fameux dans toute la région grâce à sa cuisine traditionnelle authentique et son service exceptionnel.
questions.question: Why has the restaurant become famous?
options: For its authentic traditional cuisine and exceptional service
For its modern innovative dishes and trendy atmosphere
For its affordable prices and convenient location
For its celebrity chef and media coverage
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce restaurant est devenu fameux dans toute la région grâce à sa cuisine traditionnelle authentique et son service exceptionnel.' - This restaurant has become famous throughout the region thanks to its authentic traditional cuisine and exceptional service. 'Fameux' means famous, renowned, or well-known.

questions.audioText: Cette forêt vierge abrite une biodiversité extraordinaire qui n'a jamais été perturbée par l'activité humaine moderne.
questions.question: What characterizes this virgin forest?
options: Extraordinary biodiversity never disturbed by modern human activity
Recent reforestation efforts by environmental organizations
Carefully managed ecosystem with sustainable tourism
Protected area with limited scientific research access
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette forêt vierge abrite une biodiversité extraordinaire qui n'a jamais été perturbée par l'activité humaine moderne.' - This virgin forest shelters extraordinary biodiversity that has never been disturbed by modern human activity. 'Vierge' means virgin, untouched, or pristine.

questions.audioText: Les spectateurs étaient complètement enchantés par cette représentation théâtrale magistrale qui combinait tradition et innovation artistique.
questions.question: How did the spectators react to the theatrical performance?
options: They were completely enchanted by the masterful combination of tradition and artistic innovation
They were somewhat disappointed by the lack of modern elements
They were confused by the complex narrative and staging
They were impressed mainly by the elaborate costumes and sets
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les spectateurs étaient complètement enchantés par cette représentation théâtrale magistrale qui combinait tradition et innovation artistique.' - The spectators were completely enchanted by this masterful theatrical performance that combined tradition and artistic innovation. 'Enchantés' means enchanted, delighted, or spellbound.

questions.audioText: Cet homme ivre titubait dangereusement sur le trottoir en sortant du bar local après avoir célébré trop intensément.
questions.question: How was the man walking on the sidewalk?
options: He was staggering dangerously after drinking too much
He was walking carefully despite feeling dizzy
He was moving quickly to avoid being seen
He was supported by friends helping him home
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet homme ivre titubait dangereusement sur le trottoir en sortant du bar local après avoir célébré trop intensément.' - This drunk man was staggering dangerously on the sidewalk while leaving the local bar after celebrating too intensely. 'Ivre' means drunk or intoxicated.

questions.audioText: Ce film d'horreur m'a donné des cauchemars pendant des semaines après l'avoir regardé avec mes amis au festival de cinéma.
questions.question: What effect did the horror film have?
options: It gave nightmares for weeks after watching it
It was quickly forgotten after leaving the cinema
It inspired interest in making similar films
It was discussed positively with friends for days
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce film d'horreur m'a donné des cauchemars pendant des semaines après l'avoir regardé avec mes amis au festival de cinéma.' - This horror film gave me nightmares for weeks after watching it with my friends at the film festival. 'Horreur' means horror, a feeling of intense fear or dread.

questions.audioText: Les philosophes débattent depuis des siècles de la nature fondamentale de l'existence humaine et de sa signification profonde.
questions.question: What have philosophers been debating for centuries?
options: The fundamental nature of human existence and its deep meaning
The best methods for teaching philosophical concepts
The historical development of different schools of thought
The practical applications of philosophy in daily life
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les philosophes débattent depuis des siècles de la nature fondamentale de l'existence humaine et de sa signification profonde.' - Philosophers have been debating for centuries the fundamental nature of human existence and its deep meaning. 'Existence' means existence, the state of being alive or real.

questions.audioText: Cette décision administrative représente une véritable connerie qui va compliquer inutilement la vie de tous les citoyens concernés.
questions.question: How is the administrative decision characterized?
options: As genuine stupidity that will unnecessarily complicate citizens' lives
As a necessary but unpopular measure for public good
As a creative solution to a complex bureaucratic problem
As a temporary measure that will be revised soon
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette décision administrative représente une véritable connerie qui va compliquer inutilement la vie de tous les citoyens concernés.' - This administrative decision represents genuine stupidity that will unnecessarily complicate the lives of all concerned citizens. 'Connerie' is a vulgar term meaning stupidity or nonsense.

questions.audioText: Cette communauté juive organise des festivités traditionnelles chaque année pour célébrer ses racines culturelles et maintenir ses traditions ancestrales.
questions.question: What does this Jewish community organize annually?
options: Traditional festivities to celebrate cultural roots and maintain ancestral traditions
Educational seminars about contemporary social issues
Business networking events for professional development
Charitable fundraising campaigns for international causes
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette communauté juive organise des festivités traditionnelles chaque année pour célébrer ses racines culturelles et maintenir ses traditions ancestrales.' - This Jewish community organizes traditional festivities each year to celebrate its cultural roots and maintain its ancestral traditions. 'Juive' means Jewish, referring to people of Jewish faith or culture.

questions.audioText: L'identité de ce mystérieux visiteur nocturne demeure totalement inconnue malgré toutes les enquêtes menées par les autorités locales.
questions.question: What remains unknown despite local investigations?
options: The identity of the mysterious nighttime visitor
The exact time when the incidents occurred
The motivation behind the strange behavior
The location where the meetings took place
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'identité de ce mystérieux visiteur nocturne demeure totalement inconnue malgré toutes les enquêtes menées par les autorités locales.' - The identity of this mysterious nighttime visitor remains totally unknown despite all the investigations conducted by local authorities. 'Inconnue' means unknown, unfamiliar, or unidentified.

questions.audioText: Il faut être très prudent en traversant cette route dangereuse car les automobilistes roulent souvent à grande vitesse.
questions.question: Why should one be careful when crossing this road?
options: Because drivers often travel at high speed
Because the road surface is slippery and unstable
Because construction work blocks visibility
Because pedestrian crossings are poorly marked
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut être très prudent en traversant cette route dangereuse car les automobilistes roulent souvent à grande vitesse.' - One must be very careful when crossing this dangerous road because drivers often travel at high speed. 'Prudent' means careful, cautious, or wise.

questions.audioText: L'atmosphère devient particulièrement humide pendant les mois d'été dans cette région tropicale où la pluie est fréquente.
questions.question: When does the atmosphere become particularly humid in this region?
options: During the summer months when rain is frequent
During the winter season when temperatures drop
During the spring period when flowers bloom
During the autumn months when leaves fall
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'atmosphère devient particulièrement humide pendant les mois d'été dans cette région tropicale où la pluie est fréquente.' - The atmosphere becomes particularly humid during the summer months in this tropical region where rain is frequent. 'Humide' means humid, moist, or damp.

questions.audioText: La voiture accidentée a été ramenée au garage par une dépanneuse spécialisée pour subir des réparations importantes.
questions.question: How was the damaged car brought to the garage?
options: By a specialized tow truck for major repairs
By the owner driving it carefully to the mechanic
By a rental car service for temporary replacement
By public transportation after being abandoned
questions.explanation: The text states 'La voiture accidentée a été ramenée au garage par une dépanneuse spécialisée pour subir des réparations importantes.' - The damaged car was brought back to the garage by a specialized tow truck to undergo major repairs. 'Ramenée' is the feminine past participle of 'ramener' (to bring back).

questions.audioText: Le médecin remettra le patient sur pied grâce à un traitement innovant qui devrait considérablement améliorer sa condition physique.
questions.question: What will the doctor do for the patient?
options: Get the patient back on their feet with innovative treatment
Prescribe traditional medication for long-term recovery
Recommend immediate surgery for permanent solution
Refer the patient to a specialist for second opinion
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le médecin remettra le patient sur pied grâce à un traitement innovant qui devrait considérablement améliorer sa condition physique.' - The doctor will get the patient back on their feet thanks to innovative treatment that should considerably improve their physical condition. 'Remettra' is the third person singular future form of 'remettre' (to put back).

questions.audioText: Tu amènes toujours tes amis aux meilleures soirées de la ville où l'ambiance est garantie exceptionnelle.
questions.question: What does the person always bring their friends to?
options: The best parties in the city with guaranteed exceptional atmosphere
Quiet restaurants for intimate conversations and dining
Cultural events like museums and theater performances
Outdoor activities such as hiking and sports events
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu amènes toujours tes amis aux meilleures soirées de la ville où l'ambiance est garantie exceptionnelle.' - You always bring your friends to the best parties in the city where the atmosphere is guaranteed to be exceptional. 'Amènes' is the second person singular present form of 'amener' (to bring, to take along).

questions.audioText: La candidate choisie pour ce poste prestigieux possède une expérience remarquable dans le domaine international des relations diplomatiques.
questions.question: What does the chosen candidate possess?
options: Remarkable experience in international diplomatic relations
Advanced degrees from prestigious academic institutions
Strong connections with influential business leaders
Extensive knowledge of multiple foreign languages
questions.explanation: The text states 'La candidate choisie pour ce poste prestigieux possède une expérience remarquable dans le domaine international des relations diplomatiques.' - The candidate chosen for this prestigious position possesses remarkable experience in the international field of diplomatic relations. 'Choisie' is the feminine past participle of 'choisir' (to choose).

questions.audioText: Il paraît très amusé par cette comédie musicale qui mélange habilement humour moderne et traditions théâtrales classiques.
questions.question: How does he appear to be affected by the musical comedy?
options: Very amused by the skillful blend of modern humor and classical traditions
Confused by the complex storyline and character development
Bored by the repetitive songs and predictable plot
Impressed by the technical aspects and stage production
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il paraît très amusé par cette comédie musicale qui mélange habilement humour moderne et traditions théâtrales classiques.' - He appears very amused by this musical comedy that skillfully blends modern humor and classical theatrical traditions. 'Amusé' is the past participle of 'amuser' (to amuse, to entertain).

questions.audioText: Ces employés refusent catégoriquement de travailler dans des conditions dangereuses sans équipement de protection adéquat pour leur sécurité.
questions.question: What do these employees categorically refuse to do?
options: Work in dangerous conditions without adequate safety equipment
Accept overtime hours during weekend periods
Participate in mandatory training sessions and workshops
Relocate to different offices in other cities
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces employés refusent catégoriquement de travailler dans des conditions dangereuses sans équipement de protection adéquat pour leur sécurité.' - These employees categorically refuse to work in dangerous conditions without adequate protective equipment for their safety. 'Refusent' is the third person plural present form of 'refuser' (to refuse).

questions.audioText: La porte d'entrée principale a été violemment frappée par la tempête qui a causé des dommages considérables à toute la façade du bâtiment.
questions.question: What was violently struck by the storm?
options: The main entrance door, causing considerable damage to the building facade
The roof structure, leading to water infiltration problems
The windows on the upper floors, breaking most of the glass
The parking area, damaging several vehicles parked outside
questions.explanation: The text states 'La porte d'entrée principale a été violemment frappée par la tempête qui a causé des dommages considérables à toute la façade du bâtiment.' - The main entrance door was violently struck by the storm which caused considerable damage to the entire building facade. 'Frappée' is the feminine past participle of 'frapper' (to strike, to hit).

questions.audioText: Tu amuses énormément ton public avec tes plaisanteries spontanées et ton talent naturel pour l'improvisation théâtrale qui captive l'audience.
questions.question: How does the person entertain their audience?
options: With spontaneous jokes and natural talent for theatrical improvisation
With carefully rehearsed monologues and classical dramatic pieces
With musical performances and coordinated dance routines
With magic tricks and elaborate stage illusions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu amuses énormément ton public avec tes plaisanteries spontanées et ton talent naturel pour l'improvisation théâtrale qui captive l'audience.' - You greatly entertain your audience with your spontaneous jokes and natural talent for theatrical improvisation that captivates the audience. 'Amuses' is the second person singular present form of 'amuser' (to entertain).

questions.audioText: Vous ressemblez étonnamment à votre arrière-grand-père selon les anciennes photographies de famille que nous avons découvertes récemment.
questions.question: According to what do you remarkably resemble your great-grandfather?
options: Old family photographs that were recently discovered
Written descriptions found in historical documents
Stories told by elderly relatives during gatherings
Paintings commissioned for special family occasions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous ressemblez étonnamment à votre arrière-grand-père selon les anciennes photographies de famille que nous avons découvertes récemment.' - You remarkably resemble your great-grandfather according to the old family photographs that we recently discovered. 'Ressemblez' is the second person plural present form of 'ressembler' (to resemble).

questions.audioText: Tu intéresses particulièrement les chercheurs avec tes théories innovantes sur l'évolution climatique qui pourraient révolutionner notre compréhension scientifique.
questions.question: What particularly interests researchers about this person?
options: Innovative theories on climate evolution that could revolutionize scientific understanding
Advanced mathematical models for predicting economic trends
New archaeological discoveries in ancient civilization sites
Breakthrough medical research on genetic therapy treatments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu intéresses particulièrement les chercheurs avec tes théories innovantes sur l'évolution climatique qui pourraient révolutionner notre compréhension scientifique.' - You particularly interest researchers with your innovative theories on climate evolution that could revolutionize our scientific understanding. 'Intéresses' is the second person singular present form of 'intéresser' (to interest).

questions.audioText: La barrière de sécurité a été levée automatiquement grâce au nouveau système électronique installé pour faciliter l'accès des véhicules autorisés.
questions.question: How was the security barrier raised?
options: Automatically thanks to a new electronic system for authorized vehicles
Manually by security guards stationed at the entrance
Remotely by surveillance operators monitoring the area
Mechanically through a traditional lever and pulley system
questions.explanation: The text states 'La barrière de sécurité a été levée automatiquement grâce au nouveau système électronique installé pour faciliter l'accès des véhicules autorisés.' - The security barrier was raised automatically thanks to the new electronic system installed to facilitate access for authorized vehicles. 'Levée' is the feminine past participle of 'lever' (to raise, to lift).

questions.audioText: La mariée a été tendrement embrassée par tous les membres de sa famille lors de cette cérémonie émouvante qui restera gravée dans les mémoires.
questions.question: What happened to the bride during the emotional ceremony?
options: She was tenderly kissed by all her family members
She received congratulations from distant relatives
She was presented with traditional family heirlooms
She was blessed by religious leaders and elders
questions.explanation: The text states 'La mariée a été tendrement embrassée par tous les membres de sa famille lors de cette cérémonie émouvante qui restera gravée dans les mémoires.' - The bride was tenderly kissed by all the members of her family during this emotional ceremony that will remain engraved in memories. 'Embrassée' is the feminine past participle of 'embrasser' (to kiss, to embrace).

questions.audioText: Vous offrez généreusement votre aide à toutes les familles en difficulté de ce quartier défavorisé où les besoins sociaux sont particulièrement importants.
questions.question: What do you generously offer to families in this disadvantaged neighborhood?
options: Help to all families in difficulty where social needs are particularly important
Financial advice for managing household budgets and expenses
Educational tutoring services for children struggling in school
Job placement assistance for unemployed community members
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous offrez généreusement votre aide à toutes les familles en difficulté de ce quartier défavorisé où les besoins sociaux sont particulièrement importants.' - You generously offer your help to all families in difficulty in this disadvantaged neighborhood where social needs are particularly important. 'Offrez' is the second person plural present form of 'offrir' (to offer).

questions.audioText: Le célèbre écrivain a été chaleureusement embrassé par ses admirateurs lors de la signature de son dernier roman dans cette petite librairie indépendante.
questions.question: What happened to the famous writer during the book signing?
options: He was warmly embraced by his admirers in the small independent bookstore
He was interviewed by journalists about his literary inspiration
He was presented with awards for his contribution to literature
He was photographed with local cultural personalities
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le célèbre écrivain a été chaleureusement embrassé par ses admirateurs lors de la signature de son dernier roman dans cette petite librairie indépendante.' - The famous writer was warmly embraced by his admirers during the signing of his latest novel in this small independent bookstore. 'Embrassé' is the past participle of 'embrasser' (to embrace, to kiss).

questions.audioText: Ce criminel de guerre a finalement été pardonné après des décennies de controverses juridiques et de débats éthiques intenses dans la société civile.
questions.question: What happened to the war criminal after decades of debate?
options: He was finally pardoned after intense legal controversies and ethical debates
He was sentenced to life imprisonment following new evidence
He was extradited to face trial in international courts
He was placed under house arrest pending further investigation
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce criminel de guerre a finalement été pardonné après des décennies de controverses juridiques et de débats éthiques intenses dans la société civile.' - This war criminal was finally pardoned after decades of legal controversies and intense ethical debates in civil society. 'Pardonné' is the past participle of 'pardonner' (to pardon, to forgive).

questions.audioText: Cette découverte archéologique intéressait particulièrement les spécialistes de l'Antiquité qui cherchaient depuis longtemps des preuves de cette civilisation perdue.
questions.question: What particularly interested the antiquity specialists?
options: This archaeological discovery they had long sought as proof of a lost civilization
New carbon dating techniques for analyzing ancient artifacts
Recent theories about trade routes in the Mediterranean region
Advanced preservation methods for protecting historical sites
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette découverte archéologique intéressait particulièrement les spécialistes de l'Antiquité qui cherchaient depuis longtemps des preuves de cette civilisation perdue.' - This archaeological discovery particularly interested the antiquity specialists who had long been seeking proof of this lost civilization. 'Intéressait' is the third person singular imperfect form of 'intéresser' (to interest).

questions.audioText: L'artiste peintre a été officiellement reconnue comme l'une des figures les plus influentes de l'art contemporain par les critiques internationaux.
questions.question: How was the painter artist officially recognized?
options: As one of the most influential figures in contemporary art by international critics
As the winner of the prestigious national painting competition
As the youngest artist ever exhibited in major museums
As the creator of the most expensive artwork sold this year
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'artiste peintre a été officiellement reconnue comme l'une des figures les plus influentes de l'art contemporain par les critiques internationaux.' - The painter artist was officially recognized as one of the most influential figures in contemporary art by international critics. 'Reconnue' is the feminine past participle of 'reconnaître' (to recognize).

questions.audioText: Vous jurez solennellement de respecter les règles de cette ancienne confrérie secrète qui protège des manuscrits précieux depuis des siècles.
questions.question: What do you solemnly swear to respect?
options: The rules of an ancient secret brotherhood protecting precious manuscripts for centuries
The traditional customs of medieval craftsmen and their guilds
The sacred vows of monastic communities in remote monasteries
The ethical codes of modern archaeological expeditions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous jurez solennellement de respecter les règles de cette ancienne confrérie secrète qui protège des manuscrits précieux depuis des siècles.' - You solemnly swear to respect the rules of this ancient secret brotherhood that has been protecting precious manuscripts for centuries. 'Jurez' is the second person plural present form of 'jurer' (to swear).

questions.audioText: Vous embrassez avec passion cette nouvelle philosophie de vie minimaliste qui privilégie l'essentiel plutôt que l'accumulation matérielle excessive.
questions.question: What do you passionately embrace?
options: A new minimalist life philosophy favoring the essential over excessive material accumulation
Advanced meditation techniques for achieving inner peace and tranquility
Sustainable environmental practices for reducing ecological footprint
Traditional artisanal crafts that preserve cultural heritage
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous embrassez avec passion cette nouvelle philosophie de vie minimaliste qui privilégie l'essentiel plutôt que l'accumulation matérielle excessive.' - You passionately embrace this new minimalist life philosophy that favors the essential rather than excessive material accumulation. 'Embrassez' is the second person plural present form of 'embrasser' (to embrace, to adopt).

questions.audioText: L'homme complètement ivre a été interpellé par la police municipale alors qu'il perturbait l'ordre public sur cette place historique du centre-ville.
questions.question: Why was the completely drunk man stopped by police?
options: For disturbing public order on a historic city center square
For driving under the influence in a pedestrian zone
For vandalizing historic monuments during the night
For selling illegal substances to tourists
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'homme complètement ivre a été interpellé par la police municipale alors qu'il perturbait l'ordre public sur cette place historique du centre-ville.' - The completely drunk man was stopped by municipal police while he was disturbing public order on this historic square in the city center. 'Ivre' means drunk, intoxicated, or inebriated.

questions.audioText: Ce village lointain dans les montagnes reste complètement isolé du monde moderne et ses habitants préservent encore des traditions séculaires authentiques.
questions.question: What characterizes this distant mountain village?
options: Complete isolation from the modern world while preserving authentic centuries-old traditions
Advanced technological infrastructure connecting it to major cities
Tourism development that has transformed local customs
Economic prosperity based on modern agricultural techniques
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce village lointain dans les montagnes reste complètement isolé du monde moderne et ses habitants préservent encore des traditions séculaires authentiques.' - This distant village in the mountains remains completely isolated from the modern world and its inhabitants still preserve authentic centuries-old traditions. 'Lointain' means distant, remote, or far away.

questions.audioText: Il a choisi un restaurant quelconque sans consulter les avis des critiques gastronomiques ni vérifier la réputation de l'établissement auprès des gourmets locaux.
questions.question: How did he choose the restaurant?
options: Any restaurant without consulting critics' reviews or checking its reputation with local gourmets
Based on extensive research of culinary reviews and expert recommendations
Following suggestions from renowned food bloggers and travel guides
After comparing prices and menus from multiple high-rated establishments
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a choisi un restaurant quelconque sans consulter les avis des critiques gastronomiques ni vérifier la réputation de l'établissement auprès des gourmets locaux.' - He chose any restaurant without consulting gastronomic critics' reviews or checking the establishment's reputation with local gourmets. 'Quelconque' means any, ordinary, or unremarkable.

questions.audioText: Ce soldat lâche a abandonné ses camarades au moment crucial de la bataille décisive qui devait déterminer l'issue de cette guerre longue et sanglante.
questions.question: What did the cowardly soldier do during the decisive battle?
options: Abandoned his comrades at the crucial moment that would determine the war's outcome
Led a strategic retreat to preserve the lives of his unit
Coordinated reinforcements from nearby allied positions
Provided medical assistance to wounded fighters on the battlefield
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce soldat lâche a abandonné ses camarades au moment crucial de la bataille décisive qui devait déterminer l'issue de cette guerre longue et sanglante.' - This cowardly soldier abandoned his comrades at the crucial moment of the decisive battle that was to determine the outcome of this long and bloody war. 'Lâche' means cowardly, coward, or lacking courage.

questions.audioText: Le quartier juif de cette ancienne cité méditerranéenne conserve une architecture remarquable et des synagogues historiques qui témoignent de siècles de présence culturelle.
questions.question: What does the Jewish quarter of this Mediterranean city preserve?
options: Remarkable architecture and historic synagogues testifying to centuries of cultural presence
Modern commercial centers and contemporary residential buildings
Ancient Roman ruins and classical archaeological remains
Traditional markets and artisanal workshops from the Ottoman period
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le quartier juif de cette ancienne cité méditerranéenne conserve une architecture remarquable et des synagogues historiques qui témoignent de siècles de présence culturelle.' - The Jewish quarter of this ancient Mediterranean city preserves remarkable architecture and historic synagogues that testify to centuries of cultural presence. 'Juif' means Jewish, relating to Jewish people or culture.

questions.audioText: L'origine de cette mystérieuse maladie demeure totalement inconnue malgré des années de recherches approfondies menées par les meilleurs spécialistes internationaux.
questions.question: What remains unknown despite years of research?
options: The origin of this mysterious disease despite thorough research by international specialists
The exact treatment protocol for managing patient symptoms
The geographical distribution patterns across different continents
The genetic factors that determine individual susceptibility
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'origine de cette mystérieuse maladie demeure totalement inconnue malgré des années de recherches approfondies menées par les meilleurs spécialistes internationaux.' - The origin of this mysterious disease remains totally unknown despite years of thorough research conducted by the best international specialists. 'Inconnue' means unknown, unfamiliar, or unidentified (feminine form).

questions.audioText: Cet ambassadeur étranger maîtrise parfaitement notre langue nationale et comprend avec finesse les subtilités diplomatiques de notre système politique complexe.
questions.question: What does this foreign ambassador master perfectly?
options: Our national language and understands diplomatic subtleties of our complex political system
International trade agreements and economic cooperation protocols
Military strategies and defense coordination between allied nations
Cultural exchange programs and educational partnership initiatives
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet ambassadeur étranger maîtrise parfaitement notre langue nationale et comprend avec finesse les subtilités diplomatiques de notre système politique complexe.' - This foreign ambassador perfectly masters our national language and understands with finesse the diplomatic subtleties of our complex political system. 'Étranger' means foreign, from another country, or foreigner.

questions.audioText: Cette bataille historique a marqué un tournant décisif dans le conflit européen et ses conséquences ont profondément transformé l'équilibre géopolitique continental.
questions.question: What did this historic battle mark in the European conflict?
options: A decisive turning point that profoundly transformed the continental geopolitical balance
The beginning of diplomatic negotiations between opposing forces
The introduction of new military technologies and strategies
The establishment of temporary peace treaties among nations
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette bataille historique a marqué un tournant décisif dans le conflit européen et ses conséquences ont profondément transformé l'équilibre géopolitique continental.' - This historic battle marked a decisive turning point in the European conflict and its consequences profoundly transformed the continental geopolitical balance. 'Bataille' means battle, a military engagement or fight.

questions.audioText: L'avocat examine attentivement chaque dossier juridique complexe pour préparer sa stratégie de défense et identifier les arguments les plus convaincants.
questions.question: What does the lawyer carefully examine to prepare their defense strategy?
options: Each complex legal file to identify the most convincing arguments
Previous court decisions and judicial precedents
Client testimonies and witness statements
Expert reports and technical documentation
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'avocat examine attentivement chaque dossier juridique complexe pour préparer sa stratégie de défense et identifier les arguments les plus convaincants.' - The lawyer carefully examines each complex legal file to prepare their defense strategy and identify the most convincing arguments. 'Dossier' means file, folder, or case documentation.

questions.audioText: Sa connaissance approfondie des langues anciennes lui permet de déchiffrer des manuscrits médiévaux que d'autres spécialistes considèrent comme indéchiffrables.
questions.question: What does his deep knowledge of ancient languages allow him to do?
options: Decipher medieval manuscripts that other specialists consider indecipherable
Translate contemporary documents into historical dialects
Teach advanced courses at prestigious universities
Write authoritative books on linguistic evolution
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sa connaissance approfondie des langues anciennes lui permet de déchiffrer des manuscrits médiévaux que d'autres spécialistes considèrent comme indéchiffrables.' - His deep knowledge of ancient languages allows him to decipher medieval manuscripts that other specialists consider indecipherable. 'Connaissance' means knowledge, understanding, or expertise.

questions.audioText: Marie réussit toujours ses examens avec cette méthode.
questions.question: What does this statement tell us about Marie?
options: She always succeeds at her exams with this method
She needs help to pass her exams
She sometimes fails her important tests
She prefers to study alone for exams
questions.explanation: The text states 'Marie réussit toujours ses examens avec cette méthode' - Marie always succeeds at her exams with this method. 'Réussit' is the third person singular present form of 'réussir' (to succeed), and 'toujours' means always.

questions.audioText: Les touristes sont souvent trompés par ce guide malhonnête.
questions.question: What happens to the tourists?
options: They are often deceived by this dishonest guide
They always trust their travel guide completely
They prefer to explore the city independently
They complain about the high prices
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les touristes sont souvent trompés par ce guide malhonnête' - The tourists are often deceived by this dishonest guide. 'Trompés' is the past participle of 'tromper' (to deceive/trick), used here in the passive voice with 'sont'.

questions.audioText: Vous dansez très bien le tango.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Vous dansez très bien le tango.
Vous chantez très bien le tango.
Vous dansez très mal le tango.
Vous dansez très bien le disco.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'dansez' - the second person plural (vous) present form of 'danser' (to dance). This is a formal way to compliment someone's dancing skills.

questions.audioText: Les enfants dansent joyeusement dans la cour de récréation.
questions.question: What are the children doing?
options: They are dancing joyfully in the playground
They are playing soccer during recess
They are sitting quietly in the classroom
They are running around the schoolyard
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les enfants dansent joyeusement dans la cour de récréation' - The children are dancing joyfully in the playground. 'Dansent' is the third person plural present form of 'danser' (to dance).

questions.audioText: Mes amis rient toujours de mes blagues stupides.
questions.question: How do the friends react to the jokes?
options: They always laugh at the stupid jokes
They ignore the jokes completely
They criticize the poor humor
They tell better jokes instead
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes amis rient toujours de mes blagues stupides' - My friends always laugh at my stupid jokes. 'Rient' is the third person plural present form of 'rire' (to laugh).

questions.audioText: Tu te couches tard tous les vendredis soir.
questions.question: What is this person's Friday night habit?
options: Going to bed late every Friday night
Watching movies until midnight
Meeting friends at the bar
Working late at the office
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu te couches tard tous les vendredis soir' - You go to bed late every Friday night. 'Couches' is the second person singular present form of the reflexive verb 'se coucher' (to go to bed).

questions.audioText: Ne jettes jamais tes papiers par terre, c'est important.
questions.question: What is the advice being given?
options: Never throw your papers on the ground, it's important
Always keep your documents organized
Don't forget to recycle your newspapers
Clean up your desk regularly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ne jettes jamais tes papiers par terre, c'est important' - Never throw your papers on the ground, it's important. 'Jettes' is the second person singular present form of 'jeter' (to throw), used here in the imperative with negation.

questions.audioText: Les bagages ont été amenés directement à la chambre d'hôtel.
questions.question: What happened to the luggage?
options: It was brought directly to the hotel room
It was lost during the flight
It remained at the airport counter
It was checked at hotel reception
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les bagages ont été amenés directement à la chambre d'hôtel' - The luggage was brought directly to the hotel room. 'Amenés' is the past participle of 'amener' (to bring), used here in the passive voice with 'ont été'.

questions.audioText: Je te pardonnerai si tu m'expliques sincèrement la situation.
questions.question: What condition is given for forgiveness?
options: If you sincerely explain the situation
If you promise never to do it again
If you apologize publicly
If you make financial compensation
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je te pardonnerai si tu m'expliques sincèrement la situation' - I will forgive you if you sincerely explain the situation to me. 'Pardonnerai' is the first person singular future form of 'pardonner' (to forgive).

questions.audioText: Tu réussis toujours tes projets grâce à ta détermination.
questions.question: What enables this person to succeed?
options: Their determination
Their natural talent
Their expensive equipment
Their team members
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu réussis toujours tes projets grâce à ta détermination' - You always succeed at your projects thanks to your determination. 'Réussis' is the second person singular present form of 'réussir' (to succeed).

questions.audioText: Tu pardonnes facilement les erreurs de tes collègues.
questions.question: What is this person's attitude toward colleagues' mistakes?
options: They easily forgive their colleagues' errors
They report mistakes to management
They become angry about small errors
They ignore their colleagues completely
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu pardonnes facilement les erreurs de tes collègues' - You easily forgive your colleagues' errors. 'Pardonnes' is the second person singular present form of 'pardonner' (to forgive).

questions.audioText: Ne lâches pas tes études maintenant, c'est presque fini.
questions.question: What advice is being given?
options: Don't give up on your studies now, it's almost over
Take a break from studying for a while
Change your major to something easier
Focus only on the most important subjects
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ne lâches pas tes études maintenant, c'est presque fini' - Don't give up on your studies now, it's almost over. 'Lâches' is the second person singular present form of 'lâcher' (to let go/give up), used here in the imperative with negation.

questions.audioText: Est-ce que je vous dérange avec ma musique ?
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Est-ce que je vous ______ avec ma musique ?
options: dérange
dérangez
dérangent
dérangeait
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'dérange' - first person singular present of 'déranger' (to disturb/bother). The question asks 'Am I bothering you with my music?'

questions.audioText: Nous avons été prévenus du changement d'horaire hier soir.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Nous avons été prévenus du changement d'horaire hier soir.
Nous avons été préparés du changement d'horaire hier soir.
Nous avons été prévenus du changement d'adresse hier soir.
Nous avons été prévenus du changement d'horaire hier matin.
questions.explanation: The speaker said 'Nous avons été prévenus du changement d'horaire hier soir' - We were informed of the schedule change last night. Key words: 'prévenus' (informed, not 'préparés' - prepared), 'horaire' (schedule, not 'adresse' - address), and 'soir' (evening, not 'matin' - morning).

questions.audioText: Mon collègue reprend le travail après ses vacances lundi prochain.
questions.question: When will the colleague return to work?
options: Next Monday after vacation
Tomorrow morning early
At the end of this week
After the weekend break
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon collègue reprend le travail après ses vacances lundi prochain' - My colleague resumes work after vacation next Monday. 'Reprend' is the third person singular present of 'reprendre' (to resume/take back).

questions.audioText: Prévenez-moi immédiatement si quelque chose ne va pas.
questions.question: Write the correct form: ______ -moi immédiatement si quelque chose ne va pas.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'Prévenez' - second person plural imperative of 'prévenir' (to warn/inform). The sentence means 'Warn me immediately if something is wrong.'

questions.audioText: Il habitait dans cette maison avant de déménager en ville.
questions.question: What did he do before moving to the city?
options: He lived in this house
He worked in the countryside
He visited friends regularly
He studied at the university
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il habitait dans cette maison avant de déménager en ville' - He lived in this house before moving to the city. 'Habitait' is the third person singular imperfect of 'habiter' (to live/reside).

questions.audioText: J'ai été dérangé toute la nuit par les travaux de construction.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: J'ai été ______ toute la nuit par les travaux de construction.
options: dérangé
dérangeant
dérange
dérangera
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'dérangé' - past participle of 'déranger' (to disturb), used in the passive voice. The sentence means 'I was disturbed all night by the construction work.'

questions.audioText: La vieille église a été complètement détruite par l'incendie.
questions.question: What happened to the old church?
options: It was completely destroyed by fire
It was renovated after the storm
It was closed for safety reasons
It was moved to another location
questions.explanation: The text states 'La vieille église a été complètement détruite par l'incendie' - The old church was completely destroyed by the fire. 'Détruite' is the feminine past participle of 'détruire' (to destroy), agreeing with 'église'.

questions.audioText: Elle a été prévenue du retard du vol par un message électronique.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Elle a été prévenue du retard du vol par un message électronique.
Elle a été prévenue du retard du train par un message électronique.
Elle a été préparée du retard du vol par un message électronique.
Elle a été prévenue du retard du vol par un message téléphonique.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'prévenue' - feminine past participle of 'prévenir' (to warn/inform), agreeing with 'elle'. The sentence means 'She was informed of the flight delay by an electronic message.'

questions.audioText: Tu danses comme une professionnelle maintenant.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Tu ______ comme une professionnelle maintenant.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'danses' - second person singular present of 'danser' (to dance). The sentence means 'You dance like a professional now.'

questions.audioText: Nous avons dansé jusqu'à minuit lors de la fête.
questions.question: How long did they dance at the party?
options: Until midnight
For two hours
Until dawn
All afternoon
questions.explanation: The text states 'Nous avons dansé jusqu'à minuit lors de la fête' - We danced until midnight at the party. 'Dansé' is the past participle of 'danser' (to dance), used with 'avons' in the passé composé.

questions.audioText: Nous reprenons les cours de français la semaine prochaine.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Nous ______ les cours de français la semaine prochaine.
options: reprenons
reprennent
reprenez
reprendra
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'reprenons' - first person plural present of 'reprendre' (to resume/take back). The sentence means 'We are resuming French classes next week.'

questions.audioText: Cette réduction de prix m'a été offerte par le directeur.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Cette réduction de prix m'a été offerte par le directeur.
Cette réduction de prix m'a été offerte par le vendeur.
Cette augmentation de prix m'a été offerte par le directeur.
Cette réduction de prix m'a été proposée par le directeur.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'offerte' - feminine past participle of 'offrir' (to offer), agreeing with 'réduction'. The sentence means 'This price reduction was offered to me by the director.'

questions.audioText: Tu m'offres toujours ton aide quand j'en ai besoin.
questions.question: What does this person always do?
options: Offers help when needed
Asks for assistance
Provides financial support
Gives professional advice
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu m'offres toujours ton aide quand j'en ai besoin' - You always offer me your help when I need it. 'Offres' is the second person singular present of 'offrir' (to offer).

questions.audioText: Mon petit frère saute sur le trampoline depuis une heure.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Mon petit frère saute sur le trampoline depuis une heure.
Mon petit frère danse sur le trampoline depuis une heure.
Mon petit frère saute sur le trampoline depuis deux heures.
Mon grand frère saute sur le trampoline depuis une heure.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'saute' - third person singular present of 'sauter' (to jump). The sentence means 'My little brother has been jumping on the trampoline for an hour.'

questions.audioText: Elle a sauté de joie en apprenant la nouvelle.
questions.question: How did she react to the news?
options: She jumped for joy
She cried with emotion
She ran to tell others
She sat down quietly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle a sauté de joie en apprenant la nouvelle' - She jumped for joy upon learning the news. 'Sauté' is the past participle of 'sauter' (to jump), used in the passé composé.

questions.audioText: Quand j'étais enfant, je rêvais de devenir astronaute chaque nuit.
questions.question: What did this person dream about as a child?
options: Becoming an astronaut every night
Flying airplanes around the world
Traveling to distant countries
Working as a scientist
questions.explanation: The text states 'Quand j'étais enfant, je rêvais de devenir astronaute chaque nuit' - When I was a child, I dreamed of becoming an astronaut every night. 'Rêvais' is the first person singular imperfect of 'rêver' (to dream).

questions.audioText: Tu détestes vraiment faire la vaisselle le dimanche.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Tu ______ vraiment faire la vaisselle le dimanche.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'détestes' - second person singular present of 'détester' (to hate). The sentence means 'You really hate doing the dishes on Sunday.'

questions.audioText: Ce problème a toujours existé dans notre quartier depuis longtemps.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ce problème a toujours ______ dans notre quartier depuis longtemps.
options: existé
existe
existent
existait
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'existé' - past participle of 'exister' (to exist), used in the passé composé with 'avoir'. The sentence means 'This problem has always existed in our neighborhood for a long time.'

questions.audioText: Mes voisins détestent le bruit des voitures la nuit.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Mes voisins détestent le bruit des voitures la nuit.
Mes voisins détestent le bruit des avions la nuit.
Mes amis détestent le bruit des voitures la nuit.
Mes voisins détestent le bruit des voitures le jour.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'détestent' - third person plural present of 'détester' (to hate). The sentence means 'My neighbors hate the noise of cars at night.'

questions.audioText: Tu pousses toujours tes collègues à donner le meilleur d'eux-mêmes.
questions.question: What does this person do with colleagues?
options: Pushes them to give their best
Criticizes their work methods
Avoids working with them
Competes against them constantly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tu pousses toujours tes collègues à donner le meilleur d'eux-mêmes' - You always push your colleagues to give their best. 'Pousses' is the second person singular present of 'pousser' (to push/encourage).

questions.audioText: Avant, je détestais les mathématiques mais maintenant j'adore cette matière.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Avant, je ______ les mathématiques mais maintenant j'adore cette matière.
options: détestais
déteste
détestait
détesterai
questions.explanation: The text states 'Avant, je détestais les mathématiques mais maintenant j'adore cette matière' - Before, I hated mathematics but now I love this subject. The correct form is 'détestais' - first person singular imperfect of 'détester' (to hate). The sentence shows a contrast between past and present feelings about mathematics.

questions.audioText: J'ai rêvé de toi toute la nuit dernière.
questions.question: What happened last night?
options: I dreamed of you all night
I thought about you constantly
I called you several times
I wrote you a long letter
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai rêvé de toi toute la nuit dernière' - I dreamed of you all night last night. 'Rêvé' is the past participle of 'rêver' (to dream), used in the passé composé.

questions.audioText: Vous poussez cette porte trop fort, elle va se casser.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Vous ______ cette porte trop fort, elle va se casser.
options: poussez
poussé
pousser
poussait
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous poussez cette porte trop fort, elle va se casser.' - You push this door too hard, it's going to break. The correct form is 'poussez' - second person plural present of 'pousser' (to push).

questions.audioText: Tu habites dans cette belle maison depuis combien de temps ?
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Tu habites dans cette belle maison depuis combien de temps ?
Tu habites dans cette grande maison depuis combien de temps ?
Tu travailles dans cette belle maison depuis combien de temps ?
Tu habites dans cette belle ville depuis combien de temps ?
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'habites' - second person singular present of 'habiter' (to live). The question asks how long you have been living in this beautiful house.

questions.audioText: Où habitez-vous maintenant que vous avez déménagé ?
questions.question: Write the correct form: Où ______ -vous maintenant que vous avez déménagé ?
questions.explanation: The text states 'Où habitez-vous maintenant que vous avez déménagé ?' - Where do you live now that you have moved? The correct form is 'habitez' - second person plural present of 'habiter' (to live).

questions.audioText: Les enfants sont bien protégés dans cette école privée.
questions.question: How are the children in this private school?
options: They are well protected
They are carefully supervised
They are strictly disciplined
They are individually tutored
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les enfants sont bien protégés dans cette école privée' - The children are well protected in this private school. 'Protégés' is the past participle of 'protéger' (to protect), used in the passive voice.

questions.audioText: Mes grands-parents habitent dans le même village depuis cinquante ans.
questions.question: Where do the grandparents live?
options: In the same village for fifty years
In different cities across the country
In a retirement home nearby
In the capital with their family
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes grands-parents habitent dans le même village depuis cinquante ans' - My grandparents live in the same village for fifty years. 'Habitent' is the third person plural present of 'habiter' (to live).

questions.audioText: Ce livre est paru il y a six mois chez cet éditeur.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Ce livre est ______ il y a six mois chez cet éditeur.
options: paru
parti
parlé
passé
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'paru' - past participle of 'paraître' (to appear/be published). The sentence means 'This book was published six months ago by this publisher.'

questions.audioText: Présentez votre projet aux investisseurs demain matin.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Présentez votre projet aux investisseurs demain matin.
Présentez votre projet aux investisseurs demain soir.
Préparez votre projet aux investisseurs demain matin.
Présentez votre produit aux investisseurs demain matin.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'présentez' - second person plural imperative of 'présenter' (to present). The instruction is to present your project to investors tomorrow morning.

questions.audioText: Sautez dans la piscine, l'eau est parfaite aujourd'hui.
questions.question: Write the correct form: ______ dans la piscine, l'eau est parfaite aujourd'hui.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'Sautez' - second person plural imperative of 'sauter' (to jump). The instruction encourages jumping into the pool because the water is perfect today.

questions.audioText: Cette entreprise américaine domine le marché depuis dix ans.
questions.question: What type of company dominates the market?
options: An American company
A European corporation
A local business
An Asian manufacturer
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette entreprise américaine domine le marché depuis dix ans' - This American company has been dominating the market for ten years. 'Américaine' is the feminine form of the adjective 'américain' (American).

questions.audioText: Mon professeur allemand enseigne la philosophie à l'université.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Mon professeur ______ enseigne la philosophie à l'université.
options: allemand
allemande
allemands
allemandes
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'allemand' - masculine singular form agreeing with 'professeur' (masculine). The sentence means 'My German professor teaches philosophy at the university.'

questions.audioText: J'ai une vague impression que nous nous sommes déjà rencontrés.
questions.question: What kind of impression does the speaker have?
options: A vague impression
A strong feeling
A clear memory
A definite certainty
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai une vague impression que nous nous sommes déjà rencontrés' - I have a vague impression that we have already met. 'Vague' means vague/unclear/dim.

questions.audioText: Nous avons un ami commun qui travaille dans cette banque.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Nous avons un ami commun qui travaille dans cette banque.
Nous avons un ami commun qui travaille dans cette boutique.
Nous avons un cousin commun qui travaille dans cette banque.
Nous avons un ami commun qui travaille dans cette usine.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'commun' - masculine singular adjective meaning 'common/mutual'. The sentence means 'We have a mutual friend who works in this bank.'

questions.audioText: La veille de son départ, elle a préparé tous ses bagages.
questions.question: When did she prepare her luggage?
options: The day before her departure
The morning of her trip
Several weeks in advance
At the last possible moment
questions.explanation: The text states 'La veille de son départ, elle a préparé tous ses bagages' - The day before her departure, she prepared all her luggage. 'La veille' means the day before/the eve of.

questions.audioText: Cette voie de communication permet de relier les deux villes rapidement.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Cette ______ de communication permet de relier les deux villes rapidement.
options: voie
voix
vue
vie
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette voie de communication permet de relier les deux villes rapidement' - This communication route allows the two cities to be connected quickly. The correct form is 'voie' (path/route/way), not 'voix' (voice).

questions.audioText: La chasse aux papillons est une activité populaire dans cette région.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: La chasse aux papillons est une activité populaire dans cette région.
La chasse aux oiseaux est une activité populaire dans cette région.
La classe aux papillons est une activité populaire dans cette région.
La chasse aux papillons est une activité populaire dans cette religion.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'chasse' (hunt/hunting). Butterfly hunting is a popular activity in this region. In this context, it refers to butterfly collecting or observation.

questions.audioText: J'ai reçu un petit paquet de mes parents hier matin.
questions.question: What did the speaker receive?
options: A small package from parents
A large box from friends
A letter from family
A gift from colleagues
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai reçu un petit paquet de mes parents hier matin' - I received a small package from my parents yesterday morning. 'Paquet' means package/parcel.

questions.audioText: Ce morceau de musique classique est vraiment magnifique.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Ce ______ de musique classique est vraiment magnifique.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'morceau' (piece). This piece of classical music is really magnificent. 'Morceau' is used for musical pieces, artwork, or portions of something.

questions.audioText: La justice doit être épousée par tous les citoyens responsables.
questions.question: What should be embraced by all responsible citizens?
options: Justice
Freedom
Democracy
Equality
questions.explanation: The text states 'La justice doit être épousée par tous les citoyens responsables' - Justice must be embraced by all responsible citizens. 'Épouser' here means to embrace or adopt (a cause).

questions.audioText: Les discussions sur le sexe restent encore tabou dans certaines familles.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Les discussions sur le sexe restent encore tabou dans certaines familles.
Les discussions sur le stress restent encore tabou dans certaines familles.
Les discussions sur le sexe restent encore tabou dans certaines communautés.
Les discussions sur le succès restent encore tabou dans certaines familles.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'sexe' (sex/sexuality). Discussions about sex still remain taboo in certain families. This addresses important social topics that adults encounter.

questions.audioText: Je suppose qu'elle a pris le couteau pour couper le pain.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Je ______ qu'elle a pris le couteau pour couper le pain.
options: suppose
supprime
supporte
surmonte
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'suppose' (suppose/assume). I suppose she took the knife to cut the bread. This combines the target noun 'couteau' with the missing verb form 'suppose'.

questions.audioText: La troupe théâtrale sera protégée par de nouveaux sponsors.
questions.question: Who will protect the theater troupe?
options: New sponsors
Government officials
Theater critics
Audience members
questions.explanation: The text states 'La troupe théâtrale sera protégée par de nouveaux sponsors' - The theater troupe will be protected by new sponsors. This combines 'troupe' with the missing verb form 'protégée'.

questions.audioText: Elle empêchera la violence en organisant des discussions ouvertes.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Elle ______ la violence en organisant des discussions ouvertes.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'empêchera' (will prevent). She will prevent violence by organizing open discussions. This targets the noun 'violence' with the missing verb form 'empêchera'.

questions.audioText: L'artiste peint sur une toile blanche avec des couleurs vives.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: L'artiste peint sur une ______ blanche avec des couleurs vives.
options: toile
table
terre
tour
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'toile' (canvas). The artist paints on a white canvas with bright colors. 'Toile' refers to the fabric canvas used for painting.

questions.audioText: Le chien blessé traîne sa patte arrière en marchant lentement.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Le chien blessé traîne sa patte arrière en marchant lentement.
Le chien blessé traîne sa patte avant en marchant lentement.
Le chat blessé traîne sa patte arrière en marchant lentement.
Le chien blessé traîne sa partie arrière en marchant lentement.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'patte' (paw/leg). The injured dog drags its back paw while walking slowly. 'Patte' refers to animal limbs.

questions.audioText: Ce sac en cuir coûte exactement cent francs dans cette boutique.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Ce sac en ______ coûte exactement cent francs dans cette boutique.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'cuir' (leather). This leather bag costs exactly one hundred francs in this shop. This combines 'cuir' with the completely missing noun 'franc' from the analysis.

questions.audioText: Il paraissait nerveux quand il a acheté ce pantalon noir élégant.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Il ______ nerveux quand il a acheté ce pantalon noir élégant.
options: paraissait
paraîtrait
paraissent
paraisse
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'paraissait' (appeared/seemed). He appeared nervous when he bought these elegant black pants. This combines 'pantalon' with the missing verb form 'paraissait'.

questions.audioText: Vous vous approchez doucement de l'animal sauvage blessé.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Vous vous ______ doucement de l'animal sauvage blessé.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'approchez' (approach). You approach the injured wild animal slowly. This incorporates the under-represented topic of animals and nature.

questions.audioText: Il a épousé sa femme dans une petite église de campagne.
questions.question: What happened in the small country church?
options: He married his wife
He baptized his child
He attended a funeral
He gave a sermon
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a épousé sa femme dans une petite église de campagne' - He married his wife in a small country church. 'Épouser' means to marry someone.

questions.audioText: Elle épouse complètement cette nouvelle philosophie de vie.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Elle épouse complètement cette nouvelle philosophie de vie.
Elle écoute complètement cette nouvelle philosophie de vie.
Elle épouse complètement cette nouvelle psychologie de vie.
Elle expose complètement cette nouvelle philosophie de vie.
questions.explanation: The exact phrase was 'Elle épouse complètement cette nouvelle philosophie de vie' - She completely embraces this new philosophy of life. Here 'épouser' means to adopt or embrace (an idea or cause), not just to marry.

questions.audioText: Le suspect supposé était innocent selon les preuves découvertes.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Le suspect ______ était innocent selon les preuves découvertes.
options: supposé
supporté
surpris
soupçonné
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le suspect supposé était innocent selon les preuves découvertes.' - The alleged suspect was innocent according to the evidence discovered. The correct form is 'supposé' (supposed/alleged).

questions.audioText: Il rêvait de devenir astronaute quand il était petit.
questions.question: What did he dream of becoming when he was little?
options: An astronaut
A pilot
A scientist
A teacher
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il rêvait de devenir astronaute quand il était petit' - He dreamed of becoming an astronaut when he was little. 'Rêvait' is the imperfect form of 'rêver'.

questions.audioText: Cette nouvelle technologie conduira à des changements majeurs dans l'industrie.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Cette nouvelle technologie ______ à des changements majeurs dans l'industrie.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'conduira' (will lead). This new technology will lead to major changes in the industry. This targets technology and business topics.

questions.audioText: La nouvelle émission a été présentée hier soir à la télévision nationale.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: La nouvelle émission a été ______ hier soir à la télévision nationale.
options: présentée
présente
présentent
présenter
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'présentée' (presented). The new show was presented last night on national television. This uses the past participle in passive voice.

questions.audioText: Tu frappes toujours à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma chambre.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Tu frappes toujours à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma chambre.
Tu fermes toujours à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma chambre.
Tu frappes toujours à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma classe.
Tu frappes souvent à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma chambre.
questions.explanation: The speaker said 'Tu frappes toujours à la porte avant d'entrer dans ma chambre' - You always knock on the door before entering my room. The correct form is 'frappes' (knock). This tests exact comprehension of polite behavior and manners.

questions.audioText: Vous maintenez toujours une attitude positive malgré les difficultés.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Vous ______ toujours une attitude positive malgré les difficultés.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'maintenez' (maintain). You always maintain a positive attitude despite difficulties. This incorporates the under-represented 'positive-thinking' topic.

questions.audioText: Il gronde sourdement contre les injustices sociales.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Il gronde ______ contre les injustices sociales.
options: sourdement
sourdemment
soudainement
solidement
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'sourdement' (in a muffled way/sullenly). He grumbles sullenly against social injustices. 'Sourdement' describes a low, muffled manner of expression.

questions.audioText: Elle réagit rageusement aux commentaires négatifs sur son travail.
questions.question: How does she react to negative comments about her work?
options: Angrily
Calmly
Sadly
Indifferently
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle réagit rageusement aux commentaires négatifs sur son travail' - She reacts angrily to negative comments about her work. 'Rageusement' means in an angry/furious manner.

questions.audioText: Premièrement, nous analysons le problème, deuxièmement, nous proposons des solutions.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Premièrement, nous analysons le problème, deuxièmement, nous proposons des solutions.
Premièrement, nous analysons le problème, troisièmement, nous proposons des solutions.
Premièrement, nous analysons le problème, deuxièmement, nous trouvons des solutions.
Premièrement, nous analysons le problème, deuxièmement, nous présentons des solutions.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'deuxièmement' (secondly). First, we analyze the problem, second, we propose solutions. This adverb introduces the second point in a sequence.

questions.audioText: Les fruits poussent abondamment dans cette région fertile.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Les fruits poussent ______ dans cette région fertile.
options: abondamment
absolument
apparemment
activement
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'abondamment' (abundantly). The fruits grow abundantly in this fertile region. This incorporates agriculture and under-represented regional topics.

questions.audioText: Ma famille vit outre-mer depuis dix ans maintenant.
questions.question: Write the correct form: Ma famille vit ______ depuis dix ans maintenant.
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'outre-mer' (overseas). My family has been living overseas for ten years now. 'Outre-mer' refers to territories or regions beyond the sea.

questions.audioText: Elle cherche fébrilement ses clés dans tous les tiroirs.
questions.question: Fill in the blank: Elle cherche ______ ses clés dans tous les tiroirs.
options: fébrilement
facilement
fidèlement
finalement
questions.explanation: The correct form is 'fébrilement' (feverishly/frantically). She searches frantically for her keys in all the drawers. This describes urgent, agitated searching behavior.

questions.audioText: Il nous a invité à dîner chez lui dimanche prochain pour célébrer son anniversaire.
questions.question: What does the speaker tell us about the invitation?
options: We were invited to lunch on Sunday
We were invited to dinner on Sunday to celebrate his birthday
We were invited to celebrate our anniversary
We were invited to his house for breakfast
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il nous a invité à dîner chez lui dimanche prochain pour célébrer son anniversaire' - He invited us to dinner at his place next Sunday to celebrate his birthday. The past participle 'invité' (invited) is used here with the auxiliary verb 'avoir'.

questions.audioText: Elle a tout arrangé pour notre voyage en Provence : les hôtels, les visites et même les restaurants.
questions.question: What has she organized for the trip?
options: She arranged only the hotels for our trip
She arranged everything: hotels, visits and restaurants
She arranged the restaurants but not the hotels
She arranged the visits but nothing else
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle a tout arrangé pour notre voyage en Provence : les hôtels, les visites et même les restaurants' - She arranged everything for our trip to Provence: the hotels, the visits and even the restaurants. The past participle 'arrangé' (arranged) is used with 'avoir' to indicate completed action.

questions.audioText: Le chien a crié de douleur quand le vétérinaire a examiné sa patte blessée.
questions.question: Why did the dog cry out?
options: The dog cried because it was happy to see the vet
The dog cried out in pain when the vet examined its injured paw
The dog cried because it was afraid of the clinic
The dog cried because it wanted to go home
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le chien a crié de douleur quand le vétérinaire a examiné sa patte blessée' - The dog cried out in pain when the veterinarian examined its injured paw. The past participle 'crié' (cried/cried out) shows the completed action in the past.

questions.audioText: Vous réfléchissez trop aux conséquences négatives au lieu de profiter du moment présent et d'être optimiste.
questions.question: What advice is being given about thinking?
options: You should think more about negative consequences
You think too much about negative consequences instead of enjoying the present
You don't think enough about the consequences
You should be more pessimistic about the future
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous réfléchissez trop aux conséquences négatives au lieu de profiter du moment présent et d'être optimiste' - You think too much about negative consequences instead of enjoying the present moment and being optimistic. 'Réfléchissez' is the second person plural present tense of 'réfléchir' (to think/reflect).

questions.audioText: Marie arrangera tout le programme de la conférence avant la fin de la semaine prochaine.
questions.question: When will Marie organize the conference program?
options: Marie will arrange the program by the end of next week
Marie has already arranged the conference program
Marie will arrange the program after next week
Marie is arranging the program right now
questions.explanation: The text states 'Marie arrangera tout le programme de la conférence avant la fin de la semaine prochaine' - Marie will arrange the entire conference program before the end of next week. 'Arrangera' is the future tense of 'arranger' (to arrange), indicating a future action with a specific deadline.

questions.audioText: Les voisins crient toujours très fort le soir quand ils regardent le match de football à la télévision.
questions.question: When do the neighbors shout loudly?
options: The neighbors shout loudly in the evening when watching football on TV
The neighbors shout loudly in the morning during breakfast
The neighbors shout loudly when they argue with each other
The neighbors shout loudly when they listen to music
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les voisins crient toujours très fort le soir quand ils regardent le match de football à la télévision' - The neighbors always shout very loudly in the evening when they watch the football match on television. 'Crient' is the third person plural present tense of 'crier' (to shout/cry out), showing habitual action.

questions.audioText: Le client était complètement ivre et supposons qu'il avait trop bu pendant la dégustation de vins.
questions.question: What can we assume about the customer?
options: The customer was completely drunk and we assume he drank too much during wine tasting
The customer was tired from working all day
The customer was angry about the service
The customer was confused about the menu
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le client était complètement ivre et supposons qu'il avait trop bu pendant la dégustation de vins' - The customer was completely drunk and let's assume he had drunk too much during the wine tasting. 'Ivre' means drunk/intoxicated, and 'supposons' (let's suppose) adds a missing verb conjugation.

questions.audioText: Il faut être prudent avec ce type lâche qui pourrait nous embrasser puis nous trahir logiquement.
questions.question: What warning is given about this person?
options: We must be careful with this cowardly type who could embrace us then betray us
We should trust this person completely with our secrets
This person is very brave and will always help us
This person is too shy to make any decisions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut être prudent avec ce type lâche qui pourrait nous embrasser puis nous trahir logiquement' - We must be careful with this cowardly type who could embrace us then logically betray us. 'Lâche' means cowardly/coward, and includes missing lemmas 'embrasser' (embrace) and 'logiquement' (logically).

questions.audioText: Cette table ronde fatalement positivement conçue pour les activités créatives convient parfaitement à notre atelier.
questions.question: What type of table is described?
options: A round table designed for creative activities that suits our workshop perfectly
A square table made for dining purposes only
A broken table that needs to be repaired
A small table used for storage purposes
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette table ronde fatalement positivement conçue pour les activités créatives convient parfaitement à notre atelier' - This round table inevitably positively designed for creative activities suits our workshop perfectly. 'Rond' (round) is the target adjective, with adverbs 'fatalement' (inevitably) and 'positivement' (positively).

questions.audioText: C'est vraiment chouette que vous jures de rester modestement optimiste malgré tous les obstacles rencontrés.
questions.question: What is described as really nice?
options: It's really great that you swear to remain modestly optimistic despite all obstacles
It's nice that you are giving up on your dreams
It's great that you are becoming more pessimistic
It's nice that you are avoiding all challenges
questions.explanation: The text states 'C'est vraiment chouette que vous jures de rester modestement optimiste malgré tous les obstacles rencontrés' - It's really great that you swear to remain modestly optimistic despite all the obstacles encountered. 'Chouette' means nice/great (informal), with missing lemmas 'jures' (swear) and 'modestement' (modestly).

questions.audioText: Il est né en Provence et a grandi avidement dans ce magnifique univers méditerranéen.
questions.question: Where was he born and raised?
options: He was born in Provence and eagerly grew up in this magnificent Mediterranean universe
He was born in Paris and moved to Provence later
He was born in Italy and visited Provence often
He was born in Provence but never lived there
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il est né en Provence et a grandi avidement dans ce magnifique univers méditerranéen' - He was born in Provence and eagerly grew up in this magnificent Mediterranean universe. questions.audioText: Il fait très chaud dans le sud et l'est de la France ce weekend. Treize départements sont en alerte orange.
