questions.explanation: The text states 'Si tu refuses cette offre, tu devras forcément chercher une autre opportunité ailleurs' - If you refuse this offer, you will necessarily have to look for another opportunity elsewhere. 'Forcément' means 'necessarily/inevitably' and expresses logical consequence.

questions.audioText: Ces familles pauvres trouveront certainement des solutions créatives pour améliorer leur situation financière.
questions.question: Ces familles ______ trouveront certainement des solutions créatives pour améliorer leur situation financière.
options: pauvres
modestes
démunies
précaires
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces familles pauvres trouveront certainement des solutions créatives pour améliorer leur situation financière' - These poor families will certainly find creative solutions to improve their financial situation. 'Pauvres' means 'poor' and 'trouveront' is the future tense of 'trouver' (to find).

questions.audioText: Les étudiants heureux plaisent davantage aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats académiques.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Les étudiants heureux plaisent davantage aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats académiques.
Les étudiants heureux plaisent davantage aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats scolaires.
Les étudiants contents plaisent davantage aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats académiques.
Les étudiants heureux plaisent beaucoup aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats académiques.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Les étudiants heureux plaisent davantage aux professeurs et obtiennent de meilleurs résultats académiques' - Happy students please teachers more and achieve better academic results. 'Heureux' means 'happy' and 'plaisent' is the third person plural of 'plaire' (to please).

questions.audioText: Cette décision mauvaise va forcément créer des tensions entre les différents départements de l'entreprise.
questions.question: Cette décision ______ va forcément créer des tensions entre les différents départements de l'entreprise.
options: mauvaise
incorrecte
inadaptée
regrettable
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette décision mauvaise va forcément créer des tensions entre les différents départements de l'entreprise' - This bad decision will necessarily create tensions between the different company departments. 'Mauvaise' means 'bad' and 'forcément' means 'necessarily/inevitably'.

questions.audioText: Cette histoire drôle que nous entendons souvent fait toujours rire aux éclats.
questions.question: Cette histoire ______ que nous entendons souvent fait toujours rire aux éclats.
options: drôle
amusante
comique
marrante
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette histoire drôle que nous entendons souvent fait toujours rire aux éclats' - This funny story that we often hear always makes us burst out laughing. 'Drôle' means 'funny' and 'entendons' is the first person plural of 'entendre' (to hear).

questions.audioText: Ces quartiers tranquilles attirent les familles qui cherchent un environnement paisible pour leurs enfants.
questions.question: Ces quartiers ______ attirent les familles qui cherchent un environnement paisible pour leurs enfants.
options: tranquilles
calmes
paisibles
silencieux
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces quartiers tranquilles attirent les familles qui cherchent un environnement paisible pour leurs enfants' - These quiet neighborhoods attract families looking for a peaceful environment for their children. 'Tranquilles' means 'quiet/calm' and 'cherchent' is the present tense of 'chercher' (to look for).

questions.audioText: Cette nouvelle triste concernant la taxation affecte profondément toute la communauté locale.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Cette nouvelle triste concernant la taxation affecte profondément toute la communauté locale.
Cette nouvelle triste concernant la taxation affecte profondément toute la communauté régionale.
Cette nouvelle grave concernant la taxation affecte profondément toute la communauté locale.
Cette nouvelle triste concernant les impôts affecte profondément toute la communauté locale.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Cette nouvelle triste concernant la taxation affecte profondément toute la communauté locale' - This sad news about taxation deeply affects the entire local community. 'Triste' means 'sad' and 'profondément' means 'deeply'.

questions.audioText: Ce professeur gentil aide volontiers tous les étudiants qui rencontrent des difficultés académiques.
questions.question: Ce professeur ______ aide volontiers tous les étudiants qui rencontrent des difficultés académiques.
options: gentil
sympa
bienveillant
attentionné
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce professeur gentil aide volontiers tous les étudiants qui rencontrent des difficultés académiques' - This kind teacher gladly helps all students who encounter academic difficulties. 'Gentil' means 'kind/nice', 'volontiers' means 'willingly/gladly', and 'aide' is the present tense of 'aider' (to help).

questions.audioText: Toutes les solutions pareilles qu'ils proposent ne conviennent guère aux besoins spécifiques du projet.
questions.question: Toutes les solutions ______ qu'ils proposent ne conviennent guère aux besoins spécifiques du projet.
options: pareilles
identiques
similaires
uniformes
questions.explanation: The text states 'Toutes les solutions pareilles qu'ils proposent ne conviennent guère aux besoins spécifiques du projet' - All the similar solutions they propose hardly suit the specific needs of the project. 'Pareilles' means 'similar/alike' and 'guère' means 'hardly/scarcely'.

questions.audioText: Ces animaux vivants que nous observons là constituent un écosystème remarquable dans cette région.
questions.question: Ces animaux ______ que nous observons là constituent un écosystème remarquable dans cette région.
options: vivants
sauvages
libres
naturels
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces animaux vivants que nous observons là constituent un écosystème remarquable dans cette région' - These living animals that we observe there constitute a remarkable ecosystem in this region. 'Vivants' means 'living/alive' and 'là' means 'there' (indicating location).

questions.audioText: Cette situation dangereuse que vous décrivez nécessite évidemment une intervention immédiate des autorités.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Cette situation dangereuse que vous décrivez nécessite évidemment une intervention immédiate des autorités.
Cette situation dangereuse que vous décrivez nécessite évidemment une intervention rapide des autorités.
Cette situation grave que vous décrivez nécessite évidemment une intervention immédiate des autorités.
Cette situation dangereuse que vous décrivez nécessite certainement une intervention immédiate des autorités.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Cette situation dangereuse que vous décrivez nécessite évidemment une intervention immédiate des autorités' - This dangerous situation you describe obviously requires immediate intervention by authorities. 'Dangereuse' means 'dangerous' and 'évidemment' means 'obviously'.

questions.audioText: Mes voisins proches m'aident toujours quand j'ai besoin de quelque chose d'urgent pour la maison.
questions.question: Mes voisins ______ m'aident toujours quand j'ai besoin de quelque chose d'urgent pour la maison.
options: proches
voisins
gentils
serviables
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mes voisins proches m'aident toujours quand j'ai besoin de quelque chose d'urgent pour la maison' - My close neighbors always help me when I need something urgent for the house. 'Proches' means 'close/nearby'.

questions.audioText: Ces boissons chaudes qu'il prépare tantôt le matin tantôt le soir réconfortent tout le monde.
questions.question: Ces boissons ______ qu'il prépare tantôt le matin tantôt le soir réconfortent tout le monde.
options: chaudes
aromatisées
délicieuses
réconfortantes
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ces boissons chaudes qu'il prépare tantôt le matin tantôt le soir réconfortent tout le monde' - These hot drinks that he prepares sometimes in the morning, sometimes in the evening, comfort everyone. 'Chaudes' means 'hot/warm' and 'tantôt' means 'sometimes'.

questions.audioText: Il faut que ce restaurant vous plaise pour votre anniversaire.
questions.question: What does the speaker suggest about the restaurant?
options: It must be expensive for your birthday
It must please you for your birthday
It must be reserved for your birthday
It must be nearby for your birthday
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que ce restaurant vous plaise pour votre anniversaire' - It's necessary that this restaurant pleases you for your birthday. The subjunctive form 'plaise' is used after 'Il faut que' (it is necessary that) to express necessity or obligation.

questions.audioText: Marie s'est sentie soulagée après avoir reçu de bonnes nouvelles.
questions.question: How did Marie feel after receiving the news?
options: She felt worried
She felt relieved
She felt confused
She felt angry
questions.explanation: The text states 'Marie s'est sentie soulagée' - Marie felt relieved. The past participle 'sentie' agrees with the feminine subject Marie, and 'soulagée' means relieved.

questions.audioText: La réunion passerait au prochain moment disponible si nous avions plus de participants.
questions.question: When would the meeting be rescheduled?
options: To the previous available time
To the next available time
To next week definitely
To the same time tomorrow
questions.explanation: The text states 'La réunion passerait au prochain moment disponible' - The meeting would move to the next available time. The conditional 'passerait' expresses a hypothetical action, 'prochain' means next, and 'moment' refers to a time slot.

questions.audioText: La fille de mon voisin étudie la médecine à l'université.
questions.question: What is the neighbor's daughter studying?
options: Engineering
Medicine
Literature
Business
questions.explanation: The text states 'La fille de mon voisin étudie la médecine' - The neighbor's daughter studies medicine. The noun 'fille' can mean both girl and daughter, here meaning daughter in the family relationship context.

questions.audioText: Cette voie ferrée permet aux trains de relier rapidement les deux grandes villes industrielles.
questions.question: What does this railway line do?
options: Carries freight between factories
Connects two major industrial cities quickly
Transports tourists to scenic areas
Links rural communities to markets
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette voie ferrée permet aux trains de relier rapidement les deux grandes villes industrielles' - This railway line allows trains to quickly connect the two large industrial cities. The noun 'voie' means 'track' or 'way'.

questions.audioText: La veille du concert, tous les musiciens ont répété une dernière fois dans la salle.
questions.question: When did the musicians rehearse?
options: During the concert performance
The day before the concert
A week before the show
On the morning of the concert
questions.explanation: The text states 'La veille du concert, tous les musiciens ont répété une dernière fois dans la salle' - The day before the concert, all the musicians rehearsed one last time in the hall. The noun 'veille' means 'the day before' or 'eve'.

questions.audioText: Cette année, nous prendrons nos vacances en juillet pour profiter du beau temps estival.
questions.question: When will they take their vacation?
options: In June for the summer weather
In July to enjoy the summer weather
In August before school starts
In September when it's cooler
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette année, nous prendrons nos vacances en juillet pour profiter du beau temps estival' - This year, we will take our vacation in July to enjoy the beautiful summer weather. The noun 'vacances' (vacation) is typically used in plural form in French.

questions.audioText: Elle parle affectueusement à sa grand-mère au téléphone chaque dimanche pour maintenir le lien familial.
questions.question: How does she speak to her grandmother?
options: Formally and distantly
Affectionately and warmly
Quickly and impatiently
Loudly and clearly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle parle affectueusement à sa grand-mère au téléphone chaque dimanche pour maintenir le lien familial' - She speaks affectionately to her grandmother on the phone every Sunday to maintain the family bond. The adverb 'affectueusement' (affectionately) was missing from the lemma coverage.

questions.audioText: Il faut aller à la banque avant midi pour retirer de l'argent au distributeur automatique.
questions.question: Why does someone need to go to the bank?
options: To meet with a financial advisor
To withdraw money from the ATM
To open a new savings account
To apply for a business loan
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut aller à la banque avant midi pour retirer de l'argent au distributeur automatique' - One must go to the bank before noon to withdraw money from the ATM. The noun 'banque' means 'bank'.

questions.audioText: La chasse aux champignons commence tôt le matin quand la rosée couvre encore la forêt.
questions.question: When does mushroom hunting begin?
options: Late in the afternoon
Early in the morning when dew covers the forest
During the hottest part of the day
Just before sunset
questions.explanation: The text states 'La chasse aux champignons commence tôt le matin quand la rosée couvre encore la forêt' - Mushroom hunting begins early in the morning when the dew still covers the forest. The noun 'chasse' means 'hunt' or 'hunting'.

questions.audioText: Il est évident que cette solution technique résoudra tous nos problèmes de communication.
questions.question: What is clear about the technical solution?
options: It might help with some issues
It will obviously solve all communication problems
It needs more testing before implementation
It's too complex for our current system
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il est évident que cette solution technique résoudra tous nos problèmes de communication' - It is evident that this technical solution will solve all our communication problems. The adjective 'évident' (evident/obvious) expresses certainty.

questions.audioText: Elle a agi bravement pendant l'incendie en évacuant tous les résidents de l'immeuble.
questions.question: Elle a agi ______ pendant l'incendie en évacuant tous les résidents.
options: prudemment
rapidement
bravement
calmement
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'bravement' (bravely) - an adverb describing how she acted during the emergency. The complete text is 'Elle a agi bravement pendant l'incendie en évacuant tous les résidents de l'immeuble' - She acted bravely during the fire by evacuating all the building's residents.

questions.audioText: Il travaille méthodiquement sur chaque détail du projet pour garantir sa réussite.
questions.question: Il travaille ______ sur chaque détail du projet.
questions.explanation: The correct word is 'méthodiquement' (methodically) - an adverb describing how he works systematically on each detail. The complete text is 'Il travaille méthodiquement sur chaque détail du projet pour garantir sa réussite' - He works methodically on each detail of the project to guarantee its success.

questions.audioText: Cette tâche administrative est vraiment pénible, il faut remplir des centaines de formulaires différents.
questions.question: How is the administrative task described?
options: Quick and efficient
Really painful and tedious
Interesting and engaging
Simple and straightforward
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette tâche administrative est vraiment pénible, il faut remplir des centaines de formulaires différents' - This administrative task is really painful, you have to fill out hundreds of different forms. The adjective 'pénible' (painful/tedious) expresses difficulty and frustration.

questions.audioText: Soyez prudent en traversant cette route dangereuse, beaucoup d'accidents y arrivent chaque année.
questions.question: What advice is being given?
options: Drive faster to avoid traffic
Be careful crossing this dangerous road
Take a different route home
Call for emergency assistance
questions.explanation: The text states 'Soyez prudent en traversant cette route dangereuse, beaucoup d'accidents y arrivent chaque année' - Be careful crossing this dangerous road, many accidents happen there each year. The adjective 'prudent' (careful/cautious) gives safety advice.

questions.audioText: Ce n'est pas un restaurant quelconque, c'est un établissement gastronomique réputé dans toute la région.
questions.question: What type of restaurant is being described?
options: Any ordinary restaurant
A renowned gastronomic establishment
A simple neighborhood bistro
A fast-food chain restaurant
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce n'est pas un restaurant quelconque, c'est un établissement gastronomique réputé dans toute la région' - It's not just any restaurant, it's a gastronomic establishment renowned throughout the region. The adjective 'quelconque' (any/ordinary) is used negatively to emphasize it's special.

questions.audioText: Idem pour les autres participants qui ont exprimé des opinions similaires lors du débat.
questions.question: ______ pour les autres participants qui ont exprimé des opinions similaires.
options: Pareil
Aussi
Idem
Même
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'idem' - a Latin term used in French meaning 'the same' or 'likewise'. It's commonly used in formal contexts to indicate that the same applies to other cases. The complete text is 'Idem pour les autres participants qui ont exprimé des opinions similaires lors du débat' - Same for the other participants who expressed similar opinions during the debate.

questions.audioText: Il faut agir vigoureusement contre cette pollution industrielle qui menace notre environnement local.
questions.question: Il faut agir ______ contre cette pollution industrielle qui menace notre environnement.
options: doucement
prudemment
vigoureusement
lentement
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'vigoureusement' (vigorously) - an adverb indicating strong, energetic action is needed. The complete text is 'Il faut agir vigoureusement contre cette pollution industrielle qui menace notre environnement local' - We must act vigorously against this industrial pollution that threatens our local environment.

questions.audioText: Elle répond respectivement aux questions des journalistes selon leur ordre d'arrivée.
questions.question: Elle répond ______ aux questions des journalistes selon leur ordre d'arrivée.
questions.explanation: The correct word is 'respectivement' (respectively) - an adverb indicating she answers in corresponding order. The complete text is 'Elle répond respectivement aux questions des journalistes selon leur ordre d'arrivée' - She answers the journalists' questions respectively according to their order of arrival.

questions.audioText: Ce passage étroit entre les deux bâtiments permet aux piétons de rejoindre la place principale.
questions.question: What does the narrow passage do?
options: Connects cars to the parking area
Allows pedestrians to reach the main square
Separates the old and new buildings
Provides emergency access for vehicles
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce passage étroit entre les deux bâtiments permet aux piétons de rejoindre la place principale' - This narrow passage between the two buildings allows pedestrians to reach the main square. The adjective 'étroit' (narrow) describes the confined space.

questions.audioText: Le chat attrape rapidement la souris qui court dans le jardin.
questions.question: Le chat ______ rapidement la souris qui court dans le jardin.
options: regarde
attrape
cherche
poursuit
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'attrape' (catches) - the present tense form of 'attraper'. The complete text is 'Le chat attrape rapidement la souris qui court dans le jardin' - The cat quickly catches the mouse running in the garden.

questions.audioText: Dépêche-toi de finir tes devoirs avant que papa arrive à la maison ce soir.
questions.question: What is the speaker asking someone to do?
options: Take your time with homework
Hurry up and finish homework
Wait for dad to help with homework
Start working on homework now
questions.explanation: The text states 'Dépêche-toi de finir tes devoirs avant que papa arrive à la maison ce soir' - Hurry up and finish your homework before dad gets home tonight. The verb 'dépêche-toi' (hurry up) indicates urgency.

questions.audioText: Le pilote d'avion suit grandement les procédures de sécurité pour assurer un vol sans problème.
questions.question: How does the pilot follow safety procedures?
options: Minimally and reluctantly
Greatly and thoroughly
Occasionally when required
Only during takeoff and landing
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le pilote d'avion suit grandement les procédures de sécurité pour assurer un vol sans problème' - The airplane pilot greatly follows safety procedures to ensure a problem-free flight. The adverb 'grandement' (greatly) emphasizes the extent of compliance. This targets the under-represented 'aviation' topic.

questions.audioText: Vous craignez probablement que cette nouvelle loi ne change votre situation financière actuelle.
questions.question: Vous ______ probablement que cette nouvelle loi ne change votre situation financière.
questions.explanation: The correct word is 'craignez' (fear/are afraid) - the formal 'vous' form of 'craindre'. The complete text is 'Vous craignez probablement que cette nouvelle loi ne change votre situation financière actuelle' - You probably fear that this new law will change your current financial situation.

questions.audioText: Le voleur a été attrapé par la police après avoir cambriolé plusieurs maisons du quartier.
questions.question: What happened to the thief?
options: He escaped from the neighborhood
He was caught by the police
He confessed to his crimes
He returned the stolen items
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le voleur a été attrapé par la police après avoir cambriolé plusieurs maisons du quartier' - The thief was caught by the police after burglarizing several houses in the neighborhood. The past participle 'attrapé' shows the completed action.

questions.audioText: Il abandonne bonnement son projet après avoir compris que c'était trop difficile pour lui.
questions.question: How does he abandon his project?
options: Reluctantly and with anger
Simply and honestly
Secretly without telling anyone
Dramatically with great emotion
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il abandonne bonnement son projet après avoir compris que c'était trop difficile pour lui' - He simply abandons his project after understanding it was too difficult for him. The adverb 'bonnement' (simply/honestly) indicates a straightforward acceptance.

questions.audioText: Nous remercions sincèrement tous les bénévoles qui ont participé à cette campagne de solidarité.
questions.question: Nous ______ sincèrement tous les bénévoles qui ont participé à cette campagne.
options: félicitons
remercions
encourageons
soutenons
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'remercions' (thank) - the 'nous' form of 'remercier'. The complete text is 'Nous remercions sincèrement tous les bénévoles qui ont participé à cette campagne de solidarité' - We sincerely thank all the volunteers who participated in this solidarity campaign.

questions.audioText: Cette maison abandonnée depuis vingt ans cache aimablement ses secrets dans chaque pièce poussiéreuse.
questions.question: How does the abandoned house hide its secrets?
options: Mysteriously and darkly
Kindly and gently
Completely and totally
Carefully and deliberately
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette maison abandonnée depuis vingt ans cache aimablement ses secrets dans chaque pièce poussiéreuse' - This house abandoned for twenty years kindly hides its secrets in each dusty room. The adverb 'aimablement' (kindly) personifies the house in a gentle way.

questions.audioText: Cet homme étranger ne parle pas français et cherche des directions pour aller à l'hôtel.
questions.question: What can we understand about this man?
options: He speaks French fluently
He's a foreign man looking for hotel directions
He works at the local tourist office
He's visiting friends in the neighborhood
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet homme étranger ne parle pas français et cherche des directions pour aller à l'hôtel' - This foreign man doesn't speak French and is looking for directions to get to the hotel. The adjective 'étranger' (foreign/stranger) indicates he's from another country.

questions.audioText: L'astronaute observe les étoiles depuis la station spatiale internationale pendant sa mission scientifique.
questions.question: Where is the astronaut observing from?
options: From a ground-based observatory
From the international space station
From a high-altitude aircraft
From a mountain telescope facility
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'astronaute observe les étoiles depuis la station spatiale internationale pendant sa mission scientifique' - The astronaut observes the stars from the international space station during their scientific mission. This targets the under-represented 'space' topic.

questions.audioText: Mon camarade de classe m'aide toujours avec les exercices de mathématiques les plus difficiles.
questions.question: Who helps the speaker with math?
options: The mathematics teacher
A private tutor at home
Their classmate and friend
An older student volunteer
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon camarade de classe m'aide toujours avec les exercices de mathématiques les plus difficiles' - My classmate always helps me with the most difficult math exercises. The noun 'camarade' (classmate/comrade) refers to a fellow student who provides assistance.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu comprennes que dire merci est vraiment sympa et important.
questions.question: What should you understand about saying thanks?
options: It's unnecessary
It's really nice and important
It's only for adults
It's too formal
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu comprennes que dire merci est vraiment sympa et important' - You must understand that saying thanks is really nice and important. 'Comprennes' is subjunctive, 'merci' means thanks, and 'sympa' means nice/kind.

questions.audioText: Les habitants vivaient au bout de la forêt verte, totalement isolés de la ville polluée.
questions.question: Where did the inhabitants live in relation to the polluted city?
options: Partially connected to it
Totally isolated from it
Right next to it
Occasionally visiting it
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les habitants vivaient au bout de la forêt verte, totalement isolés de la ville polluée' - The inhabitants lived at the edge of the green forest, totally isolated from the polluted city. 'Vivaient' is imperfect tense, 'bout' means end/edge, 'verte' means green, and 'totalement' means totally.

questions.audioText: Une intervention internationale a été demandée pour mettre fin à cette guerre qui affaiblit réellement la population civile.
questions.question: What has been requested to end the war?
options: International intervention
Economic sanctions
Military supplies
Media coverage
questions.explanation: The text states 'Une intervention internationale a été demandée pour mettre fin à cette guerre' - International intervention has been requested to end this war. 'Demandée' is past participle of demander (to request), 'guerre' means war, and 'réellement' means really.

questions.audioText: Cette formation générale rendrait précisément plus de chances à tous les candidats pour obtenir l'emploi.
questions.question: What would the general training precisely give to all candidates?
options: More chances
Higher salary
Better schedule
Immediate promotion
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette formation générale rendrait précisément plus de chances à tous les candidats' - This general training would precisely give more chances to all candidates. 'Rendrait' is conditional of rendre (to give/make), 'chance' means opportunity, 'général' means general, and 'précisément' means precisely.

questions.audioText: Cette fois-ci, nous devons absolument réussir ce projet important avant la deadline fixée par notre client.
questions.question: When must they succeed with the project?
options: This time
Next time
Last time
Every time
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette fois-ci, nous devons absolument réussir' - This time, we absolutely must succeed. 'Fois' means time/occasion, and 'cette fois-ci' emphasizes 'this time' specifically.

questions.audioText: Une chose très étrange s'est passée hier soir dans notre quartier résidentiel, selon plusieurs témoins.
questions.question: What happened in the residential neighborhood?
options: Something very strange
A normal event
Nothing important
A celebration
questions.explanation: The text states 'Une chose très étrange s'est passée hier soir dans notre quartier résidentiel, selon plusieurs témoins' - Something very strange happened last night in our residential neighborhood, according to several witnesses. 'Chose' means thing or something, and here it refers to an unspecified strange event.

questions.audioText: Cette rue commerçante sera entièrement rénovée l'année prochaine pour améliorer l'expérience des visiteurs.
questions.question: When will the commercial street be renovated?
options: Next year
This month
Last year
Next month
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette rue commerçante sera entièrement rénovée l'année prochaine' - This commercial street will be completely renovated next year. 'Rue' means street.
questions.source: Urban development and commercial district renovation

questions.audioText: Beaucoup de gens pensent que les technologies modernes changent rapidement notre manière de communiquer.
questions.question: What do many people think about modern technologies?
options: They change how we communicate
They are too expensive
They are difficult to use
They should be avoided
questions.explanation: The text states 'Beaucoup de gens pensent que les technologies modernes changent rapidement notre manière de communiquer' - Many people think that modern technologies are rapidly changing our way of communicating. 'Gens' means people.
questions.source: Public opinion on modern technology and communication

questions.audioText: Cet homme très beau croirait apparemment que tous les gens l'admirent sincèrement.
questions.question: What would the handsome man apparently believe?
options: That everyone admires him
That he needs improvement
That looks don't matter
That people are jealous
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet homme très beau croirait apparemment que tous les gens l'admirent' - This very handsome man would apparently believe that everyone admires him. 'Beau' means handsome, 'homme' means man, 'croirait' is conditional of croire (to believe), and 'apparemment' means apparently.

questions.audioText: Cette jeune femme croit que sa tête n'est pas suffisamment protégée pendant les activités sportives.
questions.question: What does the young woman believe about her head?
options: It's not sufficiently protected
It's too heavy for sports
It's perfectly safe
It needs more exercise
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette jeune femme croit que sa tête n'est pas suffisamment protégée' - This young woman believes that her head is not sufficiently protected. 'Jeune' means young, 'tête' means head, 'croit' means believes, and 'suffisamment' means sufficiently.
questions.source: Sports safety and protective equipment concerns

questions.audioText: Le secouriste n'était pas sûr que ce corps blessé attendrait effectivement l'arrivée de l'ambulance sans complications.
questions.question: What was the first responder unsure about?
options: Whether the injured person would wait without complications
How to perform CPR correctly
Which hospital to call
Where to find medical supplies
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le secouriste n'était pas sûr que ce corps blessé attendrait effectivement l'arrivée de l'ambulance sans complications' - The first responder wasn't sure that this injured body would effectively wait for the ambulance's arrival without complications. 'Corps' means body, 'sûr' means sure, 'attendrait' is conditional of attendre (to wait), and 'effectivement' means effectively.

questions.audioText: L'infirmière pensera qu'il est possible de réanimer ce cœur en pratiquant régulièrement des compressions thoraciques.
questions.question: What does the nurse believe can be accomplished?
options: To revive the heart with regular compressions
To perform surgery immediately
To move the patient quickly
To call for more help
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'infirmière pensera qu'il est possible de réanimer ce cœur en pratiquant régulièrement des compressions thoraciques.' - The nurse will think that it is possible to revive this heart by regularly performing chest compressions. 'Pensera' is future of penser (to think), 'réanimer' means to revive, 'cœur' means heart, and 'compressions thoraciques' means chest compressions.

questions.audioText: Chaque fois que le clown entrait en scène, on sentait une vague de rire monter dans le public. Son humour était si contagieux que même les plus sérieux ne pouvaient s'empêcher de sourire.
questions.question: What was the common feeling when the clown appeared?
options: A sense of fear
A wave of laughter
A feeling of sadness
A moment of silence
questions.explanation: The text states 'Chaque fois que le clown entrait en scène, on sentait une vague de rire monter dans le public' - Every time the clown entered the stage, one felt a wave of laughter rising in the audience. The verb 'sentait' is the imparfait tense of 'sentir' (to feel).

questions.audioText: Sur une plage du Pas-de-Calais, un gendarme a percé l'embarcation de migrants qui étaient sur le point de débarquer. Un geste contraire au droit international mais salué par le Royaume-Uni.
questions.question: What action did the gendarme take regarding the migrants' boat?
options: He punctured the boat to prevent landing
He helped them safely reach shore
He provided them with life jackets
He called for additional rescue boats
questions.explanation: The text states 'Sur une plage du Pas-de-Calais, un gendarme a percé l'embarcation de migrants qui étaient sur le point de débarquer' - On a beach in Pas-de-Calais, a gendarme punctured the migrants' boat who were about to land. 'Percé' means punctured/pierced, 'embarcation' means boat/vessel, and 'débarquer' means to land/disembark. The text notes this action was contrary to international law but praised by the UK.
questions.source: News report on migrant boat incident in Pas-de-Calais

questions.audioText: Cette nouvelle était infiniment plus difficile à accepter que toute autre peine attendue dans sa vie professionnelle.
questions.question: How did the person feel about this news compared to other difficulties?
options: It was infinitely more difficult to accept
It was slightly easier to understand
It was completely expected
It was moderately challenging
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette nouvelle était infiniment plus difficile à accepter que toute autre peine attendue dans sa vie professionnelle' - This news was infinitely more difficult to accept than any other hardship expected in their professional life. 'Infiniment' means infinitely, 'peine' means hardship/trouble, and 'attendue' is the past participle of attendre (to expect).

questions.audioText: Je ne croyais pas que vous croyiez carrément que cette terre appartenait à votre famille depuis toujours.
questions.question: What didn't the speaker believe?
options: That they really believed the land belonged to their family
That the land was recently purchased
That the family owned multiple properties
That they had legal documents for the land
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je ne croyais pas que vous croyiez carrément que cette terre appartenait à votre famille depuis toujours' - I didn't believe that you really believed that this land belonged to your family forever. 'Croyiez' is the imperfect subjunctive of croire (to believe), 'carrément' means really/completely, and 'terre' means land/earth.
questions.source: Property ownership and family inheritance discussion

questions.audioText: Je penserai terriblement à ce coup dur quand je reviendrai de voyage la semaine prochaine.
questions.question: When will the speaker think about the difficult situation?
options: When they return from their trip next week
Before they leave on their journey
During their vacation time
After they finish their work project
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je penserai terriblement à ce coup dur quand je reviendrai de voyage la semaine prochaine' - I will think terribly about this hard blow when I return from my trip next week. 'Penserai' is the future tense of penser (to think), 'terriblement' means terribly/extremely, and 'coup' means blow/strike (in 'coup dur' = hard blow/setback).
questions.source: Travel and personal reflection on difficult situations

questions.audioText: En croyant fermement cela, elle ne vit pas que son oeil gauche commençait à présenter des signes d'irritation inquiétants.
questions.question: What did the woman fail to notice while strongly believing something?
options: That her left eye was showing worrying signs of irritation
That her vision was improving significantly
That her glasses needed replacement
That her headaches were getting worse
questions.explanation: The text states 'En croyant fermement cela, elle ne vit pas que son oeil gauche commençait à présenter des signes d'irritation inquiétants' - While firmly believing that, she didn't see that her left eye was beginning to show worrying signs of irritation. 'Croyant' is the present participle of croire (to believe), 'cela' means that (formal), and 'oeil' means eye.

questions.audioText: Il faut que tu croies que Dieu existe au-delà de toutes nos compréhensions humaines limitées et terrestres.
questions.question: What does the speaker want the listener to believe about God?
options: That God exists beyond all human understanding
That God is easily comprehensible to everyone
That God only exists in religious buildings
That God communicates directly with humans daily
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut que tu croies que Dieu existe au-delà de toutes nos compréhensions humaines limitées et terrestres' - You must believe that God exists beyond all our limited and earthly human understandings. 'Croies' is the subjunctive of croire (to believe), 'Dieu' means God, and 'au-delà' means beyond.

questions.audioText: Ce type était vachement beau mais son coup de théâtre final a révélé sa véritable personnalité manipulatrice et calculatrice.
questions.question: What did the man's final dramatic gesture reveal?
options: His true manipulative and calculating personality
His genuine love and affection for others
His complete honesty and transparency
His natural shyness and humility
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce type était vachement beau mais son coup de théâtre final a révélé sa véritable personnalité manipulatrice et calculatrice' - This guy was really handsome but his final dramatic gesture revealed his true manipulative and calculating personality. 'Vachement' means really/very (informal), 'beau' means handsome/beautiful, and 'coup' means blow/strike (in 'coup de théâtre' = dramatic turn).

questions.audioText: Là-dessus, ce gros corps musclé s'effondra complètement, révélant l'épuisement accumulé pendant des mois d'entraînement intensif.
questions.question: What happened to the muscular body at that point?
options: It collapsed completely from accumulated exhaustion
It became stronger than ever before
It started recovering its energy rapidly
It showed no signs of fatigue
questions.explanation: The text states 'Là-dessus, ce gros corps musclé s'effondra complètement, révélant l'épuisement accumulé pendant des mois' - At that point, this big muscular body collapsed completely, revealing the exhaustion accumulated over months. 'Là-dessus' means at that point/thereupon, 'gros' means big/large, and 'corps' means body.

questions.audioText: Cet homme bas et drôlement silencieux observait discrètement chaque détail du comportement suspect de ses collègues.
questions.question: How was the man observing his colleagues?
options: Discretely and strangely quietly
Openly and very loudly
Carelessly and without attention
Aggressively and confrontationally
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cet homme bas et drôlement silencieux observait discrètement chaque détail du comportement suspect' - This short and strangely quiet man was discretely observing every detail of his colleagues' suspicious behavior. 'Homme' means man, 'bas' means short/low, and 'drôlement' means strangely/weirdly.

questions.audioText: Ce jour-là, il était décidément impossible de prévoir les événements extraordinaires qui allaient transformer notre perspective.
questions.question: What was impossible to predict that day?
options: The extraordinary events that would transform their perspective
The ordinary routine that would continue unchanged
The simple tasks they had planned to complete
The normal weather patterns for the season
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce jour-là, il était décidément impossible de prévoir les événements extraordinaires qui allaient transformer notre perspective' - That day, it was decidedly impossible to predict the extraordinary events that were going to transform our perspective. 'Jour' means day, 'décidément' means decidedly/definitely, and the phrase describes unpredictable transformative events.
questions.source: Unexpected life-changing events and perspective shifts

questions.audioText: Au-dessous de cette table se cache infiniment plus de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Au-dessous de cette table se cache infiniment plus de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer.
Au-dessus de cette table se cache infiniment plus de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer.
Au-dessous de cette table se cache simplement plus de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer.
Au-dessous de cette table se cache infiniment moins de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Au-dessous de cette table se cache infiniment plus de poussière que vous ne pourriez l'imaginer' - Under this table hides infinitely more dust than you could imagine. 'Au-dessous' means underneath/below and 'infiniment' means infinitely/extremely. The other options change these key adverbs or the meaning.
questions.source: Household cleaning and hidden mess discovery

questions.audioText: Çà, c'est visiblement faux et vous le savez très bien.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Çà, c'est visiblement faux et vous le savez très bien.
Ça, c'est visiblement faux et vous le savez très bien.
Çà, c'est clairement faux et vous le savez très bien.
Çà, c'est visiblement vrai et vous le savez très bien.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Çà, c'est visiblement faux et vous le savez très bien.' - That is obviously false and you know it very well. The correct phrase uses 'Çà' (that, informal spelling) and 'visiblement' (visibly/obviously).

questions.audioText: Le roi construisit un magnifique palais avec des tours dorées et des jardins extraordinaires.
questions.question: What did the king build?
options: A simple castle with basic rooms
A magnificent palace with golden towers
A large church with tall spires
A military fortress with strong walls
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le roi construisit un magnifique palais avec des tours dorées et des jardins extraordinaires' - The king built a magnificent palace with golden towers and extraordinary gardens. The noun 'palais' (palace) refers to a grand royal residence.

questions.audioText: Il parle gentiment mais pratiquement personne ne l'écoute vraiment.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Il parle gentiment mais pratiquement personne ne l'écoute vraiment.
Il parle poliment mais pratiquement personne ne l'écoute vraiment.
Il parle gentiment mais certainement personne ne l'écoute vraiment.
Il parle gentiment mais pratiquement personne ne l'entend vraiment.
questions.explanation: The correct phrase is 'Il parle gentiment mais pratiquement personne ne l'écoute vraiment' - He speaks kindly but practically no one really listens to him. 'Gentiment' means kindly/nicely and 'pratiquement' means practically/virtually. The other options change these adverbs or the verb 'écoute'.

questions.audioText: L'IA pourrait-elle devenir psychologue ? Sur les réseaux sociaux, de nombreux jeunes racontent qu'ils utilisent cet agent conversationnel pour échanger sur leurs soucis du quotidien, plutôt que d'aller voir un psy.
questions.question: What do many young people say they use the conversational agent for?
options: To discuss their daily concerns instead of seeing a psychologist
To replace all human social interactions completely
To get medical prescriptions and treatments
To learn advanced programming and coding skills
questions.explanation: The text states 'de nombreux jeunes racontent qu'ils utilisent cet agent conversationnel pour échanger sur leurs soucis du quotidien, plutôt que d'aller voir un psy' - many young people say they use this conversational agent to discuss their daily concerns, rather than going to see a psychologist. The question explores AI's role in mental health support among youth.
questions.source: News report on AI and youth mental health trends

questions.audioText: Ce cœur brisé avait spécialement besoin de temps et de patience pour guérir complètement de cette peine profonde.
questions.question: What did the broken heart especially need?
options: Time and patience to heal completely
Immediate medical intervention
Complete isolation from others
Aggressive therapeutic treatment
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce cœur brisé avait spécialement besoin de temps et de patience pour guérir complètement de cette peine profonde' - This broken heart especially needed time and patience to heal completely from this deep pain. 'Spécialement' means especially/particularly, 'cœur' means heart, and 'peine' means pain/sorrow.
questions.source: Emotional healing and recovery from heartbreak

questions.audioText: Son oeil s'ouvrit subitement quand il entendit ce coup violent frapper à la porte de sa chambre.
questions.question: What happened to his eye when he heard the noise?
options: It opened suddenly
It closed tightly
It began to water
It remained unchanged
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son oeil s'ouvrit subitement quand il entendit ce coup violent frapper à la porte' - His eye opened suddenly when he heard this violent knock at the door. 'Subitement' means suddenly/abruptly, 'oeil' means eye, and 'coup' means blow/knock.

questions.audioText: Son regard sincèrement inquiet révélait qu'elle avait brutalement compris la gravité de la situation familiale complexe.
questions.question: What did her look sincerely reveal?
options: That she had brutally understood the gravity of the situation
That she was completely confused about everything
That she felt totally relieved and relaxed
That she had no concern about the matter
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son regard sincèrement inquiet révélait qu'elle avait brutalement compris la gravité de la situation' - Her sincerely worried look revealed that she had brutally understood the gravity of the situation. 'Regard' means look/gaze, 'sincèrement' means sincerely, and 'brutalement' means brutally/harshly.

questions.audioText: Son corps tremblait beaucoup après avoir lu ce livre très émouvant qu'il ne pouvait plus oublier.
questions.question: How was his body reacting after reading the book?
options: It was trembling a lot
It was completely still and calm
It was moving energetically and confidently
It showed no physical reaction at all
questions.explanation: The text states 'Son corps tremblait beaucoup après avoir lu ce livre très émouvant qu'il ne pouvait plus oublier' - His body was trembling a lot after reading this very moving book that he could no longer forget. 'Corps' means body, 'beaucoup' means a lot, and 'émouvant' means moving/touching.

questions.audioText: Le drap noir était quasi entièrement couvert de peinture après l'accident de rénovation qui avait compliqué tous les travaux hospitaliers.
questions.question: What was the black sheet almost entirely covered with?
options: Paint after a renovation accident that complicated hospital work
Blood from a medical procedure in the hospital
Water from a broken pipe in the operating room
Dust from old equipment being moved around
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le drap noir était quasi entièrement couvert de peinture après l'accident de rénovation qui avait compliqué tous les travaux hospitaliers.' - The black sheet was almost entirely covered with paint after the renovation accident that complicated all hospital work. 'Quasi' means almost/nearly, 'noir' means black, and 'peinture' means paint.
questions.source: Medical accident trauma in surgical setting

questions.audioText: Il semble fortement impossible que cette politique de privatisation des services publics puisse réellement bénéficier aux citoyens ordinaires.
questions.question: What seems strongly impossible according to the text?
options: That privatization policy could truly benefit ordinary citizens
That public services should remain under government control
That privatization always improves service quality significantly
That citizens want more government involvement in services
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il semble fortement impossible que cette politique de privatisation des services publics puisse réellement bénéficier aux citoyens ordinaires' - It seems strongly impossible that this public service privatization policy could really benefit ordinary citizens. 'Fortement' means strongly/heavily, 'impossible' means impossible, and the text expresses skepticism about privatization benefits.

questions.audioText: La vie moderne nous oblige souvent à faire des choix difficiles entre notre carrière professionnelle et notre épanouissement personnel.
questions.question: What does the speaker say about modern life?
options: It often forces us to make difficult choices between our professional career and personal fulfillment
It provides many opportunities for both career and personal development
It makes it easier to balance work and personal life than before
It eliminates the need to choose between work and personal interests
questions.explanation: The text states 'La vie moderne nous oblige souvent à faire des choix difficiles entre notre carrière professionnelle et notre épanouissement personnel.' - Modern life often forces us to make difficult choices between our professional career and personal fulfillment. 'Vie' means life, and this explores life's complexities.

questions.audioText: Son visage exprimait une profonde tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son licenciement inattendu.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Son visage exprimait une profonde tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son licenciement inattendu.
Son visage exprimait une profonde tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son divorce inattendu.
Son courage exprimait une profonde tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son licenciement inattendu.
Son visage exprimait une grande tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son licenciement inattendu.
questions.explanation: La phrase exacte était 'Son visage exprimait une profonde tristesse quand elle a appris la nouvelle de son licenciement inattendu.' - Her face expressed deep sadness when she learned the news of her unexpected dismissal. 'Visage' means face, and this shows emotional expression.

questions.audioText: L'amour que nous partageons depuis quinze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie quotidienne.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: L'amour que nous partageons depuis quinze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie quotidienne.
L'amour que nous partageons depuis quinze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie moderne.
L'amitié que nous partageons depuis quinze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie quotidienne.
L'amour que nous partageons depuis quatorze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie quotidienne.
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'amour que nous partageons depuis quinze ans continue de grandir malgré les difficultés de la vie quotidienne' - The love we have shared for fifteen years continues to grow despite the difficulties of daily life. 'Amour' means love, expressing enduring romantic relationships.

questions.audioText: Cette idée est excellente, mais j'ai envie de partager la mienne avec l'équipe aussi.
questions.question: What does the speaker want to do?
options: Share their own idea with the team as well
Take credit for the excellent idea
Replace the excellent idea with theirs
Discuss the idea privately first
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Cette idée est excellente, mais j'ai envie de partager la mienne avec l'équipe aussi' - That idea is excellent, but I want to share mine with the team as well. 'La mienne' means 'mine' (feminine form) and 'envie' means 'desire' or 'want'.

questions.audioText: Honnêtement, ce consultant financier n'a pas donné les bons conseils à mes clients.
questions.question: What is the speaker's opinion about the financial consultant?
options: The consultant didn't give good advice to their clients
The consultant was very honest with their clients
The consultant charged too much for their services
The consultant needs more time to help their clients
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Honnêtement, ce consultant financier n'a pas donné les bons conseils à mes clients' - Honestly, this financial consultant didn't give good advice to my clients. 'Honnêtement' means 'honestly' or 'frankly'.

questions.audioText: Les lumières de Rome brillaient faiblement dans la brume matinale quand nous sommes arrivés.
questions.question: How were the lights of Rome described?
options: They were shining faintly in the morning mist
They were completely invisible in the fog
They were sparkling brightly in the sunshine
They were flickering on and off frequently
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Les lumières de Rome brillaient faiblement dans la brume matinale quand nous sommes arrivés' - The lights of Rome were shining faintly in the morning mist when we arrived. 'Faiblement' means 'faintly' or 'weakly'.

questions.audioText: Les personnes de plus de soixante-cinq ans bénéficient d'une réduction sur les billets de train.
questions.question: Who gets a discount on train tickets?
options: People over sixty-five years old
People under twenty-five years old
People traveling with children
People with frequent traveler cards
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Les personnes de plus de soixante-cinq ans bénéficient d'une réduction sur les billets de train' - People over sixty-five years old benefit from a discount on train tickets. 'Âge' relates to the age requirement mentioned.

questions.audioText: Quoi? Ces règlements changent bizarrement chaque mois au bureau.
questions.question: What does the speaker find strange?
options: The regulations change oddly every month at work
The meetings happen strangely every week
The deadlines move weirdly every quarter
The schedules shift randomly every day
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Quoi? Ces règlements changent bizarrement chaque mois au bureau' - What? These regulations change oddly every month at the office. 'Quoi' expresses surprise, 'bizarrement' means 'oddly/strangely'.

questions.audioText: Contrairement aux prédictions, les agriculteurs sont heureux des nouvelles politiques commerciales.
questions.question: How do farmers feel about the new trade policies?
options: Happy, contrary to predictions
Worried, as expected
Confused about the changes
Angry about the delays
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Contrairement aux prédictions, les agriculteurs sont heureux des nouvelles politiques commerciales' - Contrary to predictions, farmers are happy about the new trade policies. 'Contrairement' means 'contrary to' and 'heureux' means 'happy'.

questions.audioText: Mon carnet est plein d'idées créatives développées au fond de mon esprit.
questions.question: What is the speaker's notebook full of?
options: Creative ideas developed deep in their mind
Important business contacts and numbers
Daily tasks and urgent reminders
Financial calculations and budgets
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Mon carnet est plein d'idées créatives développées au fond de mon esprit' - My notebook is full of creative ideas developed deep in my mind. 'Plein' means 'full', 'fond' means 'depth/deep part'.

questions.audioText: Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal au pied droit et boitait légèrement.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal au pied droit et boitait légèrement.
Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal au pied droit et boitaient légèrement.
Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal au pieds droit et boitait légèrement.
Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal aux pied droit et boitait légèrement.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Après cette longue randonnée en montagne, il avait mal au pied droit et boitait légèrement.' - 'After this long mountain hike, he had pain in his right foot and was limping slightly.' This tests the high-frequency noun 'pied' (foot) in a hiking injury context.

questions.audioText: Elle a fermé sa bouche rapidement après avoir réalisé son erreur embarrassante devant tous ses collègues.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Elle a fermé sa bouche rapidement après avoir réalisé son erreur embarrassante devant tous ses collègues.
Elle a fermé sa bouche rapidement après avoir réalisée son erreur embarrassante devant tous ses collègues.
Elle a fermé sa bouche rapidement après avoir réalisé son erreur embarrassante devant tous ces collègues.
Elle a fermé son bouche rapidement après avoir réalisé son erreur embarrassante devant tous ses collègues.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle a fermé sa bouche rapidement après avoir réalisé son erreur embarrassante devant tous ses collègues.' - 'She closed her mouth quickly after realizing her embarrassing mistake in front of all her colleagues.' This tests the high-frequency noun 'bouche' (mouth) in a workplace embarrassment context.

questions.audioText: Essayons cette nouvelle recette de cuisine française traditionnelle ce week-end.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Essayons cette nouvelle recette de cuisine française traditionnelle ce week-end.
Essayons cette nouvelle recette de cuisine italienne traditionnelle ce week-end.
Essayez cette nouvelle recette de cuisine française traditionnelle ce week-end.
Essaierons cette nouvelle recette de cuisine française traditionnelle ce week-end.
questions.explanation: The speaker said 'Essayons cette nouvelle recette de cuisine française traditionnelle ce week-end.' - Let's try this new traditional French cooking recipe this weekend. 'Essayons' is the first person plural present imperative of 'essayer' (to try).

questions.audioText: Ma grand-mère jouait du piano tous les dimanches après-midi quand j'étais petit.
questions.question: What did the grandmother do every Sunday afternoon?
options: She played the piano
She cooked traditional meals
She read stories aloud
She worked in her garden
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ma grand-mère jouait du piano tous les dimanches après-midi quand j'étais petit' - My grandmother played the piano every Sunday afternoon when I was little. 'Jouait' is the imperfect form of 'jouer' (to play), describing a past habit with the temporal clause repositioned.

questions.audioText: J'appellerai le médecin dès demain matin pour prendre rendez-vous rapidement.
questions.question: J'______ le médecin dès demain matin pour prendre rendez-vous rapidement.
options: appellerai
appelle
appelais
appellerais
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'appellerai le médecin dès demain matin pour prendre rendez-vous rapidement' - I will call the doctor first thing tomorrow morning to make an appointment quickly. 'Appellerai' is the 1st person singular future tense of 'appeler' (to call), 'dès' means as soon as, and 'rapidement' means quickly.

questions.audioText: Les experts pensent que cette nouvelle technologie révolutionnera peut-être complètement notre façon de travailler.
questions.question: What do the experts think about the new technology?
options: It might completely revolutionize how we work
It will definitely improve workplace efficiency
It could replace all current technology
It may cause problems in the workplace
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les experts pensent que cette nouvelle technologie révolutionnera peut-être complètement notre façon de travailler' - The experts think that this new technology might completely revolutionize our way of working. The adverb 'peut-être' indicates uncertainty or possibility.

questions.audioText: Aujourd'hui, je dois prendre une décision importante concernant mon avenir professionnel.
questions.question: When does the speaker need to make an important decision?
options: Today
Tomorrow
Next week
Eventually
questions.explanation: The text states 'Aujourd'hui, je dois prendre une décision importante concernant mon avenir professionnel' - Today, I must make an important decision concerning my professional future. 'Aujourd'hui' means 'today'.

questions.audioText: Ma sœur habite là-bas, dans cette petite ville près de la montagne.
questions.question: Where does the speaker's sister live?
options: Over there, in a small town near the mountain
Here, in the same city as the speaker
Far away, in another country
Nearby, in the next neighborhood
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ma sœur habite là-bas, dans cette petite ville près de la montagne' - My sister lives over there, in that small town near the mountain. 'Là-bas' means 'over there' and indicates a location that is somewhat distant from the speaker.

questions.audioText: D'abord, nous devons analyser le problème, puis proposer des solutions concrètes.
questions.question: What should they do first according to the speaker?
options: Analyze the problem
Propose concrete solutions
Discuss with colleagues
Implement immediate changes
questions.explanation: The text states 'D'abord, nous devons analyser le problème, puis proposer des solutions concrètes' - First, we must analyze the problem, then propose concrete solutions. 'D'abord' means 'first' or 'firstly' and indicates the initial step in a sequence.

questions.audioText: Je sens que cette décision va changer beaucoup de choses dans notre entreprise.
questions.question: How does the speaker feel about the decision?
options: They sense it will change many things in their company
They think it will improve company profits
They believe it will cause major problems
They feel it won't have much impact
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je sens que cette décision va changer beaucoup de choses dans notre entreprise' - I sense/feel that this decision will change many things in our company. The verb 'sens' (from 'sentir') means to sense, feel, or have an intuition about something.

questions.audioText: Attention! Il faut protéger tes yeux quand tu regardes le soleil.
questions.question: What part of the body should be protected?
options: Eyes
Hands
Face
Head
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il faut protéger tes yeux quand tu regardes le soleil' - You must protect your eyes when you look at the sun. 'Yeux' is the plural form of 'œil' (eye), and the warning is about eye protection from solar damage.

questions.audioText: Cette chemise bleu marine va parfaitement avec ton pantalon gris.
questions.question: What color is the shirt?
options: Navy blue
Light blue
Dark gray
Pure white
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette chemise bleu marine va parfaitement avec ton pantalon gris' - This navy blue shirt goes perfectly with your gray pants. 'Bleu marine' specifically means 'navy blue', a dark shade of blue commonly used in clothing.

questions.audioText: Il rentre toujours tard du bureau, vers vingt heures.
questions.question: When does he come home from the office?
options: Always late, around 8 PM
Early in the evening
At lunchtime
Very early in the morning
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il rentre toujours tard du bureau, vers vingt heures' - He always comes home late from the office, around 8 PM. 'Rentre' (from 'rentrer') means to return home.

questions.audioText: Tiens! Je ne savais pas que tu étais déjà arrivé.
questions.question: What does the speaker express?
options: Surprise at seeing the person already arrived
Disappointment that they are late
Anger about the timing
Confusion about the location
questions.explanation: The text states 'Tiens! Je ne savais pas que tu étais déjà arrivé' - Well! I didn't know you had already arrived. 'Tiens!' is an exclamation expressing surprise or mild astonishment.

questions.audioText: Au-dessus de la cheminée, il y a un magnifique tableau ancien.
questions.question: Where is the magnificent old painting located?
options: Above the fireplace
Next to the window
Behind the sofa
On the dining table
questions.explanation: The text states 'Au-dessus de la cheminée, il y a un magnifique tableau ancien' - Above the fireplace, there is a magnificent old painting. 'Au-dessus de' means 'above' or 'over'.

questions.audioText: Cette région était immense et totalement sauvage à cette époque.
questions.question: How is the region described in the past?
options: Immense and totally wild
Small but very populated
Modern and well-developed
Dangerous and inaccessible
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette région était immense et totalement sauvage à cette époque' - This region was immense and totally wild at that time. 'Immense' means huge or vast, and 'totalement' means totally or completely.

questions.audioText: Avez-vous peur de prendre l'avion lors de vos voyages d'affaires?
questions.question: What is the person being asked about?
options: Whether they are afraid of flying during business trips
If they prefer trains for vacation travel
How often they travel for personal reasons
What their favorite airline company is
questions.explanation: The text states 'Avez-vous peur de prendre l'avion lors de vos voyages d'affaires?' - Are you afraid of taking planes during your business trips? 'Peur' means fear, and the question asks about fear of flying for work travel.

questions.audioText: C'est-à-dire que nous devons complètement repenser notre stratégie commerciale.
questions.question: What does this mean according to the speaker?
options: They need to completely rethink their business strategy
They should hire more sales representatives
They must increase their marketing budget
They need to change their office location
questions.explanation: The text states 'C'est-à-dire que nous devons complètement repenser notre stratégie commerciale' - That is to say that we must completely rethink our business strategy. 'C'est-à-dire' means 'that is to say' or 'in other words'.

questions.audioText: Peut-être qu'il pleuvra demain, je ne suis pas sûr.
questions.question: What is the speaker unsure about?
options: If it will be sunny
If it will rain tomorrow
If he will be late
If the store is open
questions.explanation: The text states 'Peut-être qu'il pleuvra demain, je ne suis pas sûr' - Maybe it will rain tomorrow, I'm not sure. The adverb 'peut-être' means perhaps/maybe, expressing uncertainty about tomorrow's weather.

questions.audioText: Cette nouvelle politique économique rend les investissements étrangers plus attractifs.
questions.question: What effect does the new economic policy have?
options: It makes foreign investments more attractive
It reduces international trade agreements
It limits domestic business growth
It increases taxation on local companies
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette nouvelle politique économique rend les investissements étrangers plus attractifs' - This new economic policy makes foreign investments more attractive. The verb 'rend' (from 'rendre') means to make or render something in a particular state.

questions.audioText: Le gouvernement tient absolument à maintenir sa position sur cette réforme controversée.
questions.question: What is the government's stance on the controversial reform?
options: It is absolutely determined to maintain its position
It is considering changing its approach
It wants to abandon the reform completely
It is seeking public opinion before deciding
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le gouvernement tient absolument à maintenir sa position sur cette réforme controversée' - The government is absolutely determined to maintain its position on this controversial reform. 'Tient à' means to be determined to or insist on something.

questions.audioText: Là-haut, dans les bureaux de direction, les dirigeants préparent une annonce importante.
questions.question: Where are the executives preparing the important announcement?
options: Up there, in the executive offices
Down in the main conference room
Outside in the courtyard
In the building's basement
questions.explanation: The text states 'Là-haut, dans les bureaux de direction, les dirigeants préparent une annonce importante' - Up there, in the executive offices, the leaders are preparing an important announcement. 'Là-haut' means 'up there' or 'upstairs', indicating a higher location.

questions.audioText: Ce rapport riche en données révèle précisément les causes de la crise financière.
questions.question: What does the data-rich report reveal?
options: Precisely the causes of the financial crisis
General trends in the global economy
Potential solutions for future problems
Historical patterns of market behavior
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ce rapport riche en données révèle précisément les causes de la crise financière' - This data-rich report precisely reveals the causes of the financial crisis. 'Riche' means rich/abundant, and 'précisément' means precisely or exactly.

questions.audioText: En 1789, le peuple français a rendu le pouvoir au parlement après la révolution.
questions.question: What did the French people do with power in 1789?
options: They returned power to parliament after the revolution
They gave power to the military leaders
They established a new monarchy
They created a federal system of government
questions.explanation: The text states 'En 1789, le peuple français a rendu le pouvoir au parlement après la révolution' - In 1789, the French people returned power to parliament after the revolution. 'Rendu' is the past participle of 'rendre' (to return/give back).

questions.audioText: Si tu perds ce manuscrit médiéval, le musée ne pourra jamais le remplacer.
questions.question: What happens if the medieval manuscript is lost?
options: The museum will never be able to replace it
The museum will order a new copy from the publisher
The museum will digitize other similar manuscripts
The museum will close the medieval exhibition
questions.explanation: The text states 'Si tu perds ce manuscrit médiéval, le musée ne pourra jamais le remplacer' - If you lose this medieval manuscript, the museum will never be able to replace it. 'Perds' is the second person singular form of 'perdre' (to lose).

questions.audioText: Les résultats du bac annoncent une réussite massive, mais ces notes ne reflètent pas le niveau réel des élèves.
questions.question: What concern is raised about the baccalauréat results?
options: The high grades don't reflect students' actual academic level
The exam has become too difficult for most students
Too few students are passing the examination
The grading system needs to be completely reformed
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les résultats du bac annoncent une réussite massive, mais ces notes ne reflètent pas le niveau réel des élèves' - The bac results announce massive success, but these grades don't reflect the students' real level. This highlights concerns about grade inflation in the French education system.

questions.audioText: Mon frère est rentré tard du bureau hier soir après une réunion importante.
questions.question: When did the brother return from the office?
options: Late last night after an important meeting
Early this morning before the meeting
During lunch break yesterday
Before the meeting started yesterday
questions.explanation: The text states 'Mon frère est rentré tard du bureau hier soir après une réunion importante' - My brother returned late from the office last night after an important meeting. 'Rentré' is the past participle of 'rentrer' (to return home).

questions.audioText: Les étudiants attendent vivement les résultats de leurs examens finaux demain.
questions.question: How are the students waiting for their exam results?
options: They are eagerly awaiting them
They are nervously avoiding them
They are calmly preparing for them
They are reluctantly expecting them
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les étudiants attendent vivement les résultats de leurs examens finaux demain' - The students are eagerly awaiting their final exam results tomorrow. 'Vivement' means eagerly, keenly, or with great enthusiasm.

questions.audioText: J'ai senti une amélioration dans l'atmosphère de l'équipe depuis le nouveau manager.
questions.question: What has the speaker noticed about the team?
options: An improvement in the team atmosphere since the new manager
A decline in team morale under new leadership
No change in team dynamics despite management changes
Increased tension between team members recently
questions.explanation: The text states 'J'ai senti une amélioration dans l'atmosphère de l'équipe depuis le nouveau manager' - I have felt/sensed an improvement in the team atmosphere since the new manager. 'Senti' is the past participle of 'sentir' (to feel/sense).

questions.audioText: Il a tenu sa promesse de réformer le système éducatif malgré les oppositions.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Il a tenu sa promesse de réformer le système éducatif malgré les oppositions.
Il a tendu sa promesse de réformer le système éducatif malgré les oppositions.
Il a tenu sa promesse de réformer le système éducatif grâce aux oppositions.
Il a tenu ses promesses de réformer le système éducatif malgré les oppositions.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a tenu sa promesse de réformer le système éducatif malgré les oppositions' - He kept his promise to reform the education system despite opposition. 'Tenu' is the past participle of 'tenir' (to hold/keep), and the distractors test similar sounds ('tendu'), preposition confusion ('grâce aux'), and number agreement ('ses promesses').

questions.audioText: Cette librairie vend uniquement des livres d'occasion en parfait état.
questions.question: Cette librairie vend ______ des livres d'occasion en parfait état.
options: uniquement
principalement
rarement
également
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette librairie vend uniquement des livres d'occasion en parfait état' - This bookstore sells exclusively second-hand books in perfect condition. 'Uniquement' means exclusively or only, emphasizing that they sell nothing but second-hand books.

questions.audioText: Ma grand-mère vivait seule dans sa maison de campagne avant de déménager en ville.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu ?
options: Ma grand-mère vivait seule dans sa maison de campagne avant de déménager en ville.
Ma grand-mère vivait seule dans sa maison de campagne avant de déménager en banlieue.
Ma grand-mère vivait seule dans son appartement de campagne avant de déménager en ville.
Ma grand-mère vit seule dans sa maison de campagne avant de déménager en ville.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Ma grand-mère vivait seule dans sa maison de campagne avant de déménager en ville' - My grandmother lived alone in her country house before moving to the city. 'Vivait' is the imperfect tense of 'vivre' (to live), indicating a past habitual state. The distractors test location ('banlieue'), dwelling type ('appartement'), and tense confusion (present 'vit').

questions.audioText: Elle trouvait que le nouveau système de transport public était beaucoup plus efficace.
questions.question: What did she think about the new public transport system?
options: She found it much more efficient
She thought it was too expensive
She believed it was poorly designed
She felt it was unnecessarily complex
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle trouvait que le nouveau système de transport public était beaucoup plus efficace' - She found that the new public transport system was much more efficient. 'Trouvait' is the imperfect tense of 'trouver' (to find/think), expressing a past opinion or judgment.

questions.audioText: Quand j'étais enfant, je sentais toujours le chlore sur ma peau après la piscine.
questions.question: What did the speaker always feel on their skin as a child?
options: Chlorine after swimming
Sunscreen at the beach
Sand from the playground
Soap from the shower
questions.explanation: The text states 'Quand j'étais enfant, je sentais toujours le chlore sur ma peau après la piscine' - When I was a child, I always felt the chlorine on my skin after the pool. 'Sentais' is the first person singular imperfect form of 'sentir' (to feel/smell).

questions.audioText: Il tenait fermement le parapluie pendant l'orage extraordinaire qui a duré trois heures.
questions.question: Il ______ fermement le parapluie pendant l'orage extraordinaire qui a duré trois heures.
options: tenait
tient
tiendrait
a tenu
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il tenait fermement le parapluie pendant l'orage extraordinaire qui a duré trois heures' - He held the umbrella firmly during the extraordinary storm that lasted three hours. 'Tenait' is the third person singular imperfect form of 'tenir' (to hold), describing a continuous action in the past.

questions.audioText: Le chat tuera sûrement les oiseaux dans le jardin si on ne fait rien.
questions.question: What will the cat definitely do to the birds in the garden?
options: Kill them if nothing is done
Chase them away peacefully
Play with them gently
Ignore them completely
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le chat tuera sûrement les oiseaux dans le jardin si on ne fait rien' - The cat will surely kill the birds in the garden if we don't do anything. 'Tuera' is the third person singular future form of 'tuer' (to kill).

questions.audioText: Elle sortira de la maison très tôt demain matin pour commencer sa routine d'exercice.
questions.question: When will she leave the house tomorrow?
options: Very early in the morning to start her exercise routine
Late in the evening after finishing work
In the afternoon for a shopping trip
Around noon for a lunch meeting
