questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle sortira de la maison très tôt demain matin pour commencer sa routine d'exercice' - She will leave the house very early tomorrow morning to start her exercise routine. 'Sortira' is the third person singular future form of 'sortir' (to go out/leave).

questions.audioText: Vous trouverez les fruits les plus frais au marché tôt le matin.
questions.question: Vous ______ les fruits les plus frais au marché tôt le matin.
options: trouverez
trouvez
trouveriez
avez trouvé
questions.explanation: The text states 'Vous trouverez les fruits les plus frais au marché tôt le matin' - You will find the freshest fruits at the market early in the morning. 'Trouverez' is the second person plural future form of 'trouver' (to find).

questions.audioText: Les enfants ont passé trop de temps devant les écrans pendant les vacances d'été.
questions.question: What did the children do too much of during summer vacation?
options: Spent time in front of screens
Played outside in the garden
Read books in the library
Visited friends and family
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les enfants ont passé trop de temps devant les écrans pendant les vacances d'été' - The children spent too much time in front of screens during summer vacation. 'Passé' is the past participle of 'passer' (to spend time), 'écrans' means screens, and 'trop' means too much.

questions.audioText: Si tu continues à cuisiner de la sorte, je te jure que je ne répondrai plus de mes actes et je t'aiderai sans hésitation. C'est une promesse sérieuse.
questions.question: What is the speaker promising to do?
options: Leave the kitchen
Call a restaurant
Help the other person
Start cooking alone
questions.explanation: The text states 'Si tu continues à cuisiner de la sorte, je te jure que je ne répondrai plus de mes actes et je t'aiderai sans hésitation' - If you continue cooking like that, I swear I won't be responsible for my actions and I'll help you without hesitation. The phrase 'je t'aiderai' means 'I will help you'.

questions.audioText: J'entrerai gratis dans ce magasin quand je verrai le signe de la réalité virtuelle.
questions.question: When will I enter this store for free?
options: When I see the virtual reality sign
When the promotional period begins next month
When I present my membership card at the entrance
When the store manager approves my special request
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'When I see the virtual reality sign'. The text states 'J'entrerai gratis dans ce magasin quand je verrai le signe de la réalité virtuelle' - I will enter this store for free when I see the virtual reality sign. 'Entrerai' is the first-person singular future of 'entrer' (to enter), 'gratis' means 'for free', and 'signe' means 'sign'.
questions.source: Strategic vocabulary development - virtual reality shopping

questions.audioText: Toutes les feuilles tombées dans mon rêve représentaient mes idées créatives perdues.
questions.question: What did all the fallen leaves in the dream represent?
options: Lost creative ideas
Forgotten childhood memories from autumn days
Missed opportunities in professional life
Unfinished artistic projects from the past
questions.explanation: The correct answer is 'Lost creative ideas'. The text states 'Toutes les feuilles tombées dans mon rêve représentaient mes idées créatives perdues' - All the fallen leaves in my dream represented my lost creative ideas. 'Tombées' is the feminine plural past participle of 'tomber' (to fall), and 'rêve' means 'dream'.

questions.audioText: Je remercie sincèrement mon professeur pour son aide précieuse durant cette période difficile.
questions.question: What is the speaker expressing?
options: Apologizing for being late to class
Thanking their teacher for valuable help
Complaining about difficult coursework
Requesting extra tutoring sessions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je remercie sincèrement mon professeur pour son aide précieuse durant cette période difficile' - I sincerely thank my teacher for their valuable help during this difficult period. The verb 'remercie' (thank) indicates gratitude, not an apology or complaint.

questions.audioText: Elle est née dans une petite ville de Provence et y a vécu toute son enfance.
questions.question: What do we learn about this person?
options: She moved to Provence as an adult
She was born and raised in Provence
She visits Provence during holidays
She dreams of living in Provence
questions.explanation: The text states 'Elle est née dans une petite ville de Provence et y a vécu toute son enfance' - She was born in a small town in Provence and lived there her whole childhood. The past participle 'née' (born) shows her place of birth, and the text confirms she spent her childhood there.

questions.audioText: L'environnement doit être protégé contre les activités industrielles dangereuses pour les générations futures.
questions.question: What should happen to the environment?
options: It should be developed for industry
It should be protected from dangerous activities
It should be studied by scientists
It should be used for recreational purposes
questions.explanation: The text states 'L'environnement doit être protégé contre les activités industrielles dangereuses pour les générations futures' - The environment must be protected against dangerous industrial activities for future generations. The past participle 'protégé' (protected) is used in the passive construction 'doit être protégé' (must be protected).

questions.audioText: Les patients souffrent beaucoup pendant cette maladie chronique qui affecte leur qualité de vie quotidienne.
questions.question: What is happening to the patients?
options: They are recovering quickly from illness
They are suffering from a chronic disease
They are receiving excellent medical care
They are participating in medical research
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les patients souffrent beaucoup pendant cette maladie chronique qui affecte leur qualité de vie quotidienne' - The patients suffer a lot during this chronic illness that affects their daily quality of life. The verb 'souffrent' (suffer) in third person plural shows their ongoing pain.

questions.audioText: Il s'est approché discrètement de la fenêtre pour observer ce qui se passait dans la rue.
questions.question: How did he move toward the window?
options: Quickly and noisily
Carefully and quietly
Hesitantly and slowly
Confidently and openly
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il s'est approché discrètement de la fenêtre pour observer ce qui se passait dans la rue' - He approached the window discreetly to observe what was happening in the street. The past participle 'approché' (approached) combined with 'discrètement' (discreetly) indicates careful, quiet movement.

questions.audioText: Autrefois, il souffrait de migraines terribles qui l'empêchaient de travailler normalement.
questions.question: What was his past condition?
options: He had severe headaches that affected his work
He was afraid of working in difficult conditions
He complained about his workplace environment
He suffered from chronic back pain
questions.explanation: The text states 'Autrefois, il souffrait de migraines terribles qui l'empêchaient de travailler normalement' - In the past, he suffered from terrible migraines that prevented him from working normally. The imperfect tense 'souffrait' (suffered) indicates this was an ongoing condition in the past.

questions.audioText: Les parents protègent leurs enfants des dangers de la rue en les accompagnant toujours à l'école.
questions.question: How do parents ensure their children's safety?
options: By teaching them self-defense techniques
By always accompanying them to school
By driving them in private vehicles
By hiring professional bodyguards
questions.explanation: The text states 'Les parents protègent leurs enfants des dangers de la rue en les accompagnant toujours à l'école' - Parents protect their children from street dangers by always accompanying them to school. The present tense 'protègent' (protect) shows ongoing parental protection through accompaniment.

questions.audioText: Le directeur nous a remercié pour notre travail exceptionnel lors de la présentation importante d'hier.
questions.question: What did the director do?
options: Criticized their presentation skills
Thanked them for exceptional work
Assigned them more difficult tasks
Promoted them to higher positions
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le directeur nous a remercié pour notre travail exceptionnel lors de la présentation importante d'hier' - The director thanked us for our exceptional work during yesterday's important presentation. The past participle 'remercié' (thanked) in the passé composé shows the director's appreciation.

questions.audioText: Je ramènerai mes documents importants demain matin pour finaliser le contrat avec nos partenaires commerciaux.
questions.question: When will the speaker bring the documents?
options: This afternoon for the meeting
Tomorrow morning to finalize the contract
Next week for the presentation
Later today for the signature
questions.explanation: The text states 'Je ramènerai mes documents importants demain matin pour finaliser le contrat avec nos partenaires commerciaux' - I will bring back my important documents tomorrow morning to finalize the contract with our business partners. The future tense 'ramènerai' (will bring back) indicates the timing and purpose.

questions.audioText: Il a agi sagement en refusant cette proposition douteuse qui aurait pu compromettre sa réputation professionnelle.
questions.question: How did he respond to the proposal?
options: He accepted it immediately without thinking
He wisely refused the questionable offer
He negotiated better terms before agreeing
He asked for more time to consider it
questions.explanation: The text states 'Il a agi sagement en refusant cette proposition douteuse qui aurait pu compromettre sa réputation professionnelle' - He acted wisely by refusing this questionable proposal that could have compromised his professional reputation. The adverb 'sagement' (wisely) modifies how he acted.

questions.audioText: Cette opération chirurgicale complexe nécessite une équipe médicale expérimentée et des équipements de pointe modernes.
questions.question: What does this surgical procedure require?
options: Simple equipment and basic training
Experienced medical team and modern equipment
Emergency protocols and backup systems
Patient consent and insurance approval
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette opération chirurgicale complexe nécessite une équipe médicale expérimentée et des équipements de pointe modernes' - This complex surgical operation requires an experienced medical team and modern cutting-edge equipment. The noun 'opération' (operation) refers to the surgical procedure.

questions.audioText: La situation grave des transports régionaux doit être résolue calmement par les autorités.
questions.question: How should the authorities resolve the regional transport situation?
options: Calmly
Quickly
Forcefully
Privately
questions.explanation: The text states 'La situation grave des transports régionaux doit être résolue calmement par les autorités' - The serious situation of regional transport must be resolved calmly by the authorities. 'Grave' means 'serious/grave' and 'calmement' means 'calmly'.

questions.audioText: L'oeil de l'enfant brille nettement quand il découvre quelque chose d'instant.
questions.question: How does the child's eye shine?
options: Clearly when discovering something momentary
Dimly when seeing familiar things
Brightly when playing with toys
Softly when feeling sleepy
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'L'oeil de l'enfant brille nettement quand il découvre quelque chose d'instant' - The child's eye shines clearly when discovering something momentary. 'Oeil' means 'eye', 'nettement' means 'clearly', 'instant' means 'momentary'.

questions.audioText: Cette sorte de chef cuisine étrangement avec des épices dans ses recettes traditionnelles.
questions.question: How does this type of chef cook?
options: Strangely with spices in traditional recipes
Carefully with fresh herbs and vegetables
Quickly with modern cooking techniques
Slowly with expensive imported ingredients
questions.explanation: The text states 'Cette sorte de chef cuisine étrangement avec des épices dans ses recettes traditionnelles' - This type of chef cooks strangely with spices in their traditional recipes. 'Sorte' means 'type/kind', 'étrangement' means 'strangely', 'épices' means 'spices'.

questions.audioText: Le chef d'équipe observe ce garçon qui apprend comment assembler les pièces rapidement.
questions.question: What does the team leader observe?
options: A boy learning how to assemble parts quickly
A worker checking the quality of finished products
A student taking notes during the demonstration
An employee cleaning the workspace thoroughly
questions.explanation: The speaker says 'Le chef d'équipe observe ce garçon qui apprend comment assembler les pièces rapidement' - The team leader observes this boy who is learning how to assemble the parts quickly. 'Chef' here means 'leader/head', 'garçon' means 'boy'.

questions.audioText: Le journaliste a annoncé la mort de l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique environnementale française.
questions.question: Qu'est-ce que vous avez entendu?
options: Le journaliste a annoncé la mort de l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique environnementale française.
Le journaliste a annoncé la mort de l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique économique française.
Le journaliste a annoncé la retraite de l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique environnementale française.
Le journaliste a critiqué l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique environnementale française.
questions.explanation: The text states 'Le journaliste a annoncé la mort de l'ancien ministre avec respect, soulignant ses contributions importantes à la politique environnementale française' - The journalist announced the death of the former minister with respect, highlighting his important contributions to French environmental policy.
